    16                                  ;Note: This code is a part of Retro DOS 4.0 kernel source code
    17                                  ;     (as included binary, 'IOSYS5.BIN') 
    18                                  ;     Equivalent of MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, BIOSCODE and BIOSDATA and SYSINIT
    19                                  ;						        (except MSLOAD code)  
    20                                        
    21                                  ;------ Retro DOS v2 (v3) boot sector loads RETRODOS.SYS (MSDOS.SYS)
    22                                  ;	at 1000h:0000h and loader (initialization) part of RETRODOS kernel
    23                                  ;	moves IO.SYS (DOSBIOSCODE & DOSBIOSDATA, 'IOSYS5.BIN') to 70h:0000h.
    24                                  ;	Then SYSINIT code to the next segment (46Dh for original MSDOS 5.0)..
    25                                  ;	SYSINIT code relocates itself and DOSBIOSCODE and MSDOS.SYS
    26                                  ;	(MSDOS5.BIN) according to request/setting in 'config.sys' file.
    27                                  
    28                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
    29                                  
    30                                  ;bpbx		struc ;	(sizeof=0x19)	
    31                                  ;
    32                                  ;bytespersec	dw ?			; base 10
    33                                  ;secperclust	db ?			; base 10
    34                                  ;rsvdsecs	dw ?			; base 10
    35                                  ;numfats	db ?			; base 10
    36                                  ;rootdirents	dw ?			; base 10
    37                                  ;totalsize16	dw ?			; base 10
    38                                  ;mediaid	db ?
    39                                  ;fatsecs	dw ?			; base 10
    40                                  ;secpertrack	dw ?			; base 10
    41                                  ;heads		dw ?			; base 10
    42                                  ;hiddensecs_lw	dw ?			; base 10
    43                                  ;hiddensecs_hw	dw ?			; base 10
    44                                  ;totalsecs_lw	dw ?			; base 10
    45                                  ;totalsecs_hw	dw ?			; base 10
    46                                  ;
    47                                  ;bpbx		ends
    48

   142                                  ;============================================================================
   143                                  ;
   144                                  ;     for dos 4.00, msload program has been changed to allow:
   145                                  ;	  1. 32 bit calculation,
   146                                  ;	  2. reading a fat sector when needed, instead of reading the whole
   147                                  ;	     fat sectors at once. this will make the boot time faster,
   148                                  ;	     and eliminate the memory size limitation problem,
   149                                  ;	  3. solving the limitation of the file size (29 kb) of io.sys0,
   150                                  ;	  4. adding the boot error message. show the same boot error message
   151                                  ;	     and do the same behavior when the read operation of io.sys
   152                                  ;	     fails as the msboot program, since msload program is the
   153                                  ;	     extention of msboot program.

   250                                  ; INPUT:     none

   252                                  ;   dl = int 13 drive number we booted from
   253                                  ;   ch = media byte
   254                                  ;   bx = first data sector (low) on disk (0-based)
   255                                  ;   ds:si = original rom bios diskette parameter table.
   256                                  ;
   257                                  ; if an extended boot record, then ax will be the first data sector
   258                                  ; high word. save ax and set FirstSectorH according to ax if it is an
   259                                  ; extended boot record.
   260                                  ;
   261                                  ;   ax = first data sector (high) on disk ;
   262                                  ; OUTPUT:
   263                                  ;
   264                                  ;   bx = first data sector on disk
   265                                  ;
   266                                  ;   MediaByte = input ch
   267                                  ;   BootDrive = input dl
   268                                  ;   FirstSectorL = input bx
   269                                  ;   FirstSectorH = input AX, if an extended boot record.;j.k.
   270                                  ;   TotalSectorsL = maximum sector number in this media ;j.k.
   271                                  ;   TotalSectorsH = high word of the above
   272                                  ;   HiddenSectorsL = hidden secotrs

   278                                  ;   ds = 0

   491                                  ; Relocate
   492                                  ; -------------------------------------------------------------------------
   493                                  ;
   494                                  ; NOTES:
   495                                  ;
   496                                  ;   Relocates the loader code to top-of-memory.
   497                                  ;
   498                                  ; INPUT:     none
   499                                  ;
   500                                  ; OUTPUT:    code and data relocated.
   501                                  ;	     AX,CX,SI,DI destroyed
   502                                  ;
   503                                  ; calls:     none
   504                                  ; -------------------------------------------------------------------------
   505                                  ;
   506                                  ; Determine the number of paragraphs (16 byte blocks) of memory.
   507                                  ; this involves invoking the memory size determination interrupt,
   508                                  ; which returns the number of 1k blocks of memory, and then
   509                                  ; converting this to the number of paragraphs.
   510                                  ; Find out whether RPL code is present at top of memory and modify the
   511                                  ; available amount of memory in AX
   512                                  ; leave the number of paragraphs of memory in ax.
   513                                  ;
   514                                  ; -------------------------------------------------------------------------
   515                                  ; copy code from start to top of memory.
   516                                  ;
   517                                  ; the length to copy is EndOfLoader
   518                                  ;
   519                                  ; jump to relocated code
   520                                  ; -------------------------------------------------------------------------
   521                                  
   522                                  		; 14/09/2023
   523                                  relocate:
   524                                  		; 24/12/2022
   525                                  		;cld
   526                                  
   527 000000C8 31F6                    		xor	si, si
   528                                  		; 14/09/2023
   529                                  		;mov	di, si
   530                                  		; di = 0
   531                                  
   532 000000CA CD12                    		int	12h		; MEMORY SIZE -
   533                                  					; Return: AX = number of contiguous 1K blocks of memory
   534 000000CC B106                    		mov	cl, 6
   535 000000CE D3E0                    		shl	ax, cl		; Memory size in paragraphs
   536                                  
   537                                  ;------ Check if an RPL program is present at TOM and do not tromp over it
   538                                  
   539                                  		; 10/12/2022
   540                                  		; ds = 0
   541                                  		; 24/12/2022
   542                                  		; ds = cs
   543                                  		;xor	bx, bx
   544                                  		;mov	ds, bx		; ZERO
   545                                  		; 14/09/2023
   546 000000D0 8EDE                    		mov	ds, si ; 0
   547                                  		
   548                                  		;mov	bx, [DskAddr+44h] ; 2Fh*4 (Int 2Fh)
   549                                  		;mov	ds, [DskAddr+46h] ; 2Fh*4+2
   550                                  		; 10/12/2022

   552 000000D6 8E1EBE00                		mov	ds, [2Fh*4+2]		
   553                                  
   554                                  		;cmp	word ptr [bx+3], 'PR'
   555                                  		; 09/12/2022

   557 000000DF 750F                    		jnz	short Skip_RPL

   559 000000E5 7509                    		jnz	short Skip_RPL

   561 000000E9 B8064A                  		mov	ax, 4A06h	; (multMULT shl	8) + multMULTRPLTOM
   562 000000EC CD2F                    		int	2Fh		; Get new TOM from any RPL
   563 000000EE 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
   564                                  Skip_RPL:
   565                                  		; 24/12/2022
   566 000000F0 0E                      		push	cs
   567 000000F1 1F                      		pop	ds	; 25/12/2022
   568

   570 000000F4 8B16[1200]              		mov	dx, [BytesPerSec] ; 24/12/2022
   571                                  		;mov	dx, [cs:BytesPerSec]
   572 000000F8 D3EA                    		shr	dx, cl
   573 000000FA 42                      		inc	dx
   574 000000FB 29D0                    		sub	ax, dx
   575 000000FD A3[3400]                		mov	[FatSegment], ax ; 24/12/2022

   577                                  		; 22/12/2022
   578                                  		;mov	dx, EndOfLoader
   579 00000100 BA[A004]                		mov	dx, EndOfLoader+256
   580                                  				; loader size + temporary/local stack space (*)
   581 00000103 D3EA                    		shr	dx, cl
   582 00000105 42                      		inc	dx
   583 00000106 29D0                    		sub	ax, dx
   584 00000108 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax	; ES:DI -> place be relocated.
   585                                  		; 22/12/2022
   586 0000010A 4A                      		dec	dx
   587 0000010B D3E2                    		shl	dx, cl	; convert paragraphs to bytes (*)	
   588                                  				; (stack pointer will be set to this offset)
   589                                  		; 24/12/2022
   590                                  		;push	cs

   599 00000117 CB                      		retf

   632                                  ; FindClusterSize
   633                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   634                                  ;
   635                                  ; INPUT:     bpb information in loaded boot record at 0:7c00h
   636                                  ;
   637                                  ; OUTPUT:
   638                                  ;
   639                                  ;	ds = 0
   640                                  ;	ax = bytes/cluster
   641                                  ;	bx = sectors/cluster
   642                                  ;	si destroyed
   643                                  ; calls:     none
   644                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
   645                                  ;
   646                                  ; get bytes/sector from bpb
   647                                  ;
   648                                  ; get sectors/cluster from bpb

   650                                  ; bytes/cluster = bytes/sector * sector/cluster

   652

   672                                  ; CalcFatSize
   673                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   674                                  ;
   675                                  ; NOTES:
   676                                  ;
   677                                  ;   Determine if fat is 12 or 16 bit fat. 12 bit fat if floppy, read mbr
   678                                  ;   to find out what system id byte is.
   679                                  ;
   680                                  ; INPUT:
   681                                  ;
   682                                  ; OUTPUT:
   683                                  ;
   684                                  ;   CS:FatSize = FAT_12_BIT or FAT_16_BIT
   685                                  ;   all other registers destroyed
   686                                  ;
   687                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   688                                  
   689                                  CalcFatSize:
   690                                  		; 14/09/2023

   693 0000012C C606[2900]01            		mov	byte [Fatsize], 1

   697 00000131 8B16[2200]              		mov	dx, [TotalSectorsH]

   699                                  ; 24/12/2202
   700                                  %if 0

   702                                  		;sub	ax, [cs:ReservSectors]

   704                                  		;mov	bx, [cs:SecPerFat]

   746 0000015F C606[2900]04            		mov	byte [Fatsize], 4 ; FAT_16_BIT
   747                                  
   748                                  ; ReadInFirstClusters
   749                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   750                                  ;
   751                                  ; NOTES: read the start of the clusters that covers at least IbmLoadSize
   752                                  ;	 fully.  for example, if sector/cluster = 2, and IbmLoadSize=3
   753                                  ;	 then we are going to re-read the second cluster to fully cover
   754                                  ;	 msload program in the cluster boundary.
   755                                  ;
   756                                  ; INPUT:
   757                                  ;   IbmLoadSize - make sure this value is the same as the one in
   758                                  ;		  msboot program when you build the new version!!!!!
   759                                  ;
   760                                  ;   SecPerCluster
   761                                  ;   ClusterSize
   762                                  ;   FirstSectorL
   763                                  ;   FirstSectorH
   764                                  ;
   765                                  ; OUTPUT: msload program is fully covered in a cluster boundary.
   766                                  ;	  ax = # of clusters we read in so far.
   767                                  ;
   768                                  ; calls:     ReadSectors
   769                                  ; logic:
   770                                  ;	ax; dx = IbmLoadSize / # of sector in a cluster.
   771                                  ;	if dx = 0 then ok. (msload is in a cluster boundary.)
   772                                  ;      else		   (has to read (ax+1)th cluster to cover msload)
   773                                  ;	read (ax+1)th cluster into the address after the clusters we
   774                                  ;	read in so far.
   775                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   776                                  
   777                                  ; 09/12/2022
   778                                  ; BiosStart equ 51Ah ; AX = IO.SYS starting cluster
   779                                  ; IbmLoadSize equ 3  ; AX = Number sectors in MSLOAD
   780                                  ; BiosOffset equ 700h ; Address where loader was read in
   781                                  	
   782                                  ReadInFirstClusters:
   783                                  		; 24/12/2022
   784                                  		;;mov	ax, [BioSStart]
   785                                  		;mov	ax, [51Ah]	; IO.SYS First Cluster
   786                                  		;dec	ax		; Root dir buffer at 500h (segment=0)
   787                                  		;			; IO.SYS first cluster ptr at 51Ah
   788                                  		;dec	ax		; AX = word [51Ah] - 2
   789                                  		;;mov	[cs:CurrentCluster], ax ;  Initialize to this cluster
   790                                  		; 24/12/2022
   791                                  		; ds = cs
   792                                  		;mov	[CurrentCluster], ax
   793                                  		; 24/12/2022
   794                                  		; [CurrentCluster] = word [51Ah] - 2
   795                                  
   796                                  		;mov	ax, IbmLoadSize
   797 00000164 B80300                  		mov	ax, 3		; Load the 3rd and other IO.SYS	sectors
   798 00000167 F6F1                    		div	cl ; *#*
   799                                  		;div	byte [SecPerCluster]
   800                                  		;;div	byte [cs:SecPerCluster]
   801                                  					; AL = total cluster read in
   802                                  					; AH = remaining sectors in last cluster
   803                                  		; 10/12/2022
   804 00000169 20E4                    		and	ah, ah
   805                                  		;cmp	ah, 0
   806 0000016B 7433                    		jz	short SetNextClusterNum	; next cluster
   807                                  
   808 0000016D 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
   809 0000016F 50                      		push	ax		; AX = total clusters in the loader
   810                                  					; already read in
   811                                  ; 24/12/2022
   812                                  %if 0		
   813                                  		mov	cx, [cs:FirstSectorL] ;	Put starting sector of disk data
   814                                  		mov	[cs:StartSecL], cx    ; area in StartSecH:StartSecL
   815                                  		mov	cx, [cs:FirstSectorH]
   816                                  		mov	[cs:StartSecH], cx
   817                                  		mul	byte [cs:SecPerCluster]
   818                                  		add	[cs:StartSecL], ax ; Add number of sectors already loaded
   819                                  		adc	word [cs:StartSecH], 0 ; to start sector
   820                                  		;mov	ax, [BiosStart]
   821                                  		mov	ax, [51Ah] ; AX = [51Ah] = IO.SYS 1st clust
   822                                  		dec	ax
   823                                  		dec	ax
   824                                  		xor	bx, bx

   826                                  		mul	bx		; DX:AX = logical start sector
   827                                  		add	[cs:StartSecL], ax
   828                                  		adc	[cs:StartSecH], dx
   829                                  					; abs start sector for next read of
   830                                  					; the rest of the last loader cluster
   831                                  		pop	ax
   832                                  		push	ax
   833                                  		mul	word [cs:ClusterSize]
   834                                  		;mov	di, BiosOffset

   836                                  		add	di, ax

   839                                  		mov	al, [cs:SecPerCluster]
   840                                  					; Read in the entire last cluster
   841                                  		mov	[cs:SectorCount], ax
   842                                  		call	ReadSectors
   843                                  		pop	ax		; AX = total clust read	by boot	loader
   844                                  		inc	ax		; AX = total clust read	in now
   845                                  SetNextClusterNum:			; ...
   846                                  		inc	ax		; AX = total clusters read in based 2
   847                                  		add	[cs:CurrentCluster], ax
   848                                  		dec	ax		; CurrentCluster = Last	cluster	read
   849                                  					; AX = number of clusters loaded
   850                                  %endif

   852                                  		; ds =cs
   853                                  		;mov	cx, [FirstSectorL] ; Put starting sector of disk data
   854                                  		;mov	[StartSecL], cx    ; area in StartSecH:StartSecL
   855                                  		;mov	cx, [cs:FirstSectorH]

   858                                  		; [StartSecH] = [FirstSectorH] ; **!**

   862

   867

   869                                  		;dec	ax

   899 0000019E 58                      		pop	ax		; AX = total clust read	by boot	loader

   901                                  SetNextClusterNum:			; ...

   903 000001A1 0106[1000]              		add	[CurrentCluster], ax

   907                                  ; SaveLoadedBios
   908                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   909                                  ;
   910                                  ; NOTES:
   911                                  ;
   912                                  ;   Determine how much of iosys was loaded in when the loader was loaded
   913                                  ;   by the boot record (only the portion that is guaranteed to be contiguous)
   914                                  ;
   915                                  ; INPUT:
   916                                  ;   AX:Total cluster already read in (loader & bios)
   917                                  ;   CS:CurrentCluster = number of clusters used for loader+2
   918                                  ;
   919                                  ; OUTPUT:
   920                                  ;	ES = 70h
   921                                  ;	DI = next offset to load iosys code
   922                                  ;	AX,BX,CX,DX,SI destroyed
   923                                  ;
   924                                  ;	CS:NextBioLocation = di on output
   925                                  ;	CS:last_cluster = last cluster loaded
   926                                  ;
   927                                  ; calls:     none
   928                                  ;
   929                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   930                                  ;
   931                                  ; Multiply cluster * cluster size in bytes to get total loaded for msload
   932                                  ;
   933                                  ; Subtract total_loaded - (EndOfLoader) to get loaded io.sys in last cluster
   934                                  ;
   935                                  ; Relocate this piece of iosys down to 70:0
   936                                  ;
   937                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   938                                  
   939                                  SaveLoadedBios:
   940 000001A6 1E                      		push	ds
   941                                  		; 24/12/2022
   942                                  		; ds = cs
   943                                  		; ax = number of loaded clusters
   944 000001A7 F726[0400]              		mul	word [ClusterSize]
   945                                  		;mul	word [cs:ClusterSize]
   946                                  					; Get total bytes loaded by
   947                                  					; this is always < 64k, so
   948                                  					; lower 16 bits ok
   949                                  
   950 000001AB 2D[A003]                		sub	ax, EndOfLoader ; (OFFSET EndOfLoader)-(OFFSET Start)
   951 000001AE 89C1                    		mov	cx, ax
   952 000001B0 B87000                  		mov	ax, 70h		; Segment at 70h
   953 000001B3 8ED8                    		mov	ds, ax

   965                                  ; GetContigClusters
   966                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   967                                  ;
   968                                  ; NOTES: go find clusters as long as they are contiguous
   969                                  ;
   970                                  ;
   971                                  ; INPUT:
   972                                  ;   CS:NextBioLocation
   973                                  ;   CS:
   974                                  ;
   975                                  ; OUTPUT:
   976                                  ;
   977                                  ; calls: GetNextFatEntry
   978                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   979                                  ;
   980                                  ;Set CS:SectorCount to sectors per cluster
   981                                  ;
   982                                  ;Call GetNextFatEntry to get next cluster in file
   983                                  ;
   984                                  ;Call check_for_eof
   985                                  ;

   987                                  ;
   988                                  ;   {call GetNextFatEntry
   989                                  ;
   990                                  ;    if (new cluster is contig to old cluster)
   991                                  ;	{add sectors per cluster to CS:SectorCount
   992                                  ;
   993                                  ;	 call check_for_eof
   994                                  ;
   995                                  ;	 if (nc returned)
   996                                  ;
   997                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   998                                  
   999                                  ; 09/12/2022
  1000                                  ; END_OF_FILE equ 0FFh
  1001                                  ; DosLoadSeg equ 70h

  1003                                  GetContigClusters:
  1004                                  
  1005                                  ; 24/12/2022
  1006                                  %if 0	
  1007                                  		xor	ah, ah
  1008                                  		mov	al, [cs:SecPerCluster]	; Assume we will get one cluster
  1009                                  		mov	[cs:SectorCount], ax	; Sector count = sectors in 1 cluster
  1010                                  		push	word [cs:SectorCount]
  1011                                  		call	GetNextFatEntry		; Returns next cluster to read in AX	
  1012                                  		pop	word [cs:SectorCount]
  1013                                  		mov	word [cs:CurrentCluster], ax ; Update the last one found
  1014                                  		cmp	byte [cs:EndOfFile], 0FFh ; END_OF_FILE
  1015                                  		jz	short GoToBioInit
  1016                                  		xor	dx, dx
  1017                                  		;sub	ax, 2			; Zero base the cluster
  1018                                  		; 10/12/2022
  1019                                  		dec	ax
  1020                                  		dec	ax
  1021                                  		xor	ch, ch
  1022                                  		mov	cl, [cs:SecPerCluster]
  1023                                  		mul	cx			; How many sectors (before next cluster) 
  1024                                  		add	ax, [cs:FirstSectorL]	; See where the data sector starts
  1025                                  		adc	dx, [cs:FirstSectorH]
  1026                                  		mov	[cs:StartSecL], ax	; Save it (used by ReadSectors)
  1027                                  		mov	[cs:StartSecH], dx
  1028                                  		mov	di, [cs:NextBioLocation] ; Get where to put code
  1029                                  		push	word [cs:SectorCount]	; Save how many sectors
  1030                                  		;mov	ax, DosLoadSeg
  1031                                  		mov	ax, 70h
  1032                                  		mov	es, ax
  1033                                  		call	ReadSectors
  1034                                  		pop	ax			; Get back total sectors read in
  1035                                  		mul	word [cs:BytesPerSec]	; Get number of bytes we loaded
  1036                                  		add	[cs:NextBioLocation], ax ; Point to where to load next	
  1037                                  		jmp	short GetContigClusters
  1038                                  
  1039                                  %endif
  1040                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1041                                  		; ds = cs
  1042                                  
  1043 000001BF A1[1400]                		mov	ax, [SecPerCluster]	; Assume we will get one cluster
  1044 000001C2 A3[0E00]                		mov	[SectorCount], ax	; Sector count = sectors in 1 cluster
  1045                                  		;push	word [SectorCount]
  1046 000001C5 50                      		push	ax
  1047 000001C6 E8B900                  		call	GetNextFatEntry		; Returns next cluster to read in AX

  1078                                  ; GoToBiosInit
  1079                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1080                                  ;
  1081                                  ; NOTES:
  1082                                  ;
  1083                                  ;  Set up required registers for iosys, then jump to it (70:0)
  1084                                  ;
  1085                                  ; INPUT:     none
  1086                                  ;

  1088                                  ;   CS:BootDrive = int 13 drive number we booted from
  1089                                  ;   CS:FirstSectorL = first data sector on disk (low) (0-based)
  1090                                  ;   CS:FirstSectorH = first data sector on disk (high)
  1091                                  ;

  1093                                  ;
  1094                                  ;   required by msinit

  1097                                  ;   BX = first data sector on disk (0-based)
  1098                                  ;   AX = first data sector on disk (high)
  1099                                  ;   DI = sectors/fat for the boot media.
  1100                                  ;

  1104                                  ; set up registers for msinit then do far jmp

  1109                                  		; 24/12/2022

  1118 000001F9 8B1E[2400]              		mov	bx, [FirstSectorL] ; AX:BX = first data sector of disk
  1119 000001FD A1[2600]                		mov	ax, [FirstSectorH]
  1120

  1122                                  
  1123                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  1124                                  
  1125                                  ; ReadSectors
  1126                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1127                                  ; notES:
  1128                                  ;
  1129                                  ;  read in the CS:SectorCount number of sectors at ES:di
  1130                                  ;
  1131                                  ;
  1132                                  ; INPUT:
  1133                                  ;
  1134                                  ;   DI = OFFSET of start of read
  1135                                  ;   ES = segment of read
  1136                                  ;   CS:SectorCount = number of sectors to read
  1137                                  ;   CS:StartSecL = starting sector (low)
  1138                                  ;   CS:StartSecH = starting sector (high)
  1139                                  ;   following is bpb info that must be setup prior to call
  1140                                  ;   CS:NumHeads
  1141                                  ;   CS:number_of_sectors
  1142                                  ;   CS:BootDrive
  1143                                  ;   CS:SecPerTrack
  1144                                  ;
  1145                                  ; OUTPUT:
  1146                                  ;
  1147                                  ;   AX,BX,CX,DX,SI,DI destroyed
  1148                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1149                                  ; divide start sector by sectors per track
  1150                                  ; the remainder is the actual sector number, 0 based
  1151                                  ;
  1152                                  ; increment actual sector number to get 1 based
  1153                                  ;
  1154                                  ; the quotient is the number of tracks - divide by heads to get the cyl
  1155                                  ;
  1156                                  ; the remainder is actual head, the quotient is cylinder
  1157                                  ;
  1158                                  ; figure the number of sectors in that track, set al to this
  1159                                  ;
  1160                                  ; do the read
  1161                                  ;
  1162                                  ; if error, do reset, then redo the int 13h
  1163                                  ;
  1164                                  ; if successful read, subtract # sectors read from SectorCount, add to logical
  1165                                  ; sector, add #sectors read * BytesPerSec to bx;
  1166                                  ;
  1167                                  ; if SectorCount <> 0 do next read
  1168                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1169                                  
  1170                                  ReadSectors:
  1171                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1172                                  		; 22/12/2022
  1173                                  ReadSectors:

  1230                                  		;;cmp	byte [cs:BootDrive], 80h

  1232                                  dma_boundary_chk:
  1233                                  		cmp	si, 1
  1234                                  		jna	short dma_boundary_ok 
  1235                                  				; 1 sector read will not cause a boundary error			
  1236                                  		push	dx

  1246                                  		pop	ax
  1247                                  		pop	dx

  1389                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  1390                                  
  1391                                  ; GetNextFatEntry
  1392                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1393                                  ;
  1394                                  ; NOTES:
  1395                                  ;
  1396                                  ;   given the last cluster found, this will return the next cluster of
  1397                                  ;   iosys. if the last cluster is (f)ff8 - (f)fff, then the final cluster
  1398                                  ;   of iosys has been loaded, and control is passed to goto_iosys
  1399                                  ;   msload can handle maximum fat area size of 128 kb.
  1400                                  ;
  1401                                  ; INPUT:
  1402                                  ;
  1403                                  ;    CS:CurrentCluster
  1404                                  ;    CS:FatSize
  1405                                  ;
  1406                                  ; OUTPUT:
  1407                                  ;
  1408                                  ;   CS:CurrentCluster (updated)
  1409                                  ;
  1410                                  ; calls:  GetFatSector
  1411                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1412                                  ; get CurrentCluster
  1413                                  ;
  1414                                  ; if (16 bit fat)
  1415                                  ;    {if (CurrentCluster = fff8 - ffff)
  1416                                  ;	 {jmp goto_iosys}
  1417                                  ;     else
  1418                                  ;	{get OFFSET by multiply cluster by 2}
  1419                                  ;
  1420                                  ; else
  1421                                  ;    {if (CurrentCluster = ff8 - fff)
  1422                                  ;	 {jmp goto_iosys}
  1423                                  ;     else
  1424                                  ;	{get OFFSET by	- multiply cluster by 3
  1425                                  ;
  1426                                  ;	 rotate right to divide by 2
  1427                                  ;
  1428                                  ;	 if (cy set - means odd number)
  1429                                  ;	    {shr 4 times to keep high twelve bits}
  1430                                  ;
  1431                                  ;	 else
  1432                                  ;	    {and with 0fffh to keep low 12 bits}
  1433                                  ;	}
  1434                                  ;    }
  1435                                  ;
  1436                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1437                                  
  1438                                  ; 09/12/2022
  1439                                  ; FAT_12_BIT equ 1
  1440                                  ; NOT_END_OF_FILE equ 0  ; ~END_OF_FILE ; END_OF_FILE equ 0FFh
  1441                                  
  1442                                  GetNextFatEntry:
  1443 00000282 06                      		push	es
  1444                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1445                                  		; ds = cs
  1446                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:FatSegment]
  1447 00000283 A1[3400]                		mov	ax, [FatSegment]
  1448 00000286 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax		; ES-> FAT area segment
  1449                                  		; 09/12/2022
  1450                                  		;;mov	byte [cs:EndOfFile], END_OF_FILE
  1451                                  		;mov	byte [cs:EndOfFile], 0FFh ; Assume last cluster
  1452                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:CurrentCluster] ; Get last cluster
  1453                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1454                                  		; ds = cs
  1455 00000288 C606[2B00]FF            		mov	byte [EndOfFile], 0FFh ; Assume last cluster
  1456 0000028D A1[1000]                		mov	ax, [CurrentCluster] ; Get last cluster
  1457 00000290 803E[2900]01            		cmp	byte [Fatsize], 1
  1458                                  		;;cmp	byte [cs:FatSize], FAT_12_BIT
  1459                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:Fatsize], 1
  1460 00000295 7537                    		jne	short Got16Bit	; 23/12/2022
  1461 00000297 89C6                    		mov	si, ax
  1462 00000299 D1E8                    		shr	ax, 1
  1463 0000029B 01C6                    		add	si, ax		; SI = AX * 1.5 = AX + AX/2
  1464                                  		; 23/12/2022
  1465                                  		;push	dx
  1466                                  		;xor	dx, dx
  1467 0000029D 29D2                    		sub	dx, dx ; 23/12/2022
  1468 0000029F E84700                  		call	GetFatSector
  1469                                  		; 23/12/2022
  1470                                  		;pop	dx
  1471 000002A2 7510                    		jnz	short ClusterOk
  1472 000002A4 268A07                  		mov	al, [es:bx]
  1473                                  		; 22/12/2022
  1474                                  		;mov	[cs:TempCluster], al
  1475                                  		;push	ax ; (*)
  1476 000002A7 46                      		inc	si
  1477                                  		; 23/12/2022
  1478                                  		;push	dx
  1479 000002A8 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  1480 000002AA E83C00                  		call	GetFatSector	; Read next fat sector
  1481                                  		; 23/12/2022
  1482                                  		;pop	dx
  1483                                  		; 22/12/2022
  1484                                  		;mov	al, [es:0]
  1485                                  		;mov	[cs:TempCluster+1], al
  1486                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:TempCluster]
  1487                                  		; 22/12/2022
  1488                                  		;pop	ax ; (*) 
  1489 000002AD 268A260000              		mov	ah, [es:0]
  1490 000002B2 EB03                    		jmp	short EvenOdd
  1491                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1492                                  
  1493                                  ClusterOk:				
  1494 000002B4 268B07                  		mov	ax, [es:bx]
  1495                                  EvenOdd:	
  1496                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1497                                  		; ds = cs
  1498 000002B7 F606[1000]01            		test	byte [CurrentCluster], 1
  1499                                  		; 10/12/2022		
  1500                                  		;test	byte [cs:CurrentCluster], 1 ; 09/12/2022
  1501                                  		;;test	word [cs:CurrentCluster], 1 ; Was last cluster odd?
  1502 000002BC 7505                    		jnz	short OddResult		; If not zero it was odd
  1503 000002BE 25FF0F                  		and	ax, 0FFFh		; Keep low 12 bits
  1504 000002C1 EB04                    		jmp	short TestEOF
  1505                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1506                                  
  1507                                  OddResult:				
  1508 000002C3 B104                    		mov	cl, 4			; Keep high 12 bits for odd
  1509 000002C5 D3E8                    		shr	ax, cl
  1510                                  TestEOF:				
  1511 000002C7 3DF80F                  		cmp	ax, 0FF8h		; Is it last cluster?
  1512 000002CA 731B                    		jnb	short GotClusterDone	; Yep, all done here
  1513 000002CC EB14                    		jmp	short NotLastCluster
  1514                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1515                                  
  1516                                  Got16Bit:
  1517                                  		; 23/12/2022				
  1518                                  		;push	dx
  1519                                  		;xor	dx, dx
  1520 000002CE 29D2                    		sub	dx, dx ; 23/12/2022
  1521 000002D0 D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1			; Multiply cluster by 2
  1522 000002D2 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  1523 000002D5 89C6                    		mov	si, ax			; Get the final buffer OFFSET
  1524 000002D7 E80F00                  		call	GetFatSector
  1525                                  		; 23/12/2022
  1526                                  		;pop	dx
  1527 000002DA 268B07                  		mov	ax, [es:bx]
  1528 000002DD 83F8F8                  		cmp	ax, 0FFF8h
  1529 000002E0 7305                    		jnb	short GotClusterDone
  1530                                  NotLastCluster:	
  1531                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1532                                  		; ds = cs			
  1533                                  		;;mov	byte [cs:EndOfFile], NOT_END_OF_FILE ; ~END_OF_FILE
  1534                                  		;mov	byte [cs:EndOfFile], 0	; Assume not last cluster
  1535 000002E2 C606[2B00]00            		mov	byte [EndOfFile], 0	; Assume not last cluster
  1536                                  GotClusterDone:				
  1537 000002E7 07                      		pop	es
  1538                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1539                                  EndRead:
  1540 000002E8 C3                      		retn
  1541                                  
  1542                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  1543                                  
  1544                                  ; GetFatSector
  1545                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1546                                  ;function: find and read the corresponding fat sector into ES:0
  1547                                  ;
  1548                                  ;in). SI = offset value (starting from fat entry 0) of fat entry to find.
  1549                                  ;     ES = fat sector segment
  1550                                  ;     CS:BytesPerSec
  1551                                  ;
  1552                                  ;out). corresponding fat sector read in.
  1553                                  ;      BX = offset value of the corresponding fat entry in the fat sector.
  1554                                  ;      CX destroyed.
  1555                                  ;      zero flag set if the fat entry is splitted, i.e. when 12 bit fat entry
  1556                                  ;      starts at the last byte of the fat sector. in this case, the caller
  1557                                  ;      should save this byte, and read the next fat sector to get the rest
  1558                                  ;      of the fat entry value. (this will only happen with the 12 bit fat).
  1559                                  ;
  1560                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1561                                  
  1562                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1563                                  		; 22/12/2022
  1564                                  GetFatSector:
  1565 000002E9 50                      		push	ax
  1566 000002EA 56                      		push	si
  1567 000002EB 57                      		push	di
  1568 000002EC 89F0                    		mov	ax, si
  1569                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1570                                  		; ds = cs
  1571                                  		;mov	cx, [cs:BytesPerSec]
  1572                                  		;div	cx			; AX = Sector number, DX = Offset
  1573 000002EE F736[1200]              		div	word [BytesPerSec]
  1574 000002F2 3B06[0C00]              		cmp	ax, [LastFatSector]
  1575                                  		;cmp	ax, [cs:LastFatSector]	; The same fat sector?
  1576 000002F6 7421                    		je	short SplitChk		; Don't need to read it again.
  1577 000002F8 A3[0C00]                		mov	[LastFatSector], ax
  1578                                  		;mov	[cs:LastFatSector], ax
  1579 000002FB 52                      		push	dx
  1580                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1581 000002FC 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  1582                                  		;add	ax, [cs:HiddenSectorsL]
  1583                                  		;adc	dx, [cs:HiddenSectorsH]
  1584                                  		;add	ax, [cs:ReservSectors]
  1585                                  		;adc	dx, 0
  1586                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1587                                  		; ds = cs
  1588 000002FE 0306[3000]              		add	ax, [FatStartSecL]
  1589 00000302 1316[3200]              		adc	dx, [FatStartSecH]
  1590 00000306 A3[0600]                		mov	[StartSecL], ax
  1591 00000309 8916[0800]              		mov	[StartSecH], dx		; Set up for ReadSectors
  1592                                  		;mov	[cs:StartSecL], ax
  1593                                  		;mov	[cs:StartSecH], dx	; Set up for ReadSectors
  1594                                  		
  1595 0000030D C706[0E00]0100          		mov	word [SectorCount], 1 ; 1 sector			
  1596                                  		;mov	word [cs:SectorCount], 1 ; 1 sector
  1597 00000313 31FF                    		xor	di, di ; 0
  1598                                  		; es:di = FATSEGMENT:0000h
  1599 00000315 E8EDFE                  		call	ReadSectors
  1600 00000318 5A                      		pop	dx
  1601                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1602                                  		;mov	cx, [cs:BytesPerSec]
  1603                                  SplitChk:
  1604                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1605 00000319 8B0E[1200]              		mov	cx, [BytesPerSec]				
  1606 0000031D 49                      		dec	cx			; CX = SECTOR SIZE - 1
  1607 0000031E 39CA                    		cmp	dx, cx			; If last byte of sector, splitted entry.
  1608 00000320 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx			; set bx to dx
  1609 00000322 5F                      		pop	di
  1610 00000323 5E                      		pop	si
  1611 00000324 58                      		pop	ax
  1612                                  EndWrite:		; 10/12/2022
  1613 00000325 C3                      		retn
  1614                                  
  1615                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1616                                  
  1617                                  ErrorOut:
  1618                                  		; 24/12/2022
  1619                                  		; ds = cs
  1620                                  		;push	cs
  1621                                  		;pop	ds
  1622                                  		
  1623 00000326 BE[4D03]                		mov	si, NonSystemDiskMsg ; "\r\nNon-System disk or disk error\r\nRe"...
  1624 00000329 E81400                  		call	WriteTTY
  1625                                  
  1626                                  		; Wait for a keypress on the keyboard.
  1627                                  		; Use the bios keyboard interrupt.
  1628                                  
  1629 0000032C 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
  1630 0000032E CD16                    		int	16h		; KEYBOARD - READ CHAR FROM BUFFER, WAIT IF EMPTY
  1631                                  					; Return: AH = scan code, AL = character
  1632                                  
  1633                                  		; We have to restore the address of the original rom disk
  1634                                  		; parameter table to the location at [0:DskAddr]. The address
  1635                                  		; of this original table has been saved previously in
  1636                                  		; 0:OrgDasdPtr and 0:OrgDasdPtr+2. After this table address
  1637                                  		; has been restored we can reboot by invoking the bootstrap
  1638                                  		; loader bios interrupt.
  1639                                  
  1640                                  		; 23/12/2022
  1641                                  		;xor	bx, bx
  1642                                  		;mov	ds, bx
  1643                                  		;les	bx, [OrgDasdPtr] ; Wrong DS segment !
  1644                                  					 ; (Erdogan Tan, 23/12/2022)
  1645 00000330 C41E[2C00]              		les	bx, [OrgDasdPtr] ; Correct DS segment = CS
  1646                                  		
  1647                                  		; 23/12/2022
  1648 00000334 16                      		push	ss ; 0
  1649 00000335 1F                      		pop	ds
  1650                                  		; ds = 0		
  1651                                  
  1652 00000336 BE7800                  		mov	si, DskAddr	; (Int 1Eh)
  1653 00000339 891C                    		mov	[si], bx	; restore offset		
  1654 0000033B 8C4402                  		mov	[si+2], es	; restore segment
  1655 0000033E CD19                    		int	19h		; reboot
  1656                                  
  1657                                  
  1658                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  1659                                  
  1660                                  ; WriteTTY
  1661                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1662                                  ; in) DS:si -> asciiz string.
  1663                                  ;
  1664                                  ; WriteTTY the character in al to the screen.
  1665                                  ; use video service 'write teletype to active page' (ROM_TTY)
  1666                                  ; use normal character attribute
  1667                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1668                                  
  1669                                  WriteTTY:
  1670 00000340 AC                      		lodsb
  1671 00000341 08C0                    		or	al, al
  1672 00000343 74E0                    		jz	short EndWrite
  1673                                  		;mov	AH, ROM_TTY	; 09/12/2022
  1674 00000345 B40E                    		mov	ah, 0Eh
  1675 00000347 B307                    		mov	bl, 7		; "normal" attribute
  1676 00000349 CD10                    		int	10h		; - VIDEO - WRITE CHARACTER AND	ADVANCE	CURSOR (TTY WRITE)
  1677                                  					; AL = character, BH = display page (alpha modes)
  1678                                  					; BL = foreground color	(graphics modes)
  1679 0000034B EBF3                    		jmp	short WriteTTY
  1680                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1681                                  
  1682                                  ; 10/12/2022	
  1683                                  ;EndWrite:
  1684                                  ;		retn
  1685

  1736                                  ; This is a byte used for special key handling in the resident
  1737                                  ; console device driver. It must be here so that it can be included

  1886 00000119 [4E03]                  start_bds:	dw bds1			; Start	of linked list of BDS's
  1887 0000011B 7000                    		dw 70h			; KERNEL_SEGMENT
  1888                                  
  1889                                  ; (MSDOS 3.3) NOTE:
  1890                                  ; Some floppy drives do not have changeline support. The result is a
  1891                                  ; large amount of inefficiency in the code. A media-check always returns
  1892                                  ; "I don`t know". This cause DOS to reread the FAT on every access and
  1893                                  ; always discard any cached data.
  1894                                  ;    We get around this inefficiency by implementing a "Logical Door Latch".
  1895                                  ; The following three items are used to do this. The logical door latch is
  1896                                  ; based on the premise that it is not physically possible to change floppy
  1897                                  ; disks in a drive in under two seconds (most people take about 10). The
  1898                                  ; logical door latch is implemented by saving the time of the last successful
  1899                                  ; disk operation (in the value TIM_DRV). When a new request is made the
  1900                                  ; current time is compared to the saved time. If less than two seconds have
  1901                                  ; passed then the value "No Change" is returned. If more than two seconds
  1902                                  ; have passed the value "Don't Know" is returned.
  1903                                  ;    There is one complecation to this algorithm. Some programs change the
  1904                                  ; value of the timer. In this unfortunate case we have an invalid timer.
  1905                                  ; This possibility is detected by counting the number of disk operations
  1906                                  ; which occur without any time passing. If this count exceeds the value of
  1907                                  ; "AccessMax" we assume the counter is invalid and always return "Don't
  1908                                  ; Know". The variable "AccessCount" is used to keep track of the number
  1909                                  ; of disk operation which occur without the time changing.
  1910                                  
  1911 0000011D 00                      accesscount:	db 0			
  1912 0000011E FF                      tim_drv:	db 0FFh			
  1913 0000011F 00                      medbyt:		db 0
  1914                                  wrtverify:	; 15/10/2022			
  1915 00000120 02                      rflag:		db 2			; 2 for	read, 3	for write
  1916 00000121 00                      verify:		db 0			; 1 if verify after write
  1917 00000122 0000                    seccnt:		dw 0			
  1918 00000124 00                      		db 0			; -- pad where hardnum was
  1919 00000125 01                      dsktnum:	db 1			; number of diskette drives			
  1920                                  
  1921                                  ; (MSDOS 3.3) NOTE:
  1922                                  ; Some of the older versions of the IBM rom-bios always assumed a seek would
  1923                                  ; have to be made to read the diskette. Consequently a large head settle
  1924                                  ; time was always used in the I/O operations. To get around this problem
  1925                                  ; we need to continually adjust the head settle time. The following
  1926                                  ; algorithm is used:
  1927                                  ;
  1928                                  ;   Get the current head settle value.
  1929                                  ;   If it is 1, then
  1930                                  ;	set slow = 15
  1931                                  ;   else
  1932                                  ;	set slow = value
  1933                                  ;   ...
  1934                                  ;   if we are seeking and writing then
  1935                                  ;	use slow
  1936                                  ;   else
  1937                                  ;	use fast
  1938                                  ;   ...
  1939                                  ;   restore current head settle value
  1940                                  
  1941 00000126 00                      motorstartup:	db 0			; value from table
  1942 00000127 00                      settlecurrent:	db 0			; value	from table
  1943 00000128 00                      settleslow:	db 0			; slow settle value
  1944 00000129 00                      nextspeed:	db 0			; value	of speed to be used
  1945 0000012A 00                      save_head_sttl:	db 0			; used by read_sector routine
  1946 0000012B 00                      save_eot:	db 0			; saved	eot from the default DPT
  1947 0000012C 09                      eot:		db 9			
  1948 0000012D 00000000                dpt:		dd 0			; pointer to Disk Parameter Table			
  1949 00000131 00                      cursec:		db 0			; current sector
  1950 00000132 00                      curhd:		db 0			; current head
  1951 00000133 0000                    curtrk:		dw 0			; current track
  1952 00000135 0000                    spsav:		dw 0			; save the stack pointer
  1953 00000137 08                      formt_eot:	db 8			; eot used for format
  1954 00000138 00                      hdnum:		db 0			; head number
  1955 00000139 0000                    trknum:		dw 0			; track	being manipulated
  1956 0000013B 50                      gap_patch:	db 50h			; format gap patched into dpt
  1957

  1994                                  ; is made to enforce this in the bigger picture, this one small sacrifice

  2366                                  ;************************************************************************
  2367                                  ;*									*
  2368                                  ;*	strategy - store es:bx (device driver request packet)		*
  2369                                  ;*		     away at [ptrsav] for next driver function call	*
  2370                                  ;*									*
  2371                                  ;************************************************************************
  2372                                  
  2373                                  strategy:	; proc far		
  2374 000006F5 2E891E[1200]            		mov	[cs:ptrsav], bx ; store es:bx (device driver request packet)
  2375                                  					; away at [ptrsav] for next driver function call
  2376 000006FA 2E8C06[1400]            		mov	[cs:ptrsav+2], es
  2377 000006FF CB                      		retf

  2380                                  
  2381                                  ;************************************************************************
  2382                                  ;*									*
  2383                                  ;*	device driver entry points. these are the initial		*
  2384                                  ;*	  'interrupt' hooks out of the device driver chain.		*
  2385                                  ;*	  in the case of our resident drivers, they'll just		*
  2386                                  ;*	  stick a fake return address on the stack which		*
  2387                                  ;*	  points to dispatch tables and possibly some unit		*
  2388                                  ;*	  numbers, and then call through a common entry point		*
  2389                                  ;*	  which can take care of a20 switching				*
  2390                                  ;*									*
  2391                                  ;************************************************************************
  2392                                  
  2393                                  ; 01/10/2022 - Erdogan Tan
  2394                                  ; (disassembled MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS code here with fixed table
  2395                                  ;  addresses, they will be changed to table labels later)
  2396                                  
  2397                                  ; 09/12/2022
  2398                                  
  2399                                  con_entry:				
  2400 00000700 E84000                  		call	cdev_entry
  2401                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2402                                  		;dw 0E4h		; con_table
  2403 00000703 [E300]                  		dw con_table	
  2404                                  					; 2C7h:0E4h = 70h:2654h
  2405                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2406

  2413 0000070A 0000                    		db 0, 0

  2422 00000711 0001                    		db 0, 1

  2431 00000718 0102                    		db 1, 2

  2500                                  
  2501                                  ;************************************************************************
  2502                                  ;*									*
  2503                                  ;*	Ensure A20 is enabled before jumping into code in HMA.		*
  2504                                  ;*	This code assumes that if Segment of Device request packet is	*
  2505                                  ;*	DOS DATA segment then the Device request came from DOS & that	*
  2506                                  ;*	A20 is already on.						*
  2507                                  ;*									*
  2508                                  ;************************************************************************
  2509                                  
  2510                                  cdev_entry:	; proc near		
  2511 00000743 2E803E[0D00]00          		cmp	byte [cs:inHMA], 0
  2512 00000749 740D                    		jz	short ce_enter_codeseg
  2513                                  				; optimized for DOS in HMA
  2514 0000074B 50                      		push	ax
  2515 0000074C 2EA1[0300]              		mov	ax, [cs:DosDataSg]
  2516 00000750 2E3906[1400]            		cmp	[cs:ptrsav+2], ax
  2517 00000755 58                      		pop	ax
  2518 00000756 7505                    		jnz	short not_from_dos
  2519                                  				; jump is coded this way to fall thru
  2520                                  				; in 99.99% of the cases
  2521                                  ce_enter_codeseg:
  2522 00000758 2EFF2E[DE06]            		jmp	far [cs:cdev]			
  2523                                  		;jmp	dword ptr cs:cdev
  2524                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2525                                  
  2526                                  not_from_dos:				
  2527 0000075D E86200                  		call	EnsureA20On
  2528 00000760 EBF6                    		jmp	short ce_enter_codeseg
  2529                                  
  2530                                  ;************************************************************************
  2531                                  ;*									*
  2532                                  ;*	outchr - this is our int 29h handler. it writes the		*
  2533                                  ;*	   character in al on the display using int 10h ttywrite	*
  2534                                  ;*									*
  2535                                  ;************************************************************************
  2536                                  
  2537                                  outchr:					
  2538 00000762 50                      		push	ax		; int 29h handler
  2539 00000763 56                      		push	si
  2540 00000764 57                      		push	di
  2541 00000765 55                      		push	bp
  2542 00000766 53                      		push	bx
  2543 00000767 B40E                    		mov	ah, 0Eh
  2544 00000769 BB0700                  		mov	bx, 7
  2545 0000076C CD10                    		int	10h		; - VIDEO - WRITE CHARACTER AND	ADVANCE	CURSOR (TTY WRITE)
  2546                                  					; AL = character, BH = display page (alpha modes)
  2547                                  					; BL = foreground color	(graphics modes)
  2548 0000076E 5B                      		pop	bx
  2549 0000076F 5D                      		pop	bp
  2550 00000770 5F                      		pop	di
  2551 00000771 5E                      		pop	si
  2552 00000772 58                      		pop	ax
  2553 00000773 CF                      		iret
  2554                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2555                                  
  2556                                  ;************************************************************************
  2557                                  ;*									*
  2558                                  ;*	block13 - our int13 hooker					*
  2559                                  ;*									*
  2560                                  ;************************************************************************
  2561                                  
  2562                                  block13:				
  2563 00000774 2E803E[0D00]00          		cmp	byte [cs:inHMA], 0
  2564 0000077A 7408                    		jz	short skipa20
  2565 0000077C E85400                  		call	IsA20Off	; A20 Off?
  2566 0000077F 7503                    		jnz	short skipa20
  2567 00000781 E84300                  		call	EnableA20	; assure a20 enabled
  2568                                  
  2569                                  skipa20:				
  2570 00000784 2E8C1E[1C00]            		mov	[cs:i13_ds], ds	; save caller's ds for call-through
  2571 00000789 9C                      		pushf			; fake interrupt
  2572 0000078A 2EFF1E[EA06]            		call	far [cs:i13x]
  2573                                  		;call	dword ptr cs:i13x
  2574                                  					; call through Bios_Code entry table
  2575 0000078F 2E8E1E[1C00]            		mov	ds, [cs:i13_ds]
  2576 00000794 CA0200                  		retf	2
  2577                                  
  2578                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  2579                                  
  2580                                  ; the int13 hook calls back here to call-through to the ROM
  2581                                  ; this is necessary because some people have extended their
  2582                                  ; ROM BIOSs to use ds as a parameter/result register and
  2583                                  ; our int13 hook relies heavily on ds to access Bios_Data
  2584                                  
  2585                                  call_orig13:	; proc far		
  2586 00000797 8E1E[1C00]              		mov	ds, [i13_ds]	; get caller's ds register
  2587 0000079B 9C                      		pushf			; simulate an int13
  2588 0000079C 2EFF1E[B400]            		call	far [cs:Orig13]
  2589                                  		;call	cs:Orig13
  2590 000007A1 2E8C1E[1C00]            		mov	[cs:i13_ds], ds
  2591 000007A6 0E                      		push	cs
  2592 000007A7 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore ds ->	Bios_Data before return
  2593                                  
  2594 000007A8 9C                      		pushf
  2595                                  		; 10/12/2022
  2596                                  		; ds = cs
  2597 000007A9 803E[0D00]00            		cmp	byte [inHMA], 0	; 16/10/2022
  2598                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:inHMA], 0
  2599 000007AE 7408                    		jz	short corig13_popf_retf
  2600 000007B0 E82000                  		call	IsA20Off
  2601 000007B3 7503                    		jnz	short corig13_popf_retf
  2602 000007B5 E80F00                  		call	EnableA20
  2603                                  corig13_popf_retf:			
  2604 000007B8 9D                      		popf
  2605 000007B9 CB                      		retf
  2606                                  
  2607                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2608                                  
  2609                                  ; BIOSDATA:07BBh (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
  2610                                  ; BIOSDATA:07BBh (MSDOS 5.0, IO.SYS) ; 16/10/2022
  2611                                  
  2612 000007BA 9000FFFF                HiMem:		dd 0FFFF0090h
