  2620                                  ;************************************************************************
  2621                                  ;*									*
  2622                                  ;*	EnsureA20On - ensure that a20 is enabled if we're running	*
  2623                                  ;*	  in the HMA before interrupt entry points into Bios_Code	*
  2624                                  ;*									*
  2625                                  ;************************************************************************
  2626                                  
  2627                                  EnsureA20On:	; proc near		
  2628 000007C2 E80E00                  		call	IsA20Off
  2629                                  		;jz	short EnableA20
  2630                                  		;retn
  2631                                  		; 18/12/2022
  2632 000007C5 750B                    		jnz	short A20On_retn	
  2633                                  
  2634                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  2635                                  
  2636                                  
  2637                                  EnableA20:	; proc near		
  2638 000007C7 50                      		push	ax
  2639 000007C8 53                      		push	bx
  2640 000007C9 B405                    		mov	ah, 5	 ; local enable a20
  2641                                  		;call	cs:xms
  2642 000007CB 2EFF1E[0E00]            		call	far [cs:xms] ; 16/10/2022
  2643 000007D0 5B                      		pop	bx
  2644 000007D1 58                      		pop	ax
  2645                                  A20On_retn:	; 18/12/2022	
  2646 000007D2 C3                      		retn
  2647                                  
  2648                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  2649                                  
  2650                                  
  2651                                  IsA20Off:	; proc near		
  2652 000007D3 1E                      		push	ds
  2653 000007D4 06                      		push	es
  2654 000007D5 51                      		push	cx
  2655 000007D6 56                      		push	si
  2656 000007D7 57                      		push	di
  2657 000007D8 2EC536[BA07]            		lds	si, [cs:HiMem]
  2658 000007DD 2EC43E[BE07]            		les	di, [cs:LoMem]
  2659 000007E2 B90800                  		mov	cx, 8
  2660 000007E5 F3A7                    		repe cmpsw
  2661 000007E7 5F                      		pop	di
  2662 000007E8 5E                      		pop	si
  2663 000007E9 59                      		pop	cx
  2664 000007EA 07                      		pop	es
  2665 000007EB 1F                      		pop	ds
  2666 000007EC C3                      		retn
  2667                                  
  2668                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2669                                  
  2670                                  DisableA20:
  2671 000007ED 50                      		push	ax
  2672 000007EE 53                      		push	bx
  2673 000007EF B406                    		mov	ah, 6		; local disable A20
  2674 000007F1 2EFF1E[0E00]            		call	far [cs:xms]
  2675                                  		;call	cs:xms
  2676 000007F6 5B                      		pop	bx
  2677 000007F7 58                      		pop	ax
  2678 000007F8 C3                      		retn
  2679                                  
  2680                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2681                                  
  2682                                  ;************************************************************************
  2683                                  ;*									*
  2684                                  ;*	int19 - bootstrap interrupt -- we must restore a bunch of the	*
  2685                                  ;*	  interrupt vectors before resuming the original int19 code	*
  2686                                  ;*									*
  2687                                  ;************************************************************************
  2688                                  
  2689                                  int19:					
  2690 000007F9 0E                      		push	cs
  2691 000007FA 1F                      		pop	ds
  2692 000007FB 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]	; 16/10/2022
  2693 000007FF B90500                  		mov	cx, 5		; NUMROMVECTORS
  2694                                  		;mov	si, offset RomVectors
  2695 00000802 BE[0001]                		mov	si, RomVectors	; 19/10/2022
  2696                                  next_int:				
  2697 00000805 AC                      		lodsb			; get int number
  2698 00000806 98                      		cbw			; assume < 128
  2699 00000807 D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
  2700 00000809 D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1		; int *	4
  2701 0000080B 89C7                    		mov	di, ax
  2702 0000080D AD                      		lodsw
  2703 0000080E AB                      		stosw
  2704 0000080F AD                      		lodsw
  2705 00000810 AB                      		stosw			; install the saved vector
  2706 00000811 E2F2                    		loop	next_int
  2707 00000813 803E[4006]00            		cmp	byte [int19sem], 0 ; 19/10/2022
  2708 00000818 7422                    		jz	short doint19
  2709 0000081A BE[4106]                		mov	si, i19_lst	; stacks code has changed these hardware interrupt vectors
  2710                                  					; stkinit in sysinit1 will initialize int19oldxx values
  2711 0000081D B90E00                  		mov	cx, 14		; num_i19
  2712                                  
  2713                                  i19_restore_loop:			
  2714 00000820 AC                      		lodsb			; get interrupt	number
  2715 00000821 98                      		cbw			; assume < 128
  2716 00000822 89C7                    		mov	di, ax
  2717 00000824 AD                      		lodsw			; get original vector offset
  2718 00000825 89C3                    		mov	bx, ax		; save it
  2719 00000827 AD                      		lodsw
  2720 00000828 83FBFF                  		cmp	bx, 0FFFFh	; check	for 0ffffh (unlikely segment)
  2721 0000082B 740D                    		jz	short i19_restor_1 ; opt no need to check selector too
  2722 0000082D 83F8FF                  		cmp	ax, 0FFFFh	; opt 0ffffh is	unlikely offset
  2723 00000830 7408                    		jz	short i19_restor_1
  2724 00000832 01FF                    		add	di, di
  2725 00000834 01FF                    		add	di, di
  2726 00000836 93                      		xchg	ax, bx
  2727 00000837 AB                      		stosw
  2728 00000838 93                      		xchg	ax, bx
  2729 00000839 AB                      		stosw			; put the vector back

  2736 00000841 7403                    		jz	short SkipVDisk
  2737 00000843 E83000                  		call	EraseVDiskHead	; Then erase our VDISK header at 1MB boundary
  2738                                  					; Some m/c's (AST 386 & HP QS/16 do not clear
  2739                                  					; the memory above 1MB during a	warm boot.

  2746                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2747                                  ;
  2748                                  ; procedure : int15
  2749                                  ;
  2750                                  ;		Int15 handler for recognizing ctrl-alt-del seq
  2751                                  ;		If it recognizes ctrl-alt-del and if DOS was
  2752                                  ;		is running high, it Erases the VDISK header
  2753                                  ;		present at 1MB boundary
  2754                                  ;
  2755                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2756                                  
  2757                                  ; 16/10/2022
  2758                                  ;DELKEY		equ	53h
  2759                                  ;ROMDATASEG	equ	40h
  2760                                  KBFLAG		equ	17h
  2761                                  ;CTRLSTATE	equ	04h
  2762                                  ;ALTSTATE	equ	08h
  2763                                  
  2764                                  Int15:		; proc near		
  2765                                  		;cmp	ax, 4F00h+DELKEY
  2766 00000848 3D534F                  		cmp	ax, 4F53h	; del keystroke ?
  2767 0000084B 7405                    		jz	short int15_1
  2768 0000084D 2EFF2E[0B01]            		jmp	far [cs:Old15]	; 16/10/2022
  2769                                  		;jmp	cs:Old15
  2770                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2771                                  
  2772                                  int15_1:				
  2773 00000852 1E                      		push	ds
  2774 00000853 50                      		push	ax
  2775 00000854 B84000                  		mov	ax, 40h		; ROMDATASEG
  2776 00000857 8ED8                    		mov	ds, ax
  2777                                  		;mov	al, ds:17h	; [KBFLAG]
  2778                                  		; 16/10/2022
  2779 00000859 A01700                  		mov	al, [KBFLAG]
  2780 0000085C 240C                    		and	al, 0Ch		; (CTRLSTATE | ALTSTATE)
  2781 0000085E 3C0C                    		cmp	al, 0Ch		; (CTRLSTATE | ALTSTATE)
  2782 00000860 750C                    		jnz	short int15_2
  2783 00000862 0E                      		push	cs
  2784 00000863 1F                      		pop	ds
  2785 00000864 803E[0D00]00            		cmp	byte [inHMA], 0	; is DOS running from HMA
  2786 00000869 7403                    		jz	short int15_2
  2787 0000086B E80800                  		call	EraseVDiskHead
  2788                                  int15_2:				
  2789 0000086E 58                      		pop	ax
  2790 0000086F 1F                      		pop	ds
  2791 00000870 F9                      		stc
  2792 00000871 2EFF2E[0B01]            		jmp	far [cs:Old15]	; 16/10/2022
  2793                                  		;jmp	cs:Old15
  2794                                  
  2795                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  2796                                  
  2797                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2798                                  ;
  2799                                  ; procedure : EraseVDiskHead
  2800                                  ;
  2801                                  ;		Erases the VDisk Header present in the 1MB boundary
  2802                                  ;
  2803                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2804                                  
  2805                                  EraseVDiskHead:	; proc near		
  2806 00000876 50                      		push	ax
  2807 00000877 51                      		push	cx
  2808 00000878 57                      		push	di
  2809 00000879 06                      		push	es
  2810 0000087A E845FF                  		call	EnsureA20On
  2811 0000087D B8FFFF                  		mov	ax, 0FFFFh	; HMA seg
  2812 00000880 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax
  2813 00000882 BF1000                  		mov	di, 10h		; point	to VDISK header
  2814 00000885 B91000                  		mov	cx, 10h		; size of vdisk	header
  2815 00000888 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax
  2816 0000088A F3AB                    		rep stosw		; clear	it
  2817 0000088C 07                      		pop	es
  2818 0000088D 5F                      		pop	di
  2819 0000088E 59                      		pop	cx
  2820 0000088F 58                      		pop	ax
  2821 00000890 C3                      		retn

  2866                                  ;SR; WIN386 support
  2867                                  
  2868                                  ; WIN386 instance data structure
  2869                                  ;
  2870                                  ; Here is a Win386 startup info structure which we set up and to which
  2871                                  ; we return a pointer when Win386 initializes.
  2872                                  
  2873 0000089A 0300                    Win386_SI:	db 3, 0			; SI_Version
  2874                                  					; Startup Info for Win386
  2875 0000089C 00000000                SI_Next:	dd 0			; pointer to next info structure
  2876 000008A0 00000000                		dd 0			; a field we don't need
  2877 000008A4 00000000                		dd 0			; another field	we don't need
  2878 000008A8 [AC08]                  SI_Instance:	dw Instance_Table
  2879 000008AA 7000                    		dw 70h	; Bios_Data	; far pointer to instance table
  2880                                  
  2881                                  ; This table gives Win386 the instance data in the BIOS and ROM-BIOS data
  2882                                  ; areas. Note that the address and size of the hardware stacks must
  2883                                  ; be calculated and inserted at boot time.
  2884                                  
  2885 000008AC 00005000                Instance_Table:	dw 0, 50h		; print	screen status...
  2886 000008B0 0200                    		dw 2			; ... 2	bytes
  2887 000008B2 0E005000                		dw 0Eh,	50h		; ROM Basic data...
  2888 000008B6 1400                    		dw 14h			; ... 14H bytes
  2889 000008B8 [0C00]                  		dw altah		; a con	device buffer...
  2890 000008BA 7000                    		dw 70h			; Bios_Data segment
  2891 000008BC 0100                    		dw 1			; ... 1 byte
  2892                                  
  2893                                  NextStack:
  2894                                  
  2895                                  ; NOTE:  If stacks are disabled by STACKS=0,0, the following
  2896                                  ;	instance items WILL NOT be filled in by SYSINIT.
  2897                                  ;	That's just fine as long as these are the last items
  2898                                  ;	in the instance list since the first item is initialized
  2899                                  ;	to 0000 at load time.
  2900                                  
  2901 000008BE 00000000                		dw 0, 0			; pointer to next stack	to be used...
  2902 000008C2 0200                    		dw 2			; ... 2 bytes
  2903 000008C4 00000000                IT_StackLoc:	dd 0			; location of hardware stacks
  2904 000008C8 0000                    IT_StackSize:	dw 0			; size of hardware stacks
  2905 000008CA 00000000                		dd 0			; terminate the	instance table
  2906                                  
  2907                                  					;SR;
  2908 000008CE 00                      IsWin386:	db 0			; Flag to indicate whether
  2909                                  					; Win386 is running or not
  2910                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2911                                  
  2912                                  ;This routine was originally in BIOS_CODE but this causes a lot of problems
  2913                                  ;when we call it including checking of A20. The code being only about 
  2914                                  ;30 bytes, we might as well put it in BIOS_DATA
  2915                                  
  2916                                  V86_Crit_SetFocus:			
  2917 000008CF 57                      		push	di
  2918 000008D0 06                      		push	es
  2919 000008D1 53                      		push	bx
  2920 000008D2 50                      		push	ax
  2921 000008D3 31FF                    		xor	di, di
  2922 000008D5 8EC7                    		mov	es, di
  2923 000008D7 BB1500                  		mov	bx, 15h		; Device ID of DOSMGR device
  2924 000008DA B88416                  		mov	ax, 1684h	; Get API entry	point
  2925 000008DD CD2F                    		int	2Fh		; - Multiplex -	MS WINDOWS - GET DEVICE	API ENTRY POINT
  2926                                  					; BX = virtual device (VxD) ID,	ES:DI =	0000h:0000h
  2927                                  					; Return: ES:DI	-> VxD API entry point,	or 0:0 if the VxD does not support an API
  2928 000008DF 8CC0                    		mov	ax, es
  2929 000008E1 09F8                    		or	ax, di
  2930 000008E3 740B                    		jz	short Skip	; Here,	es:di is address of API	routine.
  2931                                  					; Set up stack frame to	simulate a call.
  2932 000008E5 0E                      		push	cs
  2933                                  		;mov	ax, offset Skip
  2934 000008E6 B8[F008]                		mov	ax, Skip
  2935 000008E9 50                      		push	ax
  2936 000008EA 06                      		push	es
  2937 000008EB 57                      		push	di		; API far call address
  2938 000008EC B80100                  		mov	ax, 1		; SetFocus function number
  2939 000008EF CB                      		retf			; do the call
  2940                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2941                                  
  2942                                  Skip:					
  2943 000008F0 58                      		pop	ax
  2944 000008F1 5B                      		pop	bx
  2945 000008F2 07                      		pop	es
  2946 000008F3 5F                      		pop	di
  2947 000008F4 CB                      		retf
  2948                                  
  2949                                  ;End WIN386 support
