  4553 000017BC 0E                      		push	cs
  4554 000017BD 1F                      		pop	ds
  4555                                  		
  4556 000017BE A1[0601]                		mov	ax, [Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4557 000017C1 A3[B400]                		mov	[Orig13], ax
  4558 000017C4 A1[0801]                		mov	ax, [Old13+2]
  4559 000017C7 A3[B600]                		mov	[Orig13+2], ax
  4560                                  					; ;
  4561 000017CA FB                      		sti
  4562 000017CB CD11                    		int	11h		; EQUIPMENT DETERMINATION
  4563                                  					; Return: AX = equipment flag bits
  4564                                  
  4565                                  ; we have to support a system that does not have any diskette
  4566                                  ; drives but only hardfiles. this system will ipl from the hardfile.
  4567                                  ; if the equipment flag bit 0 is 1, then the system has diskette drive(s).
  4568                                  ; otherwise, the system has only hardfiles.
  4569                                  ;
  4570                                  ; important thing is that still, for compatibility reason, the drive letter
  4571                                  ; for the hardfiles start from "c".  so, we still need to allocate dummy bds
  4572                                  ; drive a and drive b. at sysinit time, we are going to set cds table entry
  4573                                  ; of dpb pointer for these drives to 0, so any user attempt to access this
  4574                                  ; drives will get "invalid drive letter ..." message. we are going to
  4575                                  ; establish "fakefloppydrv" flag. ***sysinit module should call int 11h to
  4576                                  ; determine whether there are any diskette drivers in the system or not.!!!***
  4577                                  
  4578                                  ; check the register returned by the equipment determination interrupt
  4579                                  ; we have to handle the case of no diskettes in the system by faking
  4580                                  ; two dummy drives.
  4581                                  ;
  4582                                  ; if the register indicates that we do have floppy drives we don't need
  4583                                  ; to do anything special.
  4584                                  ;
  4585                                  ; if the register indicates that we don't have any floppy drives then
  4586                                  ; what we need to do is set the fakefloppydrv variable, change the
  4587                                  ; register to say that we do have floppy drives and then go to execute
  4588                                  ; the code which starts at notsingle. this is because we can skip the
  4589                                  ; code given below which tries to find if there are one or two drives
  4590                                  ; since we already know about this.
  4591                                  
  4592                                  		; 12/12/2022
  4593 000017CD A801                    		test	al, 1
  4594                                  		;test	ax, 1		; floppy drives	present	?
  4595 000017CF 752C                    		jnz	short normalfloppydrv ;	yes.
  4596                                  
  4597                                  ; Some ROM BIOSs lie that there are no floppy drives. Lets find out
  4598                                  ; whether it is an old ROM BIOS or a new one
  4599                                  ;
  4600                                  ; WARNING !!!
  4601                                  ;
  4602                                  ; This sequence of code is present in SYSINIT1.ASM also. Any modification
  4603                                  ; here will require an equivalent modification in SYSINIT1.ASM also
  4604                                  
  4605 000017D1 50                      		push	ax
  4606 000017D2 53                      		push	bx
  4607 000017D3 51                      		push	cx
  4608 000017D4 52                      		push	dx
  4609 000017D5 57                      		push	di
  4610 000017D6 06                      		push	es
  4611 000017D7 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  4612 000017D9 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  4613 000017DB CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  4614                                  					; DL = drive number
  4615                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  4616                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  4617                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  4618 000017DD 7204                    		jb	short _gdskp_error
  4619                                  		;mov	[cs:flp_drvs], dl
  4620                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4621                                  		; ds = cs
  4622 000017DF 8816[7117]              		mov	[flp_drvs], dl
  4623                                  _gdskp_error:				
  4624 000017E3 07                      		pop	es
  4625 000017E4 5F                      		pop	di
  4626 000017E5 5A                      		pop	dx
  4627 000017E6 59                      		pop	cx
  4628 000017E7 5B                      		pop	bx
  4629 000017E8 58                      		pop	ax
  4630 000017E9 7212                    		jb	short normalfloppydrv
  4631                                  					; if error it is an old ROM BIOS
  4632                                  					; so, lets assume that ROM BIOS lied
  4633                                  
  4634                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4635                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:flp_drvs], 0 ; number of drvs == 0?
  4636                                  		;jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  4637                                  		;mov	al, [cs:flp_drvs]
  4638 000017EB A0[7117]                		mov	al, [flp_drvs]
  4639 000017EE 08C0                    		or	al, al		; number of drvs == 0?
  4640 000017F0 7403                    		jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  4641                                  
  4642                                  		;dec	al		; make it zero based
  4643                                  		; 18/12/2022
  4644 000017F2 48                      		dec	ax
  4645 000017F3 EB0C                    		jmp	short got_num_flp_drvs

  4648                                  _set_fake_flpdrv:
  4649                                  		; 21/12/2022

  4651 000017F8 A2[E116]                		mov	[fakefloppydrv], al ; 1
  4652                                  		;mov	byte [cs:fakefloppydrv], 1
  4653                                  		;			; we don't have any floppy drives.
  4654                                  		;mov	ax, 1
  4655 000017FB EB09                    		jmp	short settwodrive ; well then set it for two drives!
  4656                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4657                                  
  4658                                  normalfloppydrv:			; yes, bit 0 is 1.			
  4659 000017FD D0C0                    		rol	al, 1		; there	exist floppy drives.

  4661                                  got_num_flp_drvs:

  4663                                  		; 18/12/2022

  4667                                  settwodrive:				; set this to two fakedrives

  4676 0000180B 88C1                    		mov	cl, al		; ch is	fat id,	cl # floppies

  4737                                  					; AKPORT

  4739                                  ; some olivetti m24 machines have an 8530 serial communications

  5041                                  ; scan the list of drives to determine their type. we have three flavors of
  5042                                  ; diskette drives:
  5043                                  ;
  5044                                  ;   48tpi drives    we do nothing special for them
  5045                                  ;   96tpi drives    mark the fact that they have changeline support.
  5046                                  ;   3.5"  drives    mark changeline support and small.
  5047                                  ;
  5048                                  ; the following code uses registers for certain values:
  5049                                  ;
  5050                                  ;   dl - physical drive
  5051                                  ;   ds:di - points to current bds
  5052                                  ;   cx - flag bits for bds
  5053                                  ;   dh - form factor for the drive (1 - 48tpi, 2 - 96tpi, 3 - 3.5" medium)

  5066                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)

  5068                                  
  5069                                  ; check to see if we are faking floppy drives. if not we don't
  5070                                  ; do anything special. if we are faking floppy drives we need
  5071                                  ; to set aside two bdss for the two fake floppy drives. we
  5072                                  ; don't need to initalise any fields though. so starting at start_bds
  5073                                  ; use the link field in the bds structure to go to the second bds
  5074                                  ; in the list and initalise it's link field to -1 to set the end of
  5075                                  ; the list. then jump to the routine at dohard to allocate/initialise
  5076                                  ; the bds for harddrives.

  5371                                  ; if more than 2 diskette drives on the system, then it is necessary to remap
  5372                                  ; the bds chain to adjust the logical drive num (drive letter) with greater
  5373                                  ; than two diskette drives
  5374                                  ;
  5375                                  ; new scheme:	if more than 2 disktte drives, first map the bds structure
  5376                                  ;		as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the  drive
  5377                                  ;		letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  5378                                  ;		drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  5379                                  ;		and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk
  5380                                  ;		drive to the 3rd and 4th diskette drives.

  5393                                  ;we now decide, based on the configurations available so far, what
  5394                                  ;code or data we need to keep as a stay resident code. the following table
  5395                                  ;shows the configurations under consideration. they are listed in the order
  5396                                  ;of their current position memory.
  5397                                  ;
  5398                                  ;configuration will be done in two ways:
  5399                                  ;
  5400                                  ;first, we are going to set "static configuration". static configuration will
  5401                                  ;consider from basic configuration to endof96tpi configuration. the result
  5402                                  ;of static configuration will be the address the dynamic configuration will
  5403                                  ;use to start with.
  5404                                  ;
  5405                                  ;secondly, "dynamic cofiguration" will be performed. dynamic configuration
  5406                                  ;involves possible relocation of code or data. dynamic configuration routine
  5407                                  ;will take care of bdsm tables and at rom fix module thru k09 suspend/resume
  5408                                  ;code individually. after these operation, [dosdatasg] will be set.
  5409                                  ;this will be the place sysinit routine will relocate msdos module for good.
  5410

  5413                                  ;   1.	 basic configuration for msbio (endfloppy)

  5415                                  ;   3.	 end of bdss	; end of bdss for hard disks

  5482                                  ; On certain systems with Western Digital disk controllers, the
  5483                                  ; following detection scheme caused an unpredictable and serious
  5484                                  ; failure. In particular, they've implemented a nonstandard
  5485                                  ; Int13(ah=16h) which reconfigures the hard drive, depending on
  5486                                  ; what happens to be at es:[bx] and other memory locations indexed
  5487                                  ; off of it.

  5489                                  ; Compaq was unable to tell us exactly which kind of systems have

  5491                                  ; ROM BIOSs dated 08/04/86 and later. We'll check for the COMPAQ
  5492                                  ; string, and then look for date codes before 08/04/86 to decide

  5772                                  
  5773                                  ; Following are subroutines to support resident device driver initialization
  5774                                  ;
  5775                                  ;M011 -- note:  deleted setup_bdsms and reset_bdsms here
  5776                                  
  5777                                  ;	M035 -- begin changed section
  5778                                  
  5779                                  ;******************************************************************************
  5780                                  ; module name: remap
  5781                                  ;
  5782                                  ; descriptive name: all the code for himem that could be separated from msbio
  5783                                  ;
  5784                                  ; function:  remap the bds chain to adjusted logical drive numbers (drive
  5785                                  ;	     letters) if more than two diskette drives on the system.
  5786                                  ;
  5787                                  ;     scheme:  if more than 2 diskette drives, first map the bds structure
  5788                                  ;	       as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the drive
  5789                                  ;	       letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  5790                                  ;	       drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  5791                                  ;	       and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk
  5792                                  ;	       drive to the 3rd and 4th diskette drives.
  5793                                  
  5794                                  ; input:       none
  5795                                  ; exit:	drive letters have been remapped in bds chain
  5796                                  ; exit error:  none
  5797                                  ; called from: msinit
  5798                                  ;
  5799                                  ; notes:  this function  will be called only if more than 2 diskettes are
  5800                                  ;	  found in the system
  5801                                  ;	  this function assumes that there are no more than 26 drives assigned
  5802                                  ;	    this is guaranteed by the code that creates bdss for partitions
  5803                                  ;	  this function assumes that the first entries in the chain are
  5804                                  ;	   floppy drives, and all the rest are hard drives
  5805                                  ;	  will alter the boot drive if necessary to reflect remapping
  5806                                  ;
  5807                                  ;******************************************************************************
  5808                                  
  5809                                  ; 17/10/2022
  5810                                  ; 02/10/2022
  5811                                  
  5812                                  remap:		; proc near		
  5813 00001C77 2E8B3E[1901]            		mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; get first bds
  5814                                  
  5815                                  ; search for 1st fixed disk physical drive num
  5816                                  
  5817                                  drive_loop:				
  5818 00001C7C 807D0480                		cmp	byte [di+4], 80h ; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  5819                                  					; first	hard disk??
  5820 00001C80 7409                    		jz	short fdrv_found ; yes,	continue
  5821 00001C82 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5822                                  					; get next bds,	assume segment
  5823 00001C84 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, -1		; last bds?
  5824 00001C87 75F3                    		jnz	short drive_loop ; loop	if not
  5825 00001C89 EB4F                    		jmp	short rmap_exit	; yes, no hard drive on	system
  5826                                  
  5827                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5828                                  ;first disk drive bds, now change the logical drive num to 2 and the subsequent
  5829                                  ;logical drive nums to 3, 4, 5 etc.
  5830                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5831                                  
  5832                                  fdrv_found:				
  5833 00001C8B B002                    		mov	al, 2		; start	with logical drv num=2
  5834                                  fdrv_loop:				
  5835 00001C8D 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  5836                                  					; found	??
  5837 00001C90 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5838                                  					; ds:di--> next	bds
  5839                                  		;inc	al		; set num for next drive
  5840                                  		; 18/12/2022
  5841 00001C92 40                      		inc	ax
  5842 00001C93 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; last hard drive ??
  5843 00001C96 75F5                    		jnz	short fdrv_loop	; no - assign more disk	drives
  5844                                  
  5845                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5846                                  ; now, rescan and find bds of 3rd floppy drive and assign next drive letter
  5847                                  ; in al to 3rd. if the current drive letter is past z, then do not allocate
  5848                                  ; any more.
  5849                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5850                                  
  5851 00001C98 2E8B3E[1901]            		mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; [start_bds]
  5852                                  					; get first bds
  5853 00001C9D 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5854                                  					; ds:di-->bds2
  5855 00001C9F 2E8A26[2501]            		mov	ah, [cs:dsktnum] ; get number of floppies to remap
  5856 00001CA4 80EC02                  		sub	ah, 2		; adjust for a:	& b:
  5857                                  remap_loop1:				
  5858 00001CA7 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5859                                  					; set new num to next floppy
  5860 00001CA9 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  5861 00001CAC FEC0                    		inc	al		; new number for next floppy
  5862 00001CAE FECC                    		dec	ah		; count	down extra floppies
  5863 00001CB0 75F5                    		jnz	short remap_loop1
  5864                                  
  5865                                  ; now we've got to adjust the boot drive if we reassigned it
  5866                                  
  5867 00001CB2 2EA0[CA16]              		mov	al, [cs:drvfat]
  5868 00001CB6 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; is it	a: or b: ?
  5869 00001CB8 7220                    		jb	short rmap_exit
  5870 00001CBA 2E2A06[2501]            		sub	al, [cs:dsktnum] ; is it one of the other floppies?
  5871 00001CBF 7204                    		jb	short remap_boot_flop ;	brif so
  5872                                  
  5873                                  ; we've got to remap the boot hard drive
  5874                                  ; subtract the number of EXTRA floppies from it
  5875                                  
  5876 00001CC1 0402                    		add	al, 2		; bootdrv -= (dsktnum-2)
  5877 00001CC3 EB05                    		jmp	short remap_change_boot_drv
  5878                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5879                                  
  5880                                  ; we've got to remap the boot floppy.
  5881                                  ; add the number of hard drive partitions to it
  5882                                  
  5883                                  remap_boot_flop:			
  5884 00001CC5 2E0206[7500]            		add	al, [cs:drvmax]	; bootdrv += (drvmax-dsktnum)
  5885                                  remap_change_boot_drv:			
  5886 00001CCA 2EA2[CA16]              		mov	[cs:drvfat], al ; alter msdos.sys load drive
  5887 00001CCE FEC0                    		inc	al
  5888 00001CD0 1E                      		push	ds
  5889 00001CD1 BF5804                  		mov	di, SYSINITSEG	; 46Dh
  5890                                  		;mov	di, 46Dh	; SYSINIT segment
  5891 00001CD4 8EDF                    		mov	ds, di
  5892 00001CD6 A2[9602]                		mov	[DEFAULTDRIVE], al
  5893                                  		;mov	ds:296h, al	; [SYSINIT+DEFAULT_DRIVE]
  5894                                  					; pass it to sysinit as	well
  5895 00001CD9 1F                      		pop	ds
  5896                                  rmap_exit:				
  5897 00001CDA C3                      		retn
  5898                                  
  5899                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  5900                                  
  5901                                  ; 17/10/2022
  5902                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 -actual-)
  5903                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 -draft-)
  5904                                  ; 02/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3)	
  5905                                  ; 19/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0 (MSDOS 2.11)
  5906                                  ;**************************************************
  5907                                  ; getboot - get the boot sector for a hard disk
  5908                                  ;
  5909                                  ; Reads the boot sector from a specified drive into
  5910                                  ; a buffer at the top of memory.
  5911                                  ;
  5912                                  ; dl = int13 drive number to read boot sector for
  5913                                  ;**************************************************
  5914                                  
  5915                                  ; 17/10/2022
  5916                                  bootbias equ 200h
  5917                                  
  5918                                  getboot:	; proc near		
  5919                                  		
  5920                                  		; 08/04/2018
  5921                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 (IBMBIO.COM, IBMDOS 2.1)
  5922                                  		; 28/03/2018 - MSDOS 6.0 - MSINIT.ASM, 1991
  5923                                  		; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
  5924                                  		;	      (disassembled IO.SYS code of MSDOS 5.0)
  5925                                  
  5926 00001CDB 2EA1[D516]              		mov	ax, [cs:init_bootseg] ; 17/10/2022
  5927 00001CDF 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax
  5928                                  		; 17/10/2022
  5929 00001CE1 BB0002                  		mov	bx, bootbias ; 200h
  5930                                  		;mov	bx, 200h	; bootbias
  5931                                  					; load BX, ES:BX is where sector goes
  5932 00001CE4 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  5933 00001CE7 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
  5934 00001CE9 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1
  5935 00001CEC CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  5936                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  5937                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  5938                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  5939 00001CEE 7209                    		jb	short erret
  5940                                  		; 17/10/2022
  5941 00001CF0 26813EFE0355AA          		cmp	word [es:bootbias+1FEh], 0AA55h
  5942                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:3FEh, 0AA55h ; [es:bootbias+1FEh]
  5943                                  					; Dave Litton magic word?
  5944 00001CF7 7401                    		jz	short norm_ret	; yes
  5945                                  erret:					
  5946 00001CF9 F9                      		stc
  5947                                  norm_ret:				
  5948 00001CFA C3                      		retn
  5949                                  
  5950                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  5951                                  
  5952                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 
  5953                                  
  5954                                  ;***************************************************************************
  5955                                  ;   sethard - generate bpb for a variable sized hard file. ibm has a
  5956                                  ;   partitioned hard file; we must read physical sector 0 to determine where
  5957                                  ;   our own logical sectors start. we also read in our boot sector to
  5958                                  ;   determine version number
  5959                                  ;
  5960                                  ;   inputs:	dl is rom drive number (80...)
  5961                                  ;		bh is partition number (0....) 
  5962                                  ;		ds:di points to bds
  5963                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear -> bpb is filled in
  5964                                  ;		carry set   -> bpb is left uninitialized due to error
  5965                                  ;	trashes (at least) si, cx
  5966                                  ;	MUST PRESERVE ES:!!!!
  5967                                  ;***************************************************************************
  5968                                  
  5969                                  sethard:	; proc near		
  5970 00001CFB 57                      		push	di
  5971 00001CFC 53                      		push	bx
  5972 00001CFD 1E                      		push	ds
  5973 00001CFE 06                      		push	es
  5974 00001CFF 885D05                  		mov	[di+5],	bl	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  5975 00001D02 885504                  		mov	[di+4],	dl	; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  5976 00001D05 804D2301                		or	byte [di+23h], 1 ; [di+BDS.flags]
  5977                                  					; fnon_removable
  5978 00001D09 C6452205                		mov	byte [di+22h], 5 ; [di+BDS.formfactor]
  5979                                  					; ffHardFile
  5980 00001D0D C606[D216]00            		mov	byte [fbigfat], 0 ; assume 12 bit FAT
  5981 00001D12 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; partition number
  5982 00001D14 52                      		push	dx
  5983 00001D15 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  5984 00001D17 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  5985                                  					; DL = drive number
  5986                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  5987                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  5988                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  5989 00001D19 FEC6                    		inc	dh
  5990 00001D1B 887515                  		mov	[di+15h], dh	; [di+BDS.heads] ; get number of heads
  5991 00001D1E 5A                      		pop	dx
  5992 00001D1F 7263                    		jb	short setret	; error	if no hard disk
  5993 00001D21 80E13F                  		and	cl, 3Fh
  5994 00001D24 884D13                  		mov	[di+13h], cl	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  5995 00001D27 52                      		push	dx		; save partition number
  5996 00001D28 E8B0FF                  		call	getboot
  5997 00001D2B 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore partition number
  5998 00001D2C 7256                    		jb	short setret
  5999 00001D2E BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  6000                                  
  6001                                  ; The first 'active' partition is 00, the second is 01....
  6002                                  ;   then the remainder of the 'primary' but non-active partitions
  6003                                  
  6004                                  act_part:				
  6005 00001D31 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h ; is the partition active?
  6006 00001D36 7418                    		jz	short no_act	; no
  6007 00001D38 26803F01                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; reject if partitiontype != 1, 4 or 6
  6008 00001D3C 740C                    		jz	short got_good_act
  6009 00001D3E 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  6010 00001D42 7406                    		jz	short got_good_act
  6011 00001D44 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  6012 00001D48 7506                    		jnz	short no_act
  6013                                  got_good_act:				
  6014 00001D4A 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition #?
  6015 00001D4C 743A                    		jz	short set2	; WE GOT THE ONE WANTED!!
  6016 00001D4E FECE                    		dec	dh		; count	down
  6017                                  no_act:					
  6018 00001D50 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  6019 00001D53 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  6020                                  					; last entry done?
  6021 00001D57 75D8                    		jnz	short act_part	; no, process next entry
  6022 00001D59 BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  6023                                  					; restore original value of bx
  6024                                  
  6025                                  ; Now scan the non-active partitions
  6026                                  
  6027                                  get_primary:				
  6028 00001D5C 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h
  6029 00001D61 7518                    		jnz	short not_prim	; we've already scanned
  6030                                  					; the ACTIVE ones
  6031 00001D63 26803F01                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; see if partitiontype == 1, 4 or 6
  6032 00001D67 740C                    		jz	short got_prim
  6033 00001D69 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  6034 00001D6D 7406                    		jz	short got_prim
  6035 00001D6F 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  6036 00001D73 7506                    		jnz	short not_prim
  6037                                  got_prim:				
  6038 00001D75 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition?
  6039 00001D77 740F                    		jz	short set2
  6040 00001D79 FECE                    		dec	dh
  6041                                  not_prim:				
  6042 00001D7B 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  6043 00001D7E 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  6044 00001D82 75D8                    		jnz	short get_primary ; loop till we've gone through table
  6045                                  setret:					
  6046 00001D84 F9                      		stc			; error	return
  6047 00001D85 E9DC02                  		jmp	ret_hard_err
  6048                                  
  6049                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6050                                  
  6051                                  ;  until we get the real logical boot record and get the bpb,
  6052                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS will be used instead of BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS
  6053                                  ;  for the convenience of the computation.
  6054                                  ;
  6055                                  ;  at the end of this procedure, if a bpb information is gotten from
  6056                                  ;  the valid boot record, then we are going to use those bpb information
  6057                                  ;  without change.
  6058                                  ;
  6059                                  ;  otherwise, if (hidden sectors + total sectors) <= a word, then we will move
  6060                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS (low) to BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS and zero out
  6061                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS entry to make it a conventional bpb format.
  6062                                  
  6063                                  set2:					
  6064 00001D88 2E8816[D716]            		mov	[cs:rom_drv_num], dl
  6065                                  			; save the rom bios drive number we are handling now.
  6066 00001D8D 268B4704                		mov	ax, [es:bx+4]	; hidden sectors (start	sector)
  6067 00001D91 268B5706                		mov	dx, [es:bx+6]
  6068                                  
  6069                                  ; decrement the sector count by 1 to make it zero based. exactly 64k
  6070                                  ; sectors should be allowed	
  6071                                  
  6072 00001D95 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1
  6073 00001D98 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0
  6074 00001D9B 26034708                		add	ax, [es:bx+8]	; sectors in partition
  6075 00001D9F 2613570A                		adc	dx, [es:bx+10]
  6076 00001DA3 7305                    		jnb	short okdrive
  6077 00001DA5 800E[D216]80            		or	byte [fbigfat], 80h ; ftoobig
  6078                                  okdrive:				
  6079 00001DAA 268B4704                		mov	ax, [es:bx+4]
  6080 00001DAE 894517                  		mov	[di+17h], ax	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs]
  6081                                  					; BPB_HIDDENSECTORS = p->partitionbegin
  6082 00001DB1 268B4706                		mov	ax, [es:bx+6]
  6083 00001DB5 894519                  		mov	[di+19h], ax	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
  6084 00001DB8 268B570A                		mov	dx, [es:bx+10]	; # of sectors (high)
  6085 00001DBC 268B4708                		mov	ax, [es:bx+8]	; # of sectors (low)
  6086 00001DC0 89551D                  		mov	[di+1Dh], dx	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
  6087 00001DC3 89451B                  		mov	[di+1Bh], ax	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32]
  6088                                  					; bpb->maxsec =	p->partitionlength
  6089 00001DC6 83FA00                  		cmp	dx, 0
  6090 00001DC9 7705                    		ja	short okdrive_1
  6091 00001DCB 83F840                  		cmp	ax, 64		; if (p->partitionlength < 64)
  6092 00001DCE 72B4                    		jb	short setret	; return -1;
  6093                                  okdrive_1:				
  6094 00001DD0 8B5519                  		mov	dx, [di+19h]	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
  6095 00001DD3 8B4517                  		mov	ax, [di+17h]	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs]
  6096 00001DD6 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; boot sector number - for mini	disk
  6097                                  					; usually equal	to the # of sec/trk.
  6098 00001DD8 8A5D13                  		mov	bl, [di+13h]	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  6099 00001DDB 50                      		push	ax
  6100 00001DDC 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
  6101 00001DDE 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  6102 00001DE0 F7F3                    		div	bx		; (sectors)dx:ax / (BDS.secpertrack)bx =
  6103                                  					; (track)temp_h:ax + (sector)dx
  6104                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6105 00001DE2 2EA3[2905]              		mov	[cs:temp_h], ax
  6106 00001DE6 58                      		pop	ax
  6107 00001DE7 F7F3                    		div	bx
  6108 00001DE9 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl
  6109 00001DEB FEC1                    		inc	cl
  6110 00001DED 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx
  6111 00001DEF 8A5D15                  		mov	bl, [di+15h]	; [di+BDS.heads]
  6112 00001DF2 50                      		push	ax
  6113 00001DF3 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  6114 00001DF5 2EA1[2905]              		mov	ax, [cs:temp_h]
  6115 00001DF9 F7F3                    		div	bx
  6116 00001DFB 2EA3[2905]              		mov	[cs:temp_h], ax
  6117 00001DFF 58                      		pop	ax
  6118 00001E00 F7F3                    		div	bx		;  dl is head, ax is cylinder
  6119 00001E02 2E833E[2905]00          		cmp	word [cs:temp_h], 0
  6120 00001E08 777C                    		ja	short setret_brdg ; exceeds the	limit of int 13h
  6121 00001E0A 3D0004                  		cmp	ax, 1024
  6122 00001E0D 7777                    		ja	short setret_brdg ; exceeds the	limit of int 13h
  6123                                  			; Retro DOS v3.2 note by Erdogan Tan - 28/07/2019
  6124                                  			; **MSDOS code accepts if ax = 1024 but it is nonsense here
  6125                                  			; ('ja' must be 'jnb')
  6126                                  okdrive_2:
  6127                                   		; 28/07/2019
  6128                                  ; dl is head.
  6129                                  ; ax is cylinder
  6130                                  ; cl is sector number (assume less than 2**6 = 64 for int 13h)
  6131                                  
  6132                                  ;*** for mini disks ***
  6133                                  
  6134 00001E0F 837D4701                		cmp	word [di+47h], 1 ; [di+BDS.bdsm_ismini]
  6135                                  					; check	for mini disk
  6136 00001E13 7503                    		jnz	short oknotmini	; not mini disk.
  6137 00001E15 034549                  		add	ax, [di+49h]	; [di+BDS.bdsm_hidden_trks]
  6138                                  					; set the physical track number
  6139                                  oknotmini:
  6140                                  ;*** end of added logic for mini disk
  6141                                  				
  6142 00001E18 D0CC                    		ror	ah, 1		; move high two	bits of	cyl to high
  6143 00001E1A D0CC                    		ror	ah, 1		; two bits of upper byte
  6144 00001E1C 80E4C0                  		and	ah, 0C0h	; turn off remainder of	bits
  6145 00001E1F 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; move two bits	to correct spot
  6146 00001E21 88C5                    		mov	ch, al		; ch is	cylinder (low 8	bits)
  6147                                  					; cl is	sector + 2 high	bits of	cylinder
  6148 00001E23 88D6                    		mov	dh, dl		; dh is	head
  6149 00001E25 2E8A16[D716]            		mov	dl, [cs:rom_drv_num] ; dl is drive number
  6150                                  
  6151                                  ; cl is sector + 2 high bits of cylinder
  6152                                  ; ch is low 8 bits of cylinder
  6153                                  ; dh is head
  6154                                  ; dl is drive
  6155                                  
  6156                                  ; for convenience, we are going to read the logical boot sector
  6157                                  ; into cs:disksector area.
  6158                                  
  6159                                  ; read in boot sector using bios disk interrupt. the buffer where it
  6160                                  ; is to be read in is cs:disksector.
  6161                                  
  6162 00001E2A 0E                      		push	cs
  6163 00001E2B 07                      		pop	es
  6164 00001E2C BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector	; for convenience,
  6165                                  					; we are going to read the logical boot	sector
  6166                                  					; into cs:disksector area.
  6167 00001E2F B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  6168 00001E32 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  6169                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  6170                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  6171                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  6172                                  
  6173                                  ; cs:disksec contains the boot sector. in theory, (ha ha) the bpb in this thing
  6174                                  ; is correct. we can, therefore, suck out all the relevant statistics on the
  6175                                  ; media if we recognize the version number.
  6176                                  
  6177 00001E34 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
  6178 00001E37 53                      		push	bx
  6179 00001E38 50                      		push	ax
  6180 00001E39 2E803FE9                		cmp	byte [cs:bx], 0E9h ; is it a near jump?
  6181 00001E3D 740D                    		jz	short check_1_ok ; yes
  6182 00001E3F 2E803FEB                		cmp	byte [cs:bx], 0EBh ; is it a short jump?
  6183 00001E43 7529                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no
  6184 00001E45 2E807F0290              		cmp	byte [cs:bx+2], 90h ; yes, is the next one a nop?
  6185 00001E4A 7522                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record
  6186                                  check_1_ok:
  6187                                  		; 14/08/2023			
  6188 00001E4C BB[5901]                		mov	bx, disksector+11 ; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB				
  6189                                  		;mov	bx, 159h	; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB
  6190                                  					; point	to the bpb in the boot record
  6191 00001E4F 2E8A470A                		mov	al, [cs:bx+10]	; [bx+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
  6192                                  					; get the mediadescriptor byte
  6193 00001E53 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h	; mask off low nibble
  6194 00001E55 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; is high nibble = 0Fh?
  6195 00001E57 7515                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no,	invalid	boot record
  6196 00001E59 2E813F0002              		cmp	word [cs:bx], 512 ; [bx+EBPB.BYTESPERSECTOR]
  6197 00001E5E 750E                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; invalidate non 512 byte sectors
  6198                                  
  6199                                  check2_ok:				; yes, mediadescriptor ok.
  6200 00001E60 2E8A4702                		mov	al, [cs:bx+2]	; now make sure	that
  6201                                  					; the sectorspercluster	is
  6202                                  					; a power of 2
  6203                                  					;
  6204                                  					; [bx+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
  6205                                  					; get the sectorspercluster
  6206 00001E64 08C0                    		or	al, al		; is it	zero?
  6207 00001E66 7406                    		jz	short invalid_boot_record ; yes, invalid boot record
  6208                                  
  6209                                  ck_power_of_two:			
  6210 00001E68 D0E8                    		shr	al, 1		; shift	until first bit	emerges
  6211 00001E6A 73FC                    		jnb	short ck_power_of_two
  6212 00001E6C 7405                    		jz	short valid_boot_record
  6213                                  
  6214                                  invalid_boot_record:			
  6215 00001E6E 58                      		pop	ax
  6216 00001E6F 5B                      		pop	bx
  6217 00001E70 E93301                  		jmp	unknown		; jump to invalid boot record
  6218                                  					; unformatted or illegal media.
  6219                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6220                                  
  6221                                  valid_boot_record:			
  6222 00001E73 58                      		pop	ax
  6223 00001E74 5B                      		pop	bx
  6224                                  
  6225                                  ; Signature found. Now check version.
  6226                                  
  6227 00001E75 2E817F08322E            		cmp	word [cs:bx+8], '2.' ; 03/10/2022 (NASM syntax)

  6247

  6249

  6273                                  copybpb:
  6274                                  
  6275                                  ; 03/10/2022
  6276                                  
  6277                                  ; we have a valid boot sector. use the bpb in it to build the
  6278                                  ; bpb in bios. it is assumed that only
  6279                                  ;	BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER
  6280                                  ;	BDS_BPB.BPB_ROOTENTRIES, and
  6281                                  ;	BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERFAT
  6282                                  ; need to be set (all other values in already). fbigfat is also set.
  6283                                  
  6284                                  ; if it is non fat based system, then just copy the bpb from the boot sector
  6285                                  ; into the bpb in bds table, and also set the boot serial number, volume id,
  6286                                  ; and system id according to the boot record.
  6287                                  ; for the non_fat system, don't need to set the other value. so just do goodret.
  6288

  6397                                  ; ****** cas ---

  6434                                  		; 10/12/2022

  6440                                  			; screw it. it	was bogus.

  6446                                  		;or	cx, ax		; see if it is a big zero

  6502                                  					; set in bios bpb

  6598                                  ; we don't need to change "small fat" logic since it is gauranteed
  6599                                  ; that double word total sector will not use 12 bit fat (unless
  6600                                  ; it's sectors/cluster >= 16 which will never be in this case.)
  6601                                  ; so in this case we assume dx = 0 !!
  6602                                  
  6603 00001FE7 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; (12 bit fat)

  6624 00002007 52                      		push	dx		; save total sectors (high)
  6625 00002008 8B550C                  		mov	dx, [di+0Ch]	; [di+BDS.direntries]
  6626 0000200B D3EA                    		shr	dx, cl		; root dir sectors = BDS.direntries / 16;
  6627 0000200D 29D0                    		sub	ax, dx
  6628 0000200F 5A                      		pop	dx

  6630 00002013 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1
  6631 00002016 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0		; dx:ax	= t - r	- d
  6632                                  					; total	secs - reserved	secs - root dir	secs
  6633 00002019 B302                    		mov	bl, 2

  6635                                  					; bx = 256 * BDS.secperclus + 2
  6636                                  
  6637                                  ; I don't understand why to add bx here!!!
  6638                                  
  6639                                  		; 29/12/2018 - Erdogan Tan (Retro DOS v4.0)
  6640                                  		; 27/09/2022
  6641                                  		; (Microsoft FAT32 File	System Specification,
  6642                                  		; December 2000, Page 21)
  6643                                  		; TmpVal1 = DskSize - (BPB_ResvdSecCnt+RootrDirSectors)
  6644                                  		; TmpVal2 = (256*BPB_SecPerClus)+BPB_NumFATs
  6645                                  		; FATsz	= (TmpVal1+(TmpVal2-1))/TmpVal2
  6646                                  		; (If FATType == FAT16,	BPB_FATSz16 = LOWORD(FATSz))
  6647                                  		
  6648 0000201E 01D8                    		add	ax, bx		; ax = t-r-d+256*spc+2
  6649 00002020 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  6650 00002023 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1		; ax = t-r-d+256*spc+1
  6651 00002026 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0
  6652

  6654

  6656                                  					; ceil((total-dir-res)/(256*BDS.secperclus+2))
  6657 0000202B 894511                  		mov	[di+11h], ax	; [di+BDS.fatsecs]
  6658                                  					; number of fat	sectors

  6666                                  		;mov	[di+1Fh], bl	; [di+BDS.fatsiz] ; fat	size flag
  6667                                  
  6668 0000202E 1E                      		push	ds

  6685                                  ; set according to the partition information. we are going to

  6687                                  ; then no change. otherwise, BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS will be moved
  6688                                  ; to BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS and BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS will be set to 0.

  6787                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  6788                                  
  6789                                  ; 15/10/2022
  6790                                  
  6791                                  ; setdrvparms sets up the recommended bpb in each bds in the system based on
  6792                                  ; the form factor. it is assumed that the bpbs for the various form factors
  6793                                  ; are present in the bpbtable. for hard files, the recommended bpb is the same
  6794                                  ; as the bpb on the drive.
  6795                                  ;
  6796                                  ; no attempt is made to preserve registers since we are going to jump to
  6797                                  ; sysinit straight after this routine.
  6798                                  
  6799                                  setdrvparms:

  6821                                  					; assume sectors per cyl. < 64k.

  6830 000020EB 58                      		pop	ax

  6832 000020EE 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
  6833 000020F0 7401                    		jz	short no_cyl_rnd ; came out even
  6834 000020F2 40                      		inc	ax		; round	up

  6850                                  ; we can just go and deal with the next bds at label go_to_next_bds.

  6856                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:fakefloppydrv], 1
  6857 00002105 7454                    		jz	short go_to_next_bds

  6867                                  					; have the total number of sectors

  6874 00002124 D0E2                    		shl	dl, 1

  6881 0000212D C7452DF000              		mov	word [di+2Dh], 240 ; [di+BDS.rdirentries]
  6882                                  __@@:					
  6883 00002132 885529                  		mov	[di+29h], dl	; [di+BDS.rsecperclus]
  6884

  6887

  6891 00002135 F726[AB20]              		mul	word [word3]

  6893 0000213D 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx

  6899                                  		;xor	dx, dx
  6900                                  		;div	word [cs:word512] ; / 512 ; div word [cs:word512]

  6903                                  no_round_up:

  6905 00002147 EB12                    		jmp	short go_to_next_bds

  6910                                  		;mov	si, bpbtable

  6912                                  		; 09/12/2022

  6921                                  							; correct offset
