  9654                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9655                                  ;	getbp - return bpb from the drive specified by the bds.
  9656                                  ;	    if the return_fake_bpb flag is set, then it does nothing.
  9657                                  ;	    note that we never come here for fixed disks.
  9658                                  ;	    for all other cases,
  9659                                  ;	      - it reads boot sector to pull out the bpb
  9660                                  ;	      - if no valid bpb is found, it then reads the fat sector,
  9661                                  ;		to get the fat id byte to build the bpb from there.
  9662                                  ;
  9663                                  ;   inputs:	es:di point to correct bds.
  9664                                  ;
  9665                                  ;   outputs:	fills in bpb in current bds if valid bpb or fat id on disk.
  9666                                  ;		carry set, and al=7 if invalid disk.
  9667                                  ;		carry set and error code in al if other error.
  9668                                  ;		if failed to recognize the boot record, then will set the
  9669                                  ;		set_id_flag to 0.
  9670                                  ;		this routine will only work for a floppy diskette.
  9671                                  ;		     for a fixed disk, it will just return.
  9672                                  ;
  9673                                  ;	****** Note: getbp is a clone of getbp which uses the newer
  9674                                  ;	  segment definitions. It should be migrated towards.
  9675                                  ;	   now es:di has the bds, ds: has Bios_Data
  9676                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9677                                  
  9678                                  GetBp:		; if returning fake bpb then return bpb as is.
  9679                                  		;test	byte [es:di+BDS.flags], return_fake_bpb|fnon_removable		
  9680 000005F8 26F6452305              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 5

  9763                                  has8:					
  9764 0000065D F6C401                  		test	ah, 1		; test for 1 or	2 heads
  9765 00000660 7408                    		jz	short Has1	; jz = 1 head
  9766 00000662 01C9                    		add	cx, cx		; double size of disk
  9767 00000664 B770                    		mov	bh, 112		; increase number of directory entries
  9768 00000666 FEC6                    		inc	dh		; inc sec/all unit
  9769 00000668 FEC2                    		inc	dl		; inc head limit
  9770                                  Has1:					
  9771 0000066A 26887508                		mov	[es:di+8], dh	; [es:di+BDS.secperclus]
  9772 0000066E 26887D0C                		mov	[es:di+0Ch], bh	; [es:di+BDS.direntries]
  9773 00000672 26894D0E                		mov	[es:di+0Eh], cx	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs16]
  9774 00000676 26886510                		mov	[es:di+10h], ah	; [es:di+BDS.media]
  9775 0000067A 26884511                		mov	[es:di+11h], al	; [es:di+BDS.fatsecs]
  9776 0000067E 26885D13                		mov	[es:di+13h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
  9777 00000682 26885515                		mov	[es:di+15h], dl	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
  9778                                  
  9779                                  		; the BDS_BPB.BPB_HIDDENSECTORS+2 field and the
  9780                                  		; BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS field need to be set
  9781                                  		; to 0 since this code is for floppies
  9782                                  
  9783                                  		; 18/12/2022
  9784                                  		;mov	word [es:di+19h], 0 ; [es:di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
  9785                                  		;mov	word [es:di+17h], 0 ; [es:di+BDS.hiddensecs]

  9789 00000688 26894D19                		mov	[es:di+19h], cx ; 0 ; [es:di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
  9790 0000068C 26894D17                		mov	[es:di+17h], cx ; 0 ; [es:di+BDS.hiddensecs]
  9791 00000690 26894D1D                		mov	[es:di+1Dh], cx ; 0 ; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
  9792                                  getret:

  9818                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9819                                  
  9820                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  9821                                  
  9822                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
  9823                                  ; read in the boot sector. set carry if error in reading sector.
  9824                                  ; bx is set to 1 if the boot sector is invalid, otherwise it is 0.
  9825                                  ;
  9826                                  ;	assumes es:di -> bds, ds-> Bios_Data
  9827                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
  9828                                  
  9829                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  9830                                  
  9831                                  readbootsec:	
  9832 000006AC B600                    		mov	dh, 0		; head 0
  9833 000006AE B90100                  		mov	cx, 1		; cylinder 0, sector 1
  9834 000006B1 E8C600                  		call	read_sector
  9835 000006B4 724A                    		jb	short err_ret
  9836 000006B6 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; assume valid boot sector
  9837                                  
  9838                                  		; put a sanity check for the boot sector in here to detect
  9839                                  		; boot sectors that do not have valid bpbs. we examine the
  9840                                  		; first two bytes - they must contain a long jump (69h) or a
  9841                                  		; short jump (EBh) followed by a nop (90h), or a short jump
  9842                                  		; (E9h). if this test is passed, we further check by examining
  9843                                  		; the signature at the end of the boot sector for the word
  9844                                  		; AA55h. if the signature is not present, we examine the media
  9845                                  		; descriptor byte to see if it is valid. for dos 3.3, this
  9846                                  		; logic is modified a little bit. we are not going to check
  9847                                  		; signature. instead we are going to sanity check the media
  9848                                  		; byte in bpb regardless of the validity of signature. this is
  9849                                  		; to save the already developed commercial products that have
  9850                                  		; good jump instruction and signature but with the false bpb
  9851                                  		; informations
  9852                                  
  9853                                  ; that will crash the diskette drive operation. (for example, symphony diskette).
  9854                                  
  9855                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9856 000006B8 803E[4E01]69            		cmp	byte [disksector], 69h ; is it a direct jump?
  9857 000006BD 7415                    		jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; don't need to find a nop
  9858 000006BF 803E[4E01]E9            		cmp	byte [disksector], 0E9h ; dos 2.0 jump?
  9859 000006C4 740E                    		jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; no need for	nop
  9860 000006C6 803E[4E01]EB            		cmp	byte [disksector], 0EBh ; how about a short jump?
  9861 000006CB 7531                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
  9862 000006CD 803E[5001]90            		cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
  9863 000006D2 752A                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
  9864                                  
  9865                                  ; 15/10/5022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  9866                                  ;
  9867                                  ;; 10/03/2019
  9868                                  ;; (MSDOS 3.3, MSDISK.ASM, 1988)
  9869                                  ;;
  9870                                  ;; Don't have to perform the following signature check since
  9871                                  ;; we need to check the media byte even with the good signatured diskette.
  9872                                  ;;
  9873                                  ;;check_signature:
  9874                                  ;;		cmp	word [cs:disksector+1FEh],0AA55h ; see if non-ibm
  9875                                  ;;							 ; disk or 1.x media.
  9876                                  ;;		jz	short checksinglesided ; go see if singled sided medium.
  9877                                  ;;					       ; may need some special handling
  9878                                  
  9879                                  ; check for non-ibm disks which do not have the signature AA55h at the
  9880                                  ; end of the boot sector, but still have a valid boot sector. this is done
  9881                                  ; by examining the media descriptor in the boot sector.
  9882                                  
  9883                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9884                                  check_bpb_mediabyte:			
  9885 000006D4 A0[6301]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
  9886                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
  9887 000006D7 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h
  9888 000006D9 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; allow	for strange media
  9889 000006DB 7521                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
  9890                                  
  9891                                  ; there were some (apparently a lot of them) diskettes that had been formatted
  9892                                  ; under dos 3.1 and earlier versions which have invalid bpbs in their boot
  9893                                  ; sectors. these are specifically diskettes that were formatted in drives
  9894                                  ; with one head, or whose side 0 was bad. these contain bpbs in the boot
  9895                                  ; sector that have the sec/clus field set to 2 instead of 1, as is standard
  9896                                  ; in dos. in order to support them, we have to introduce a "hack" that will
  9897                                  ; help our build bpb routine to recognise these specific cases, and to
  9898                                  ; set up out copy of the bpb accordingly.
  9899                                  ; we do this by checking to see if the boot sector is off a diskette that
  9900                                  ; is single-sided and is a pre-dos 3.20 diskette. if it is, we set the
  9901                                  ; sec/clus field to 1. if not, we carry on as normal.
  9902                                  
  9903                                  checksinglesided:
  9904 000006DD A0[6301]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
  9905 000006E0 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h
  9906 000006E2 741B                    		jz	short gooddsk
  9907 000006E4 A801                    		test	al, 1
  9908 000006E6 7517                    		jnz	short gooddsk
  9909 000006E8 813E[5601]332E          		cmp	word [disksector+8], 2E33h ; "3."
  9910 000006EE 7507                    		jnz	short mustbeearlier
  9911 000006F0 803E[5801]32            		cmp	byte [disksector+0Ah], 32h ; "2"
  9912 000006F5 7308                    		jnb	short gooddsk
  9913                                  
  9914                                  ; we must have a pre-3.20 diskette. set the sec/clus field to 1
  9915                                  
  9916                                  mustbeearlier:				
  9917 000006F7 C606[5B01]01            		mov	byte [disksector+0Dh], 1
  9918                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
  9919 000006FC EB01                    		jmp	short gooddsk
  9920                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9921                                  
  9922                                  invalidbootsec:				
  9923 000006FE 43                      		inc	bx		; indicate that boot sector invalid
  9924                                  		; 10/12/2022
  9925                                  movbpb_ret:
  9926                                  gooddsk:				
  9927 000006FF F8                      		clc
  9928                                  err_ret:
  9929 00000700 C3                      		retn
  9930                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9931                                  
  9932                                  		; 10/12/2022
  9933                                  ;err_ret:				
  9934                                  		;retn
  9935                                  
  9936                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9937                                  
  9938                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9939                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9940                                  ; 'movbpb' moves the bpb read from the boot sector into registers for use by
  9941                                  ; getbp routine at has1
  9942                                  ;
  9943                                  ; if the set_id_flag is 1, and if an extended boot record, then set volume
  9944                                  ; serial number, volume label, file system id in bds according to
  9945                                  ; the boot record.  after that, this routine will set the set_id_flag to 2
  9946                                  ; to signal that volume label is set already from the extended boot record
  9947                                  ; (so, don't set it again by calling "set_volume_id" routine which uses
  9948                                  ; the volume label in the root directory.)
  9949                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9950                                  
  9951                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  9952                                  
  9953                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9954                                  movbpb:	
  9955 00000701 8A36[5B01]              		mov	dh, [disksector+0Dh]
  9956                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
  9957                                  					; sectors per unit
  9958 00000705 8A3E[5F01]              		mov	bh, [disksector+11h]
  9959                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.ROOTENTRIES]
  9960                                  					; number of directory entries
  9961 00000709 8B0E[6101]              		mov	cx, [disksector+13h]
  9962                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.TOTALSECTORS]
  9963                                  					; size of drive
  9964 0000070D 8A26[6301]              		mov	ah, [disksector+15h]
  9965                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
  9966                                  					; media	descriptor
  9967 00000711 A0[6401]                		mov	al, [disksector+16h];
  9968                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERFAT]
  9969                                  					; number of fat	sectors
  9970 00000714 8A1E[6601]              		mov	bl, [disksector+18h]
  9971                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERTRACK]
  9972                                  					; sectors per track
  9973 00000718 8A16[6801]              		mov	dl, [disksector+1Ah]
  9974                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.HEADS]
  9975                                  					; number of heads
  9976 0000071C 803E[0A05]01            		cmp	byte [set_id_flag], 1 ; called by get_bpb?
  9977 00000721 75DC                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
  9978 00000723 E81200                  		call	mov_media_ids
  9979 00000726 7205                    		jb	short movbpb_conv ; conventional boot record?
  9980 00000728 C606[0A05]02            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 2 ; signals that volume id is set
  9981                                  movbpb_conv:				
  9982 0000072D 803E[7700]01            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 1
  9983 00000732 75CB                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
  9984 00000734 E8D411                  		call	resetchanged	; reset	flags in bds to	not fchanged.
  9985                                  		; 10/12/2022
  9986                                  		; cf = 0
  9987                                  ;movbpb_ret:				
  9988                                  		;clc
  9989 00000737 C3                      		retn
  9990                                  
  9991                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9992                                  
  9993                                  ;copy the boot_serial number, volume id, and filesystem id from the
  9994                                  ;***extended boot record*** in ds:disksector to the bds table pointed
  9995                                  ;by es:di.
  9996                                  
  9997                                  ;in.) es:di -> bds
  9998                                  ;     ds:disksector = valid extended boot record.
  9999                                  ;out.) vol_serial, bds_volid and bds_system_id in bds are set according to
 10000                                  ;      the boot record information.
 10001                                  ;     carry flag set if not an extended bpb.
 10002                                  ;     all registers saved except the flag.
 10003                                  
 10004                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10005                                  mov_media_ids:		
 10006 00000738 803E[7401]29            		cmp	byte [disksector+26h], 29h
 10007                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SIG],
 10008                                  					; EXT_BOOT_SIGNATURE
 10009 0000073D 752C                    		jnz	short mmi_not_ext
 10010 0000073F 51                      		push	cx
 10011 00000740 8B0E[7501]              		mov	cx, [disksector+27h]
 10012                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL]
 10013 00000744 26894D57                		mov	[es:di+57h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial]
 10014 00000748 8B0E[7701]              		mov	cx, [disksector+29h]
 10015                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL+2]
 10016 0000074C 26894D59                		mov	[es:di+59h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial+2]
 10017 00000750 57                      		push	di
 10018 00000751 56                      		push	si
 10019 00000752 B90B00                  		mov	cx, 11		; size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 10020 00000755 BE[7901]                		mov	si, disksector+2Bh
 10021                                  		;mov	si, (offset disksector+2Bh) ;
 10022                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.VOL_LABEL
 10023 00000758 83C74B                  		add	di, 75		; BDS.volid
 10024 0000075B F3A4                    		rep movsb
 10025                                  		;mov	cx, 8		; size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID
 10026                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10027 0000075D B108                    		mov	cl, 8 ; cx = 8
 10028 0000075F BE[8401]                		mov	si, disksector+36h
 10029                                  		;mov	si, (offset disksector+36h) ; disksector+EXT_BOOT.SYSTEM_ID
 10030 00000762 83C705                  		add	di, 5		; (BDS.filesys_id-BDS.volid)-size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 10031 00000765 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 10032 00000767 5E                      		pop	si
 10033 00000768 5F                      		pop	di
 10034 00000769 59                      		pop	cx
 10035                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10036                                  		; cf = 0
 10037                                  		;clc		; this clc is not required (16/06/2019 - Erdogan Tan)
 10038                                  				; (20/09/2022)
 10039 0000076A C3                      		retn
 10040                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10041                                  
 10042                                  mmi_not_ext:				
 10043 0000076B F9                      		stc
 10044 0000076C C3                      		retn

 10046                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10047                                  
 10048                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10049                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 10050                                  ; read in the fat sector and get the media byte from it.
 10051                                  ; input : es:di -> bds
 10052                                  ; output:
 10053                                  ;	  carry set if an error occurs, ax contains error code.
 10054                                  ;	  otherwise, ah contains media byte on exit
 10055                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 10056                                  
 10057                                  readfat:	
 10058                                  		;mov	dh, 0
 10059                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10060 0000076D 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
 10061 0000076F B90200                  		mov	cx, 2		; head 0
 10062                                  					; cylinder 0, sector 2
 10063 00000772 E80500                  		call	read_sector
 10064 00000775 7202                    		jb	short bad_fat_ret
 10065 00000777 8A27                    		mov	ah, [bx]	; media	byte
 10066                                  bad_fat_ret:				
 10067 00000779 C3                      		retn
 10068                                  
 10069                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10070                                  
 10071                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10072                                  
 10073                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10074                                  ; read a single sector into the temp buffer.
 10075                                  ; perform three retries in case of error.
 10076                                  ;   inputs:	es:[di].bds_drivenum has physical drive to use
 10077                                  ;		cx has sector and cylinder
 10078                                  ;		dh has head
 10079                                  ;		es:di has bds
 10080                                  ;		ds has Bios_Data
 10081                                  ;
 10082                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear
 10083                                  ;		    Bios_Data:bx point to sector
 10084                                  ;		       (note: some callers assume location of buffer)
 10085                                  ;
 10086                                  ;		carry set
 10087                                  ;		    ax has rom error code
 10088                                  ;
 10089                                  ; register bp is preserved.
 10090                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10091                                  
 10092                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10093                                  
 10094                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10095                                  read_sector:	
 10096 0000077A 55                      		push	bp
 10097 0000077B BD0300                  		mov	bp, 3		; make 3 attempts
 10098 0000077E 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10099 00000782 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector	; get es:bx to point to	buffer
 10100                                  rd_ret:					
 10101 00000785 06                      		push	es
 10102 00000786 1E                      		push	ds
 10103 00000787 07                      		pop	es
 10104 00000788 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10105 0000078B CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10106                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10107                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10108                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10109 0000078D 07                      		pop	es
 10110 0000078E 734A                    		jnb	short okret2
 10111                                  rd_rty:					
 10112 00000790 E87604                  		call	again		; reset	disk, decrement	bp, preserve ax
 10113 00000793 7442                    		jz	short err_rd_ret
 10114 00000795 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 10115                                  		;test	byte ptr [es:di+23h], 1	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10116                                  					; fnon_removable
 10117 0000079A 75E9                    		jnz	short rd_ret
 10118 0000079C 803E[3806]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10119 000007A1 7510                    		jnz	short rd_skip1_dpt
 10120 000007A3 50                      		push	ax
 10121 000007A4 1E                      		push	ds		; for retry, set the head settle time to 0Fh
 10122 000007A5 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 10123                                  		;mov	al, [si+9]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10124                                  		;mov	byte [si+9], 15 ; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10125                                  		;			; NORMSETTLE
 10126                                  		; 12/12/2022
 10127 000007A9 B00F                    		mov	al, 15
 10128 000007AB 864409                  		xchg	al, [si+9]
 10129                                  		; 
 10130 000007AE 1F                      		pop	ds
 10131 000007AF A2[2A01]                		mov	[save_head_sttl], al
 10132 000007B2 58                      		pop	ax
 10133                                  rd_skip1_dpt:				
 10134 000007B3 06                      		push	es
 10135 000007B4 1E                      		push	ds
 10136 000007B5 07                      		pop	es
 10137 000007B6 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10138 000007B9 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10139                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10140                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10141                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10142 000007BB 07                      		pop	es
 10143 000007BC 9C                      		pushf
 10144 000007BD 803E[3806]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10145 000007C2 750E                    		jnz	short rd_skip2_dpt
 10146 000007C4 50                      		push	ax
 10147 000007C5 A0[2A01]                		mov	al, [save_head_sttl]
 10148 000007C8 1E                      		push	ds
 10149 000007C9 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 10150 000007CD 884409                  		mov	[si+9],	al	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10151 000007D0 1F                      		pop	ds
 10152 000007D1 58                      		pop	ax
 10153                                  rd_skip2_dpt:				
 10154 000007D2 9D                      		popf
 10155 000007D3 7305                    		jnb	short okret2
 10156 000007D5 EBB9                    		jmp	short rd_rty
 10157                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10158                                  
 10159                                  err_rd_ret:				
 10160 000007D7 B2FF                    		mov	dl, 0FFh	; make sure we ask rom if media	has changed
 10161                                  					; return error
 10162 000007D9 F9                      		stc
 10163                                  
 10164                                  ; update information pertaining to last drive accessed, time of access, last
 10165                                  ; track accessed in that drive.
 10166                                  
 10167                                  okret2:					
 10168 000007DA 8816[7600]              		mov	[step_drv], dl	; set up for head settle logic in disk
 10169 000007DE 8816[1E01]              		mov	[tim_drv], dl	; save drive last accessed

 10267                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================

 10269                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10270                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10271                                  
 10272                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------
 10273                                  ; miscellaneous odd jump routines. 
 10274                                  ; moved out of mainline for speed.
 10275                                  
 10276                                  ; if we have a system where we have virtual drives, we need 
 10277                                  ; to prompt the user to place the correct disk in the drive.
 10278                                  ;
 10279                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds:->Bios_Data
 10280                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------
 10281                                  
 10282                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10283                                  checksingle:		
 10284 0000083C 50                      		push	ax
 10285 0000083D 53                      		push	bx
 10286 0000083E 268B5D23                		mov	bx, [es:di+23h]	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10287                                  
 10288                                  ; if hard drive, cannot change disk.
 10289                                  ; if current owner of physical drive, no need to change diskette.
 10290                                  
 10291 00000842 F6C321                  		test	bl, 21h		; fnon_removable|fi_own_physical
 10292 00000845 7573                    		jnz	short singleret
 10293 00000847 F6C310                  		test	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 10294                                  					; is there a drive sharing this	physical drive?
 10295 0000084A 746E                    		jz	short singleret
 10296                                  
 10297                                  
 10298                                  ; look for the previous owner of this physical drive
 10299                                  ; and reset its ownership flag.
 10300                                  
 10301 0000084C 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10302                                  					; get physical drive number
 10303 00000850 06                      		push	es		; preserve pointer to current bds
 10304 00000851 57                      		push	di
 10305 00000852 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; get first bds
 10306                                  scan_list:				
 10307 00000856 26384504                		cmp	[es:di+4], al
 10308 0000085A 7553                    		jnz	short scan_skip	; Not our drive. Try next bds.
 10309 0000085C B320                    		mov	bl, 20h	; ' '   ; fi_own_physical ; test ownership flag
 10310 0000085E 26845D23                		test	[es:di+23h], bl
 10311 00000862 744B                    		jz	short scan_skip	; he doesn't own it either. continue
 10312 00000864 26305D23                		xor	[es:di+23h], bl	; reset	ownership flag
 10313 00000868 5F                      		pop	di		; restore pointer to current bds
 10314 00000869 07                      		pop	es
 10315 0000086A 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; ; set	ownership flag
 10316                                  
 10317                                  ; we examine the fsetowner flag. if it is set, then we are using the code in
 10318                                  ; checksingle to just set the owner of a drive. we must not issue the prompt
 10319                                  ; in this case.
 10320 0000086E 803E[7A00]01            		cmp	byte [fsetowner], 1
 10321 00000873 7517                    		jnz	short not_fsetowner
 10322                                  		;cmp	byte ptr es:[di+4], 0 ;	are we handling	drive number 0 ?
 10323 00000875 26807D0400              		cmp	byte [es:di+4], 0
 10324 0000087A 753E                    		jnz	short singleret
 10325 0000087C 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]
 10326                                  		;mov	al, es:[di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet]
 10327                                  					; get the DOS drive letter
 10328 00000880 06                      		push	es
 10329 00000881 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 10330 00000885 26A20405                		mov	[es:LSTDRV], al
 10331                                  		;mov	es:504h, al	; [es:LSTDRV]
 10332                                  					; set up sdsb
 10333 00000889 07                      		pop	es		; restore bds pointer
 10334 0000088A EB2E                    		jmp	short singleret
 10335                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10336                                  
 10337                                  ; to support "backward" compatibility with ibm's "single drive status byte"
 10338                                  ; we now check to see if we are in a single drive system and the application
 10339                                  ; has "cleverly" diddled the sdsb
 10340                                  
 10341                                  not_fsetowner:				
 10342 0000088C 803E[7800]02            		cmp	byte [single], 2 ; if (single_drive_system)
 10343 00000891 7517                    		jnz	short ignore_sdsb
 10344 00000893 50                      		push	ax
 10345 00000894 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; if (curr_drv == req_drv)
 10346 00000898 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 10347 0000089A 06                      		push	es
 10348 0000089B 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 10349 0000089F 2686060405              		xchg	al, [es:LSTDRV]
 10350                                  		;xchg	al, es:504h	; [es:LSTDRV]
 10351                                  					; then swap(curr_drv,req_drv)
 10352 000008A4 07                      		pop	es
 10353 000008A5 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; else
 10354 000008A7 58                      		pop	ax		; swap(curr_drv,req_drv)
 10355 000008A8 7410                    		jz	short singleret	; issue	swap_dsk_msg
 10356                                  ignore_sdsb:				
 10357 000008AA E8800E                  		call	swpdsk
 10358 000008AD EB0B                    		jmp	short singleret
 10359                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10360                                  
 10361                                  scan_skip:	
 10362 000008AF 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]			
 10363                                  		;les	di, es:[di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 10364                                  					; go to	next bds
 10365 000008B2 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; end of list?
 10366 000008B5 759F                    		jnz	short scan_list	; ontinue until	hit end	of list
 10367 000008B7 F9                      		stc
 10368 000008B8 5F                      		pop	di		; restore current bds
 10369 000008B9 07                      		pop	es
 10370                                  
 10371                                  singleret:				
 10372 000008BA 5B                      		pop	bx
 10373 000008BB 58                      		pop	ax
 10374 000008BC C3                      		retn

 10377                                  
 10378                                  baddrive:				
 10379 000008BD B008                    		mov	al, 8		; sector not found
 10380 000008BF EB02                    		jmp	short baddrive_ret
 10381                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10382                                  
 10383                                  unformatteddrive:				
 10384 000008C1 B007                    		mov	al, 7		; unknown media

 10392                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10393                                  
 10394                                  ; 15/10/52022
 10395                                  
 10396                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10397                                  ;	disk i/o handler
 10398                                  ;
 10399                                  ;	al = drive number (0-6)
 10400                                  ;	ah = media descriptor
 10401                                  ;	cx = sector count
 10402                                  ;	dx = first sector (low)
 10403                                  ;	[start_sec_h] = first sector (high)  32 bit calculation.
 10404                                  ;	ds = cs
 10405                                  ;	es:di = transfer address
 10406                                  ;	[rflag]=operation (2=read, 3=write)
 10407                                  ;	[verify]=1 for verify after write
 10408                                  ;
 10409                                  ;	if successful carry flag = 0
 10410                                  ;	  else cf=1 and al contains error code
 10411                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10412                                  
 10413                                  diskrd:	
 10414                                  		;mov	ds:rflag, 2	; romread
 10415                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10416 000008C5 C606[2001]02            		mov	byte [rflag], 2 ; romread
 10417                                  
 10418                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10419                                  
 10420                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10421                                  diskio:
 10422 000008CA 89FB                    		mov	bx, di		; es:bx	= transfer address
 10423 000008CC 8C06[3705]              		mov	[xfer_seg], es	; save transfer	segment
 10424 000008D0 E8F8FB                  		call	SetDrive
 10425 000008D3 268A4510                		mov	al, [es:di+10h]	; [es:di+BDS.media]
 10426 000008D7 A2[1F01]                		mov	[medbyt], al
 10427                                  		;jcxz	short ioret
 10428 000008DA E3E8                    		jcxz	ioret
 10429                                  
 10430                                  ; see if the media is formatted or not by checking the flags field in
 10431                                  ; in the bds. if it is unformatted we cannot allow i/o, so we should
 10432                                  ; go to the error exit at label unformatteddrive.
 10433                                  
 10434 000008DC 26F6452402              		test	byte [es:di+24h], 2
 10435                                  		;test	byte ptr es:[di+24h], 2	; [es:di+BDS.flags+1]
 10436                                  					; unformatted_media
 10437 000008E1 75DE                    		jnz	short unformatteddrive
 10438 000008E3 890E[2201]              		mov	[seccnt], cx	; save sector count
 10439 000008E7 8926[3501]              		mov	[spsav], sp	; save sp
 10440                                  
 10441                                  ; ensure that we are trying to access valid sectors on the drive
 10442                                  
 10443 000008EB 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
 10444 000008ED 31F6                    		xor	si, si
 10445 000008EF 01CA                    		add	dx, cx
 10446 000008F1 83D600                  		adc	si, 0
 10447 000008F4 26837D0E00              		cmp	word [es:di+0Eh], 0 ; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs16]
 10448                                  					; > 32 bit sector ?
 10449 000008F9 740D                    		jz	short sanity32
 10450 000008FB 83FE00                  		cmp	si, 0
 10451 000008FE 75BD                    		jnz	short baddrive
 10452 00000900 263B550E                		cmp	dx, [es:di+0Eh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs16]
 10453 00000904 77B7                    		ja	short baddrive
 10454 00000906 EB12                    		jmp	short sanityok
 10455                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10456                                  
 10457                                  sanity32:				
 10458 00000908 0336[2B05]              		add	si, [start_sec_h]
 10459 0000090C 263B751D                		cmp	si, [es:di+1Dh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
 10460 00000910 7208                    		jb	short sanityok
 10461 00000912 77A9                    		ja	short baddrive
 10462 00000914 263B551B                		cmp	dx, [es:di+1Bh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32]
 10463 00000918 77A3                    		ja	short baddrive
 10464                                  
 10465                                  sanityok:				
 10466 0000091A 8B16[2B05]              		mov	dx, [start_sec_h]
 10467 0000091E 26034517                		add	ax, [es:di+17h]	; [es:di+BDS.hiddensecs]
 10468 00000922 26135519                		adc	dx, [es:di+19h]	; [es:di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
 10469                                  
 10470                                  ; now dx;ax have the physical first sector.
 10471                                  ; since the following procedures is going to destroy ax, let's
 10472                                  ; save it temporarily to saved_word.
 10473                                  
 10474 00000926 A3[2D05]                		mov	[saved_word], ax ; save the sector number (low)
 10475                                  
 10476                                  ; set up pointer to disk base table in [dpt]. we cannot assume that iosetup
 10477                                  ; will do it because we will skip the set up stuff with hard disks.
 10478                                  
 10479 00000929 06                      		push	es
 10480 0000092A 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 10481 0000092E 26C4367800              		les	si, [es:DSKADR]
 10482                                  		;les	si, es:78h	; [es:DSKADR]
 10483                                  					; current disk parm table
 10484 00000933 8936[2D01]              		mov	[dpt], si
 10485 00000937 8C06[2F01]              		mov	[dpt+2], es
 10486 0000093B 07                      		pop	es
 10487 0000093C 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10488                                  					; fnon_removable
 10489 00000941 7510                    		jnz	short skip_setup
 10490 00000943 E8F6FE                  		call	checksingle
 10491                                  
 10492                                  ; check to see if we have previously noted a change line. the routine
 10493                                  ; returns if everything is ok. otherwise, it pops off the stack and returns
 10494                                  ; the proper error code.
 10495                                  
 10496 00000946 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0 ; do we have changeline support?
 10497 0000094B 7403                    		jz	short diskio_nochangeline ; brif not
 10498 0000094D E8AB0E                  		call	checklatchio	; will do a sneaky pop stack return
 10499                                  					; if a disk error occurs
 10500                                  diskio_nochangeline:			
 10501 00000950 E84700                  		call	iosetup		; set up tables	and variables for i/o
 10502                                  
 10503                                  ; now the settle values are correct for the following code
 10504                                  
 10505                                  skip_setup:
 10506                                  
 10507                                  ; 32 bit sector calculation.
 10508                                  ; dx:[saved_word] = starting sector number.
 10509                                  				
 10510 00000953 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
 10511 00000955 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 10512 00000957 26F77513                		div	word [es:di+13h] ; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 10513                                  					 ; divide by sec per track
 10514 0000095B A3[2905]                		mov	[temp_h], ax
 10515 0000095E A1[2D05]                		mov	ax, [saved_word]
 10516 00000961 26F77513                		div	word [es:di+13h] ; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 10517                                  					; now, [temp_h]:ax = track #, dx = sector
 10518                                  		;inc	dl		; sector number	is 1 based.
 10519                                  		; 18/12/2022
 10520 00000965 42                      		inc	dx
 10521 00000966 8816[3101]              		mov	[cursec], dl	; save current sector
 10522 0000096A 268B4D15                		mov	cx, [es:di+15h]	; es:di+BDS.heads]
 10523                                  					; get number of	heads
 10524 0000096E 50                      		push	ax
 10525 0000096F 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 10526 00000971 A1[2905]                		mov	ax, [temp_h]	; divide tracks	by heads per cylinder
 10527 00000974 F7F1                    		div	cx
 10528 00000976 A3[2905]                		mov	[temp_h], ax
 10529 00000979 58                      		pop	ax
 10530 0000097A F7F1                    		div	cx		; now, [temp_h]:ax = cylinder #, dx = head
 10531 0000097C 833E[2905]00            		cmp	word [temp_h], 0
 10532 00000981 7714                    		ja	short baddrive_brdg
 10533 00000983 3D0004                  		cmp	ax, 1024	; 2^10 currently maxium	for track #.
 10534 00000986 770F                    		ja	short baddrive_brdg
 10535 00000988 8816[3201]              		mov	[curhd], dl	; save current head
 10536 0000098C A3[3301]                		mov	[curtrk], ax	; save current track
 10537                                  
 10538                                  ; we are now set up for the i/o. normally, we consider the dma boundary
 10539                                  ; violations here. not true. we perform the operation as if everything is
 10540                                  ; symmetric; let the int 13 handler worry about the dma violations.
 10541                                  
 10542 0000098F A1[2201]                		mov	ax, [seccnt]
 10543 00000992 E88400                  		call	block		; (cas - call/ret)
 10544                                  		;call	done
 10545                                  		;retn
 10546                                  		; 18/12/2022
 10547 00000995 EB4B                    		jmp	done
 10548                                  
 10549                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10550                                  
 10551                                  baddrive_brdg:				
 10552 00000997 E923FF                  		jmp	baddrive
 10553                                  
 10554                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10555                                  
 10556                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 10557                                  ; set the drive-last-accessed flag for diskette only. 
 10558                                  ; we know that the hard disk will not be removed.
 10559                                  ; es:di -> current bds.
 10560                                  ; ds -> Bios_Data
 10561                                  ; ax,cx,si are destroyed.
 10562                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 10563                                  
 10564                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10565                                  iosetup:	
 10566 0000099A 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10567 0000099E A2[1E01]                		mov	[tim_drv], al	; save drive letter
 10568                                  
 10569                                  ; determine proper head settle values
 10570                                  
 10571 000009A1 803E[3806]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10572 000009A6 7539                    		jnz	short skip_dpt_setting
 10573 000009A8 A0[2C01]                		mov	al, [eot]	; fetch	up eot before changing ds
 10574 000009AB 1E                      		push	ds
 10575 000009AC C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]	; get pointer to disk base table
 10576 000009B0 884404                  		mov	[si+4],	al
 10577 000009B3 8A440A                  		mov	al, [si+10]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_MOTOR_STRT]
 10578 000009B6 8A6404                  		mov	ah, [si+4]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_EOT]
 10579 000009B9 1F                      		pop	ds
 10580 000009BA A2[2601]                		mov	[motorstartup], al
 10581 000009BD 8826[2B01]              		mov	[save_eot], ah
 10582                                  
 10583                                  ; for 3.5" drives, both external as well as on the k09, we need to set the
 10584                                  ; motor start time to 4. this checking for every i/o is going to affect
 10585                                  ; performance across the board, but is necessary!!
 10586                                  
 10587 000009C1 1E                      		push	ds
 10588 000009C2 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]	; get pointer to disk base table
 10589 000009C6 26807D2202              		cmp	byte [es:di+22h], 2 ; [es:di+BDS.formfactor]
 10590                                  					; ffSmall
 10591 000009CB 7505                    		jnz	short motor_start_ok
 10592 000009CD B004                    		mov	al, 4
 10593 000009CF 86440A                  		xchg	al, [si+10]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_MOTOR_STRT]
 10594                                  motor_start_ok:
 10595                                  
 10596                                  ; ds:si now points to disk parameter table.
 10597                                  ; get current settle and set fast settle
 10598                                  				
 10599                                  		;xor	al, al
 10600                                  		;inc	al		; ibm wants fast settle	to be 1
 10601                                  		; 18/12/2022
 10602 000009D2 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax

 11040                                  done_set2:		; 12/12/2022
 11041 00000C07 58                      		pop	ax
 11042 00000C08 C3                      		retn
 11043                                  
 11044                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 11045                                  
 11046                                  ; this routine is called if an error occurs while formatting or verifying.
 11047                                  ; it resets the drive,and decrements the retry count.
 11048                                  ; on entry - ds:di - points to bds for the drive
 11049                                  ;	     bp    - contains retry count
 11050                                  ; on exit    flags indicate result of decrementing retry count
 11051                                  
 11052                                  again:	
 11053 00000C09 E87004                  		call	ResetDisk
 11054 00000C0C 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6
 11055 00000C0F 7402                    		jz	short dont_dec_retry_count ; If	it is a	media change error
 11056                                  					; do not decrement retry count.
 11057 00000C11 4D                      		dec	bp		; decrement retry count
 11058 00000C12 C3                      		retn
 11059                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11060                                  
 11061                                  dont_dec_retry_count:			
 11062 00000C13 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 11063 00000C15 C3                      		retn

 11078                                  ;      This function is intended to give the user to control the
 11079                                  ;      bds table flags of unformatted_media bit.
 11080                                  ;      GetAccessFlag will show the status -

 11169                                  ; ==========================================================================
 11170                                  ; Do_Generic_IOCtl: perform generic ioctl request
 11171                                  ;
 11172                                  ;    input: AL contains logical drive
 11173                                  ;
 11174                                  ;	functions are dispatched through a call. On return, carry indicates
 11175                                  ;	error code in al. Note::bES:b& ds undefined on return from
 11176                                  ;	subfunctions.
 11177                                  ;
 11178                                  ; ==========================================================================
 11179                                  
 11180                                  ; 11/03/2019
 11181                                  		; 19/10/2022
 11182                                  do_generic_ioctl:			; 2C7h:0C6Bh = 70h:31DBh
 11183 00000C46 E882F8                  		call	SetDrive	; ES:DI	Points to bds for drive
 11184 00000C49 06                      		push	es
 11185 00000C4A C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]	; ES:BX	Points to request header
 11186 00000C4E 26807F0D08              		cmp	byte [es:bx+0Dh], 8 ; [es:bx+IOCTL_REQ.MAJORFUNCTION]
 11187                                  					; RAWIO
 11188 00000C53 268A470E                		mov	al, [es:bx+0Eh]	; [es:bx+IOCTL_REQ.MINORFUNCTION]
 11189 00000C57 07                      		pop	es
 11190 00000C58 7525                    		jnz	short IoctlFuncErr
 11191                                  
 11192                                  		; cas note: Could do the above two blocks in reverse order.
 11193                                  		; Would have to preserve al for SetDrive
 11194                                  
 11195                                  		; 10/12/2022
 11196 00000C5A BE[170C]                		mov	si, IoReadJumpTable
 11197                                  		;mov	si, 0C3Ch	; IoReadJumpTable
 11198                                  					; at 2C7h:0C3Ch	= 70h:31ACh
 11199 00000C5D A820                    		test	al, 20h		; GEN_IOCTL_FN_TST ; test of req. function
 11200 00000C5F 7503                    		jnz	short NotGenericWrite ; function is a read.
 11201                                  		; 10/12/2022
 11202 00000C61 BE[2A0C]                		mov	si, IoWriteJumpTable
 11203                                  		;mov	si, 0C4Fh	; IoWriteJumpTable
 11204                                  					; at 2C7h:0C4Fh	= 70h:31BFh
 11205                                  NotGenericWrite:			
 11206 00000C64 24DF                    		and	al, 0DFh	; ~GEN_IOCTL_FN_TST ; get rid of read/write bit
 11207 00000C66 2C40                    		sub	al, 40h		; offset for base function
 11208 00000C68 2E3A04                  		cmp	al, [cs:si]
 11209 00000C6B 7712                    		ja	short IoctlFuncErr
 11210 00000C6D 98                      		cbw
 11211 00000C6E D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
 11212 00000C70 46                      		inc	si
 11213 00000C71 01C6                    		add	si, ax
 11214 00000C73 2EFF14                  		call	near [cs:si]
 11215                                  		;call	word ptr cs:[si]
 11216 00000C76 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 11217                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 11218                                  					; 2C7h:30h = 70h:25A0h
 11219 00000C7B B481                    		mov	ah, 81h		; Return this status in	case of	carry
 11220 00000C7D C3                      		retn			; Pass carry flag through to exit code
 11221                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11222                                  
 11223                                  		; Cmd_Error_Proc is called as a procedure and also use
 11224                                  		; as a fall through from above
 11225                                  Cmd_Error_Proc:				; 2C7h:0CA3h = 70h:3213h

 11237                                  ;	GetDeviceParameters implements the generic ioctl function:
 11238                                  ;	majorcode=RAWIO, minorcode=GetDeviceParameters (60h)
 11239                                  ;
 11240                                  ;	ENTRY	(ES:di) = BDS for drive
 11241                                  ;		PtrSav = long pointer to request header

 11249

 11263                                  					
 11264                                  		; copy recommended bpb

 11279                                  					; Use this subfield of bds instead

 11456                                  ; ==========================================================================
 11457                                  ; FormatTrack:
 11458                                  ; if specialfunction byte is 1,then this is a status call to see if there is
 11459                                  ; rom support for the combination of sec/trk and # of cyln,and if the
 11460                                  ; combination is legal. if specialfunction byte is 0,then format the track.
 11461                                  ;
 11462                                  ; input: ES:di points to bds for drive
 11463                                  ;
 11464                                  ; output:
 11465                                  ;	for status call:
 11466                                  ;	specialfunction byte set to:
 11467                                  ;		0 - rom support + legal combination
 11468                                  ;		1 - no rom support
 11469                                  ;		2 - illegal combination
 11470                                  ;		3 - no media present
 11471                                  ;	carry cleared.
 11472                                  ;
 11473                                  ;	for format track:
 11474                                  ;		carry set if error
 11475                                  ;
 11476                                  ; ==========================================================================

 11478                                  ; 16/03/2019

 11627                                  
 11628                                  		; Check specialfunctions to see if DO_FAST_FORMAT has been
 11629                                  		; specified if not we should go to the normal track verification
 11630                                  		; routine. If fast format has been specified we should get the
 11631                                  		; number of tracks to be verified and check it to see if it is
 11632                                  		; > 255. If it is then it is an error and we should go to
 11633                                  		; VerifyTrack_Err. If not multiply the number of tracks by the
 11634                                  		; sectors per track to get the total number of sectors to be
 11635                                  		; verified. This should also be less than equal to 255
 11636                                  		; otherwise we go to same error exit. If everything is okay
 11637                                  		; we initalise cx to the total sectors. use ax as a temporary
 11638                                  		; register.

 11739                                  		; Fall into TrackIo
 11740                                  
 11741                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 11742                                  
 11743                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 11744                                  
 11745                                  ; ==========================================================================
 11746                                  ;
 11747                                  ; TrackIo:
 11748                                  ;    performs track read/write/verify
 11749                                  ;
 11750                                  ;   input:
 11751                                  ;      rFlag	- 2 = read
 11752                                  ;		  3 = write
 11753                                  ;		  4 = verify
 11754                                  ;      AX	- Index into track table of first sector to io
 11755                                  ;      CX	- Number of sectors to io
 11756                                  ;      Xfer_Seg:BX - Transfer address
 11757                                  ;      ES:DI	- Pointer to bds
 11758                                  ;      CurTrk	- Current cylinder
 11759                                  ;      CurHd	- Current head
 11760                                  ;
 11761                                  ; ==========================================================================
 11762                                  
 11763                                  ; 16/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 11764                                  		
 11765                                  		; 19/10/2022
 11766                                  TrackIo:	
 11767                                  					; Procedure `disk' will pop stack to
 11768 00000EF1 8926[3501]              		mov	[spsav], sp	; SpSav	and return if error
 11769 00000EF5 E844F9                  		call	checksingle	; Ensure correct disk is in drv
 11770 00000EF8 803E[3806]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1
 11771                                  					; See if we have already set	disk
 11772 00000EFD 7407                    		jz	short Dptalreadyset ; base table
 11773 00000EFF 50                      		push	ax		; set up tables	and variables for i/o
 11774 00000F00 51                      		push	cx
 11775 00000F01 E896FA                  		call	iosetup
 11776 00000F04 59                      		pop	cx
 11777 00000F05 58                      		pop	ax
 11778                                  Dptalreadyset:				; Point si at the table entry of the			
 11779 00000F06 BE[3B05]                		mov	si, tracktable	; first sector to be io'd
 11780 00000F09 D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
 11781 00000F0B D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
 11782 00000F0D 01C6                    		add	si, ax
 11783                                  
 11784                                  		; WE WANT:
 11785                                  		; CX to	be the number of times we have to loop
 11786                                  		; DX to	be the number of sectors we read on each iteration
 11787                                  		
 11788 00000F0F BA0100                  		mov	dx, 1
 11789                                  		; 12/12/2022
 11790 00000F12 26F6452308              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 8
 11791                                  		;test	word [es:di+35], 8 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 11792                                  					; good_tracklayout
 11793 00000F17 7402                    		jz	short ionextsector
 11794                                  		
 11795 00000F19 87D1                    		xchg	dx, cx		; HEY! We can read all secs in one blow
 11796                                  ionextsector:				
 11797 00000F1B 51                      		push	cx
 11798 00000F1C 52                      		push	dx
 11799 00000F1D 46                      		inc	si
 11800 00000F1E 46                      		inc	si		; Skip over the	cylinder and head in
 11801                                  					; the track table
 11802 00000F1F AC                      		lodsb			; Get sector ID	from track table
 11803 00000F20 A2[3101]                		mov	[cursec], al
 11804                                  
 11805                                  		; assumptions for a fixed disk multi-track disk	i/o
 11806                                  		; 1). In the input CX (# of sectors to go) to TrackIo,
 11807                                  		;     only CL is valid.
 11808                                  		; 2). Sector size should be set	to 512 bytes.
 11809                                  		; 3). Good track layout
 11810                                  		
 11811                                  		; 12/12/2022
 11812 00000F23 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 11813                                  		;test	word [es:di+35], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 11814                                  					; fnon_removable ; Fixed disk?
 11815 00000F28 7414                    		jz	short IoRemovable ; No
 11816                                  		; 12/12/2022
 11817 00000F2A F606[2F05]80            		test	byte [multrk_flag], 80h
 11818                                  		;test	word [multrk_flag], 80h ; MULTI_TRK_ON
 11819                                  						; Allow multi-track operation?
 11820 00000F2F 740D                    		jz	short IoRemovable ; No,don't do that.
 11821 00000F31 8916[2201]              		mov	[seccnt], dx
 11822 00000F35 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
 11823 00000F37 E81DFB                  		call	Disk
 11824 00000F3A 5A                      		pop	dx
 11825 00000F3B 59                      		pop	cx
 11826 00000F3C F8                      		clc
 11827 00000F3D C3                      		retn
 11828                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11829                                  
 11830                                  IoRemovable:				
 11831 00000F3E AC                      		lodsb			; Get sector size index	from track
 11832                                  					; table	and save it
 11833 00000F3F 50                      		push	ax
 11834 00000F40 56                      		push	si
 11835 00000F41 1E                      		push	ds		; Save Bios_Data
 11836 00000F42 50                      		push	ax
 11837 00000F43 8A26[2C01]              		mov	ah, [eot]	; Preserve whatever might be in	ah
 11838                                  					; Fetch	EOT while ds-> Bios_Data
 11839 00000F47 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 11840 00000F4B 884403                  		mov	[si+3],	al	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_SECTOR_SIZ]
 11841 00000F4E 886404                  		mov	[si+4],	ah	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_EOT]
 11842 00000F51 58                      		pop	ax
 11843 00000F52 1F                      		pop	ds
 11844 00000F53 88D0                    		mov	al, dl
 11845 00000F55 A3[2201]                		mov	[seccnt], ax
 11846 00000F58 E8FCFA                  		call	Disk
 11847 00000F5B 5E                      		pop	si		; Advance buffer pointer by adding
 11848                                  					; sector size
 11849 00000F5C 58                      		pop	ax
 11850 00000F5D E81D00                  		call	SectorSizeIndexToSectorSize
 11851 00000F60 01C3                    		add	bx, ax
 11852 00000F62 5A                      		pop	dx
 11853 00000F63 59                      		pop	cx
 11854 00000F64 E2B5                    		loop	ionextsector
 11855 00000F66 803E[3806]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1
 11856                                  		;jz	short NoNeedDone
 11857                                  		; 12/12/2022
 11858 00000F6B 7404                    		je	short NoNeedDone2
 11859 00000F6D E872FA                  		call	done		; set time of last access, and reset
 11860                                  					; entries in Dpt.
 11861                                  NoNeedDone:				
 11862 00000F70 F8                      		clc
 11863                                  NoNeedDone2:
 11864 00000F71 C3                      		retn
 11865                                  
 11866                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 11867                                  
 11868                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11869                                  ;
 11870                                  ; The sector size in bytes needs to be converted to an index value for the ibm
 11871                                  ; rom. (0=>128,1=>256,2=>512,3=>1024). It is assumed that only these values
 11872                                  ; are permissible.
 11873                                  ;
 11874                                  ; On Input   AX contains sector size in bytes
 11875                                  ; On Output  AL Contains index
 11876                                  ; All other registers preserved
 11877                                  ;
 11878                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11879                                  
 11880                                  SectSizeToSectIndex:	
 11881 00000F72 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; (0=>128,1=>256,2=>512,3=>1024)
 11882                                  					; examine upper	byte only
 11883 00000F75 7703                    		ja	short OneK

 11885 00000F79 C3                      		retn

 11970                                  					; AL = disk type AL = 03h - high-capacity disk in high-capacity	drive
 11971                                  DasdHasBeenSet:

 11976                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 11977                                  
 11978                                  ; 16/10/2022
 11979                                  
 11980                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11981                                  ;
 11982                                  ; Set Media Type for Format
 11983                                  ; Performs the int 13 with ah = 18h to see if the medium described in the
 11984                                  ; BPB area in the BDS can be handled by the rom.
 11985                                  ; On Input, ES:DI -> current BDS.
 11986                                  ; The status of the operation is returned in AL
 11987                                  ;
 11988                                  ;	- 0 - if the support is available,and the combination is valid.
 11989                                  ;	- 1 - no rom support
 11990                                  ;	- 2 - illegal combination
 11991                                  ;	- 3 - no media present (rom support exists but cannot determine now)
 11992                                  ;
 11993                                  ; Flags also may be altered. All other registers preserved.
 11994                                  ; If the call to rom returns no error,then the current Dpt is "replaced" by
 11995                                  ; the one returned by the rom. This is Done by changing the pointer in [Dpt]
 11996                                  ; to the one returned. the original pointer to the disk base table is stored
 11997                                  ; in TempDpt, until it is restored.
 11998                                  ;
 11999                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12000                                  
 12001                                  		; 19/10/2022
 12002                                  SetMediaForFormat:	
 12003 00000FE6 51                      		push	cx
 12004 00000FE7 52                      		push	dx
 12005                                  
 12006                                  		; If we have a format error, then do not change Dpt, TempDpt.
 12007                                  		; but we need to call int 13h, ah=18h again.
 12008                                  
 12009 00000FE8 803E[3906]01            		cmp	byte [had_format_error], 1
 12010 00000FED 7425                    		jz	short SkipSaveDskAdr
 12011 00000FEF 30C0                    		xor	al, al		; If already done return 0
 12012 00000FF1 803E[3806]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1
 12013 00000FF6 7502                    		jnz	short DoSetMediaForFormat
 12014 00000FF8 EB7F                    		jmp	SetMediaRet	; Media	already	set
 12015                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12016                                  
 12017                                  DoSetMediaForFormat:			
 12018 00000FFA 06                      		push	es
 12019 00000FFB 56                      		push	si
 12020 00000FFC 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]	; Point to interrupt vectors
 12021 00001000 26C4367800              		les	si, [es:DSKADR]
 12022                                  		;les	si, es:78h	; [es:DSKADR]
 12023                                  					; Get pointer to disk base table
 12024 00001005 8936[2D01]              		mov	[dpt], si
 12025 00001009 8C06[2F01]              		mov	[dpt+2], es	; Save pointer to table
 12026                                  
 12027                                  		; Initialize the head settle time to 0Fh. See the offsets
 12028                                  		; given in dskprm.inc.
 12029                                  
 12030 0000100D 26C644090F              		mov	byte [es:si+9], 0Fh ; [es:si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 12031 00001012 5E                      		pop	si
 12032 00001013 07                      		pop	es
 12033                                  
 12034                                  SkipSaveDskAdr:				
 12035 00001014 268B4D25                		mov	cx, [es:di+25h]	; [es:di+BDS.cylinders]
 12036 00001018 49                      		dec	cx
 12037 00001019 80E503                  		and	ch, 3
 12038 0000101C D0CD                    		ror	ch, 1
 12039 0000101E D0CD                    		ror	ch, 1
 12040 00001020 86E9                    		xchg	ch, cl
 12041 00001022 260A4D13                		or	cl, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 12042 00001026 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 12043 0000102A 06                      		push	es
 12044 0000102B 1E                      		push	ds
 12045 0000102C 56                      		push	si
 12046 0000102D 57                      		push	di
 12047 0000102E B418                    		mov	ah, 18h
 12048 00001030 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - SET MEDIA TYPE	FOR FORMAT (AT model 3x9,XT2,XT286,PS)
 12049                                  					; DL = drive number, CH	= lower	8 bits of number of tracks, CL = sectors per track
 12050 00001032 7233                    		jb	short FormaStatErr
 12051 00001034 803E[3906]01            		cmp	byte [had_format_error], 1
 12052 00001039 7425                    		jz	short skip_disk_base_setting
 12053 0000103B 06                      		push	es		; Save segment returned	by the rom
 12054 0000103C 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]	; Point	to interrupt vector segment
 12055 00001040 26C4367800              		les	si, [es:DSKADR]
 12056                                  		;les	si, es:78h	; [es:DSKADR] (Int 1Eh)
 12057                                  					; Get current disk base	table
 12058 00001045 8936[3A06]              		mov	[tempdpt], si
 12059 00001049 8C06[3C06]              		mov	[tempdpt+2], es ; Save it
 12060 0000104D 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 12061                                  		;mov	es:78h,	di
 12062 00001051 26893E7800              		mov	[es:DSKADR], di
 12063                                  		;pop	word ptr es:7Ah	; replace with one returned by rom
 12064 00001056 268F067A00              		pop	word [es:DSKADR+2]
 12065 0000105B C606[3806]01            		mov	byte [media_set_for_format], 1
 12066                                  skip_disk_base_setting:			
 12067 00001060 30C0                    		xor	al, al		; Legal	combination + rom support code
 12068                                  		;mov	ds:had_format_error, al	; Reset	the flag
 12069 00001062 A2[3906]                		mov	[had_format_error], al
 12070 00001065 EB0E                    		jmp	short PopStatRet
 12071                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12072                                  
 12073                                  FormaStatErr:
 12074                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12075 00001067 B003                    		mov	al, 3
 12076                                  				
 12077 00001069 80FC0C                  		cmp	ah, 0Ch		; DSK_ILLEGAL_COMBINATION
 12078                                  					; Illegal combination =	0Ch
 12079 0000106C 7406                    		jz	short FormatStatIllegalComb
 12080 0000106E 80FC80                  		cmp	ah, 80h		; DSK_TIMEOUT_ERR
