 13128                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13129                                  
 13130                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13131                                  
 13132                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13133                                  ;
 13134                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 13135                                  ;
 13136                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 13137                                  ;							seg ffff )
 13138                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 13139                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 13140                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 13141                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 13142                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 13143                                  ;
 13144                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 13145                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 13146                                  ;
 13147                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13148                                  
 13149                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13150                                  HMAPtr:
 13151 000013C4 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13152                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13153 000013C9 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13154                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13155 000013CD 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13156 000013D0 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13157 000013D2 803E[FB08]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 13158                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 13159 000013D7 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13160 000013D9 FF1E[F708]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13161                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13162 000013DD 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13163                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13164                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 13165 000013E1 C3                      		retn
 13166                                  
 13167                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13168                                  
 13169                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13170                                  
 13171                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 13172                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 13173                                  
 13174                                  move_sector:
 13175                                  
 13176                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 13177                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 13178                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 13179                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 13180                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 13181                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 13182                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 13183                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 13184                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 13185                                  ;
 13186                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 13187                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 13188                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 13189                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 13190                                  ; back to a byte move.
 13191                                  
 13192 000013E2 FC                      		cld
 13193 000013E3 51                      		push	cx
 13194 000013E4 B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 13195 000013E7 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 13196 000013EB 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13197 000013ED 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 13198 000013F1 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13199 000013F3 F3A5                    		rep movsw
 13200 000013F5 59                      		pop	cx
 13201 000013F6 C3                      		retn
 13202                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13203                                  
 13204                                  movsec_bytes:				
 13205 000013F7 D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 13206 000013F9 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 13207 000013FB 59                      		pop	cx
 13208 000013FC C3                      		retn
 13209                                  
 13210                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13211                                  
 13212                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13213                                  
 13214                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 13215                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 13216                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 13217                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 13218                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 13219                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 13220                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 13221                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 13222                                  ;
 13223                                  ; input conditions:
 13224                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 13225                                  ;
 13226                                  ; output:
 13227                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 13228                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 13229                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 13230                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 13231                                  
 13232                                  check_wrap:	
 13233 000013FD 50                      		push	ax
 13234 000013FE 53                      		push	bx
 13235 000013FF 06                      		push	es
 13236 00001400 57                      		push	di
 13237 00001401 E86E00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 13238 00001404 7260                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 13239                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13240 00001406 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13241                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13242 0000140B 7459                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 13243 0000140D 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13244 00001411 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 13245 00001413 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 13246 00001416 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 13247 00001418 764C                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 13248 0000141A F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 13249                                  
 13250                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 13251                                  ; last sector on that track.
 13252                                  
 13253 0000141C 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 13254 0000141E 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 13255                                  		; 18/12/2022
 13256 00001420 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 13257 00001421 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 13258                                  					; if on	boundary
 13259                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 13260                                  not_on_bound:				
 13261 00001423 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 13262 00001426 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 13263 00001428 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 13264 0000142A 40                      		inc	ax
 13265 0000142B 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 13266 0000142D 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 13267 00001430 263B4515                		cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13268                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 13269 00001434 7636                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 13270 00001436 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 13271 00001437 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13272 00001439 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13273 0000143D F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 13274                                  
 13275                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 13276                                  
 13277 0000143F 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 13278 00001441 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 13279 00001443 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 13280                                  
 13281                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 13282                                  
 13283 00001445 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 13284 00001447 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 13285 00001449 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 13286                                  no_head_bound:				
 13287 0000144A 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 13288 0000144C 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 13289 0000144D FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 13290 0000144F 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 13291 00001451 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 13292 00001453 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 13293 00001456 B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 13294 00001458 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 13295 0000145A D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 13296 0000145C 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 13297 0000145E 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 13298 00001460 D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 13299 00001462 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 13300 00001464 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 13301                                  no_wrap:				
 13302 00001466 F8                      		clc
 13303 00001467 5F                      		pop	di
 13304 00001468 07                      		pop	es
 13305 00001469 5B                      		pop	bx
 13306 0000146A 58                      		pop	ax
 13307 0000146B C3                      		retn
 13308                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13309                                  
 13310                                  no_wrap_head:				
 13311 0000146C 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 13312 0000146E FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 13313 00001470 EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 13314                                  
 13315                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13316                                  
 13317                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13318                                  
 13319                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 13320                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 13321                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 13322                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 13323                                  ;
 13324                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 13325                                  
 13326                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13327                                  find_bds:	
 13328 00001472 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 13329                                  fbds_1:					
 13330 00001476 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13331 0000147A 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 13332 0000147C 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 13333                                  					; go to next bds
 13334 0000147F 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13335 00001482 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 13336 00001484 F9                      		stc
 13337                                  fdbs_2:					
 13338 00001485 C3                      		retn
 13339                                  
 13340                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13341                                  
 13342                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13343                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13344                                  doint:
 13345                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13346 00001486 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13347                                  					; get physical drive number
 13348                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 13349                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 13350                                  		
 13351 00001489 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13352 0000148B 08C0                    		or	al, al
 13353 0000148D 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 13354                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13355 0000148F 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 13356                                  					; get request code
 13357                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 13358 00001492 FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13359                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 13360 00001495 9D                      		popf
 13361                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 13362                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13363 00001496 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13364                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 13365                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13366 0000149B 9C                      		pushf
 13367                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13368 0000149C 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13369                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 13370                                  dointdone:				
 13371 0000149F C3                      		retn
 13372                                  
 13373                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13374                                  
 13375                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13376                                  
 13377                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 13378                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 13379                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 13380                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 13381                                  ;
 13382                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 13383                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 13384                                  ;
 13385                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 13386                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 13387                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 13388                                  
 13389                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 13390                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 13391                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 13392                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 13393                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 13394                                  ;.olddx: resw
 13395                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 13396                                  ;.olddd: resd
 13397                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 13398                                  ;end struc
 13399                                  
 13400                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13401                                  
 13402                                  ;   entry conditions:
 13403                                  ;	ah = function
 13404                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 13405                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 13406                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 13407                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 13408                                  ;   output conditions:
 13409                                  ;	no dma violation.
 13410                                  
 13411                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 13412                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 13413                                  ;
 13414                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 13415                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 13416                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 13417                                  
 13418                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13419                                  
 13420                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13421                                  
 13422 000014A0 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 13423                                  
 13424                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13425                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13426                                  ; 09/12/2022
 13427                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 13428                                  
 13429                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13430                                  
 13431                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 13432                                  
 13433                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 13434                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 13435                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 13436                                  
 13437                                  format_special_stuff:			
 13438 000014A4 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 13439 000014A9 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 13440 000014AB 53                      		push	bx
 13441 000014AC BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 13442 000014AF E83804                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 13443 000014B2 5B                      		pop	bx
 13444 000014B3 EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 13445                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13446                                  
 13447                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13448                                  
 13449                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 13450                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 13451                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 13452                                  
 13453                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13454                                  ec35_special_stuff:			
 13455 000014B5 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 13456 000014B7 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 13457 000014B9 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 13458 000014BA 51                      		push	cx
 13459 000014BB 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 13460 000014BD B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 13461 000014BF D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 13462 000014C1 8406[3105]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 13463 000014C5 59                      		pop	cx
 13464 000014C6 58                      		pop	ax
 13465 000014C7 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13466                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 13467 000014C9 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 13468 000014CA 06                      		push	es
 13469                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13470 000014CB 2EC41E[A014]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 13471                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 13472                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 13473 000014D0 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 13474 000014D2 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 13475 000014D5 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 13476                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 13477                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 13478 000014D9 07                      		pop	es
 13479 000014DA 5B                      		pop	bx
 13480 000014DB EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13481                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13482                                  
 13483                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13484                                  
 13485                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 13486                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 13487                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 13488                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 13489                                  
 13490                                  ps2_special_stuff:			
 13491 000014DD 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 13492                                  					; read driver parm ?
 13493 000014E2 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 13494 000014E4 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 13495                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 13496 000014E9 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13497                                  ps2_30_problem:				
 13498 000014EB 50                      		push	ax
 13499 000014EC B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 13500                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 13501                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13502 000014EE 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13503                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 13504                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13505 000014F3 58                      		pop	ax
 13506 000014F4 EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13507                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13508                                  
 13509                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13510                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13511                                  
 13512                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 13513                                  
 13514                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 13515                                  
 13516                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 13517                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 13518                                  
 13519                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13520 000014F6 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 13521                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 13522                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 13523 000014F7 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13524                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 13525                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 13526                                  
 13527                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 13528                                  
 13529 000014FC A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 13530 000014FF 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 13531 00001502 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 13532                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 13533                                   format_special_stuff_done:		
 13534 00001504 803E[3105]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 13535 00001509 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 13536                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 13537                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 13538                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h		
 13539 0000150B 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13540                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13541                                  		
 13542 00001510 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 13543                                  		
 13544 00001511 803E[3E06]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 13545                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 13546 00001516 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 13547                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 13548                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so		
 13549 00001518 9D                      		popf
 13550 00001519 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 13551                                  ret_from_i13:				
 13552 0000151B 1F                      		pop	ds
 13553 0000151C CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 13554                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13555                                  
 13556                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 13557                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 13558                                  ; a changeline error.
 13559                                  
 13560                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:			
 13561 0000151F 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 13562                                  i13_ret_error:				
 13563 00001521 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 13564 00001524 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 13565 00001526 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 13566 00001528 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 13567 0000152A 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 13568 0000152F 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 13569                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 13570                                  					; never	would
 13571 00001531 53                      		push	bx
 13572 00001532 BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 13573 00001535 E8B203                  		call	set_changed_dl
 13574 00001538 5B                      		pop	bx
 13575                                  int13b:					
 13576 00001539 F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 13577 0000153A EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 13578                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13579                                  
 13580                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 13581                                  
 13582                                  goterr13:				
 13583 0000153C 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 13584 0000153F 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 13585                                  goterr13_xxxx:				
 13586 00001541 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 13587 00001544 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 13588 00001546 803E[3806]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 13589 0000154B 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 13590                                  
 13591 0000154D 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 13592                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 13593                                  					; (2 = romread)
 13594                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 13595 00001552 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 13596                                  
 13597 00001554 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13598                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 13599                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13600 00001556 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13601                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13602                                  					; call far 70:797h
 13603 0000155B A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 13604 0000155E 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 13605 00001560 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 13606 00001562 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 13607 00001564 53                      		push	bx
 13608 00001565 51                      		push	cx
 13609 00001566 52                      		push	dx
 13610 00001567 A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 13611                                  loop_ecc:				
 13612 0000156A B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13613                                  
 13614                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 13615                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 13616                                  ;
 13617                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 13618                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 13619                                  ; track.
 13620                                  ;
 13621                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 13622                                  ; this request.
 13623                                  ;
 13624                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 13625                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 13626                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 13627                                  ;
 13628 0000156D E88DFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 13629                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 13630                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13631 00001570 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13632                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13633 00001575 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 13634 00001577 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 13635 0000157A 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 13636 0000157C 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 13637 0000157F 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 13638                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13639                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 13640                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 13641 00001581 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 13642                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 13643                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 13644                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 13645                                  ok11_op:				
 13646 00001583 FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 13647 00001587 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 13648 00001589 FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 13649                                  					; add 200h to address
 13650 0000158B FEC7                    		inc	bh
 13651 0000158D FEC7                    		inc	bh
 13652 0000158F EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 13653                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13654                                  
 13655                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 13656                                  
 13657                                  ok11_exit_err:				
 13658 00001591 F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 13659                                  ok11_exit:				
 13660 00001592 5A                      		pop	dx
 13661 00001593 59                      		pop	cx
 13662 00001594 5B                      		pop	bx
 13663 00001595 EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 13664                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13665                                  
 13666                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 13667                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 13668                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 13669                                  
 13670                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:			
 13671 00001597 06                      		push	es
 13672 00001598 53                      		push	bx
 13673 00001599 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13674 0000159C 1E                      		push	ds
 13675 0000159D 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 13676 0000159E B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13677                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 13678                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13679 000015A1 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13680                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13681 000015A6 5B                      		pop	bx
 13682 000015A7 07                      		pop	es
 13683 000015A8 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 13684 000015AA 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 13685 000015AD 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 13686                                  
 13687                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 13688                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 13689                                  
 13690                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:		
 13691 000015AF 56                      		push	si
 13692 000015B0 57                      		push	di
 13693 000015B1 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 13694 000015B3 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 13695 000015B6 E829FE                  		call	move_sector
 13696 000015B9 5F                      		pop	di
 13697 000015BA 5E                      		pop	si
 13698 000015BB EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 13699                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13700                                  
 13701                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 13702                                  ; operation as best we can.
 13703                                  
 13704                                  gotdmaerr:				
 13705 000015BD A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 13706 000015C0 FB                      		sti
 13707 000015C1 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 13708 000015C4 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 13709                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 13710                                  					; functions we don't handle
 13711 000015C6 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 13712 000015C9 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 13713 000015CB 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 13714 000015CE 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 13715 000015D0 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 13716                                  
 13717                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 13718                                  
 13719                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 13720                                  
 13721 000015D2 52                      		push	dx
 13722 000015D3 51                      		push	cx
 13723 000015D4 53                      		push	bx
 13724 000015D5 50                      		push	ax
 13725 000015D6 55                      		push	bp
 13726 000015D7 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 13727 000015D9 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 13728 000015DB D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13729 000015DD D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13730 000015DF D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13731 000015E1 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 13732 000015E3 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 13733 000015E5 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 13734                                  
 13735                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 13736                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 13737                                  
 13738 000015E9 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 13739 000015EB E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 13740                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13741                                  
 13742                                  no_skip_first:				
 13743 000015EE D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 13744 000015F0 B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 13745 000015F2 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 13746                                  
 13747                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 13748                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 13749                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 13750                                  ;
 13751                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 13752                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 13753                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 13754                                  ; in error.
 13755                                  
 13756 000015F4 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 13757 000015F6 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 13758                                  
 13759                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 13760                                  
 13761 000015F8 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 13762                                  					; set up head number
 13763 000015FB E888FE                  		call	doint
 13764 000015FE E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 13765                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13766                                  
 13767                                  i13_done_dmaerr:			
 13768 00001601 B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 13769 00001603 F9                      		stc
 13770 00001604 E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 13771                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 13772                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13773                                  
 13774                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 13775                                  
 13776                                  intverify:				
 13777 00001607 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 13778 00001608 53                      		push	bx
 13779 00001609 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 13780 0000160A 07                      		pop	es
 13781                                  dosimple:				
 13782 0000160B BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13783                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 13784                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 13785                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13786 0000160E 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13787                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13788 00001613 5B                      		pop	bx
 13789 00001614 07                      		pop	es
 13790 00001615 E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 13791                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13792                                  
 13793                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 13794                                  
 13795                                  intformat:				
 13796 00001618 06                      		push	es
 13797 00001619 53                      		push	bx
 13798 0000161A 56                      		push	si
 13799 0000161B 57                      		push	di
 13800 0000161C 1E                      		push	ds
 13801                                  
 13802                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 13803                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 13804                                  
 13805 0000161D 06                      		push	es
 13806 0000161E 1E                      		push	ds
 13807 0000161F 07                      		pop	es
 13808 00001620 1F                      		pop	ds
 13809 00001621 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 13810 00001623 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 13811 00001626 E8B9FD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 13812 00001629 1F                      		pop	ds
 13813 0000162A 5F                      		pop	di
 13814 0000162B 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 13815 0000162C EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 13816                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13817                                  
 13818                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 13819                                  ; the first block.
 13820                                  ;
 13821                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 13822                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 13823                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 13824                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 13825                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 13826                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 13827                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 13828                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 13829                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 13830                                  
 13831                                  doblock:
 13832                                  
 13833                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 13834                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 13835                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 13836                                  				
 13837 0000162E 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13838                                  					; get head #, drive #
 13839 00001631 51                      		push	cx
 13840 00001632 06                      		push	es
 13841 00001633 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 13842                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 13843 00001634 E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 13844 00001637 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13845                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13846 0000163B 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13847                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13848 00001640 5F                      		pop	di
 13849 00001641 07                      		pop	es
 13850 00001642 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 13851 00001644 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 13852 00001646 B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 13853 00001648 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 13854                                  doblockflop:				
 13855 0000164A 59                      		pop	cx
 13856                                  doblockcontinue:			
 13857 0000164B 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 13858 0000164D 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 13859 0000164F 50                      		push	ax
 13860 00001650 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 13861 00001652 EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 13862                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13863                                  
 13864                                  doblocklast:				
 13865 00001654 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 13866 00001656 50                      		push	ax
 13867                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot	
 13868 00001657 E82CFE                  		call	doint
 13869 0000165A 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 13870 0000165C 58                      		pop	ax
 13871 0000165D 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 13872                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 13873 00001660 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 13874 00001662 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 13875 00001664 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 13876 00001666 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 13877 00001668 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 13878                                  					; then we are done already.
 13879 0000166A 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 13880                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 13881 0000166C E88EFD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 13882 0000166F EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 13883                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13884                                  
 13885                                  bufferx:				
 13886 00001671 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 13887                                  					; set up head number
 13888                                  buffer:					
 13889 00001674 53                      		push	bx
 13890 00001675 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 13891 00001678 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 13892 0000167B 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 13893                                  					
 13894                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 13895                                  
 13896 0000167D 06                      		push	es
 13897 0000167E 1E                      		push	ds
 13898 0000167F 56                      		push	si
 13899 00001680 57                      		push	di
 13900 00001681 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 13901 00001682 06                      		push	es
 13902 00001683 1F                      		pop	ds
 13903 00001684 07                      		pop	es
 13904 00001685 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 13905 00001688 57                      		push	di		; save it
 13906 00001689 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 13907 0000168B E854FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 13908 0000168E 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 13909                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 13910 0000168F 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 13911 00001690 5E                      		pop	si
 13912 00001691 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 13913                                  
 13914                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 13915                                  
 13916 00001692 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13917                                  					; get drive number
 13918 00001694 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 13919 00001697 E863FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 13920                                  					;
 13921                                  					; ah is	function
 13922                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 13923                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 13924                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 13925                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 13926                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 13927 0000169A E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 13928 0000169D 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 13929 0000169E 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 13930 000016A0 EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 13931                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13932                                  
 13933                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 13934                                  
 13935                                  doread:					
 13936 000016A2 06                      		push	es
 13937 000016A3 53                      		push	bx
 13938 000016A4 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 13939 000016A5 07                      		pop	es
 13940 000016A6 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13941 000016A9 B001                    		mov	al, 1
 13942 000016AB 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13943                                  					; get drive number
 13944 000016AE E84CFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 13945                                  					; ah = function
 13946                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 13947                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 13948                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 13949 000016B1 E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 13950 000016B4 5B                      		pop	bx
 13951 000016B5 07                      		pop	es
 13952 000016B6 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 13953 000016B8 56                      		push	si
 13954 000016B9 57                      		push	di
 13955 000016BA 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 13956 000016BC BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 13957 000016BF E820FD                  		call	move_sector
 13958 000016C2 5F                      		pop	di
 13959 000016C3 5E                      		pop	si
 13960                                  
 13961                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 13962                                  
 13963                                  dotail:					
 13964 000016C4 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 13965 000016C5 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 13966 000016C8 41                      		inc	cx
 13967 000016C9 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 13968 000016CC F8                      		clc
 13969 000016CD FEC8                    		dec	al
 13970 000016CF 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 13971                                  
 13972                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 13973                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 13974                                  
 13975 000016D1 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13976 000016D4 E826FD                  		call	check_wrap
 13977 000016D7 E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 13978                                  
 13979                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 13980                                  
 13981                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 13982                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 13983                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 13984                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 13985                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 13986                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 13987                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 13988                                  
 13989                                  bad13:					
 13990 000016DA 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 13991 000016DC 5D                      		pop	bp
 13992 000016DD 5B                      		pop	bx
 13993 000016DE 5B                      		pop	bx
 13994 000016DF 59                      		pop	cx
 13995 000016E0 5A                      		pop	dx
 13996 000016E1 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 13997 000016E3 E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 13998                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13999                                  
 14000                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:				
 14001 000016E6 E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 14002                                  
 14003                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14004                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14005                                  		;db 	0
 14006                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14007                                  
 14008                                  ;Bios_Code ends
 14009                                  
 14010                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 14011

 14013                                  ; MSBIO2.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 14014                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
