 15000                                  section .SYSINIT vstart=0
 15001                                  
 15002                                  ; ****************************************************************************
 15003                                  ; SYSINIT.BIN (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS) - RETRO DOS v4.0 by ERDOGAN TAN - 21/10/2022
 15004                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15005                                  ; Last Update: 04/01/2023 (Modified IO.SYS)  ((Previous: 31/12/2022))
 15006                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15007                                  ; Beginning: 03/06/2018 (Retro DOS 3.0), 21/03/2019 (Retro DOS 4.0)
 15008                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15009                                  ; Assembler: NASM version 2.15
 15010                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15011                                  ;	   ((nasm sysinit5.s -l sysinit5.lst -o SYSINIT5.BIN -Z error.txt)) 	
 15012                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15013                                  ; Modified from 'sysinit2.s' (SYSINIT2.BIN) file of Retro DOS v3.0 (6/7/2018)
 15014                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15015                                  ; Derived from 'SYSINIT1.ASM' and 'SYSINIT2.ASM' files of MSDOS 6.0
 15016                                  ; source code by Microsoft, 1991 
 15017                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15018                                  ; Derived from 'SYSINIT.ASM' file of MSDOS 2.0 (IBM PCDOS v2.0) source code
 15019                                  ; by Microsoft, 12/10/1983
 15020                                  ; ****************************************************************************
 15021                                  ; main file: 'retrodos4.s'
 15022                                  ; incbin 'SYSINIT3.BIN' ; (SYINITSEG)
 15023                                  
 15024                                  ; 21/10/2022
 15025                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15026                                  ; This source code (version) is based on SYSINIT source code of disassembled
 15027                                  ; MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS file (SYSINIT.BIN) 
 15028                                  ; Dissassembler: Hex-Rays Interactive Disassembler (IDA)
 15029                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15030                                  ; Binary file splitter & joiner: FFSJ v3.3
 15031                                  
 15032                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 15033                                  ; SYSINIT.TXT (27/01/1983)
 15034                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 15035                                  ;    SYSINIT is  a module linked behind the OEM bios.  It takes
 15036                                  ;over  the  system  initialization  after  the  OEM  bios   has
 15037                                  ;performed any  initialization  it  needs  to  do.   Control is
 15038                                  ;transfered with a long jump to the external  variable  SYSINIT
 15039                                  ;
 15040                                  ;
 15041                                  ;   The OEM  has  the  following  variables declared external:
 15042                                  ;
 15043                                  ;   CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION    WORD
 15044                                  ;
 15045                                  ;This word  contains  the  segment  number of the DOS before it
 15046                                  ;is relocated.  The OEM bios must set this value.
 15047                                  ;
 15048                                  ;   FINAL_DOS_LOCATION      WORD
 15049                                  ;
 15050                                  ;This word contains the segment number of the DOS after SYSINIT
 15051                                  ;moves it.  The OEM bios must set this value.
 15052                                  ;
 15053                                  ;   DEVICE_LIST             DWORD
 15054                                  ;
 15055                                  ;This  double  word  pointer  points  to  the  linked  list  of
 15056                                  ;character and block device drivers.  The  OEM  must  set  this
 15057                                  ;value.
 15058                                  ;
 15059                                  ;   MEMORY_SIZE             WORD
 15060                                  ;
 15061                                  ;This word  contains  the  number  of  RAM  paragraphs.  If the
 15062                                  ;bios doesn't set  this  variable  SYSINIT  will  automatically
 15063                                  ;calculate it.   NOTE:  systems with PARITY checked memory must
 15064                                  ;size memory in the BIOS.  SYSINITs method is to  write  memory
 15065                                  ;and read it back until it gets a mismatch.
 15066                                  ;
 15067                                  ;   DEFAULT_DRIVE           BYTE
 15068                                  ;
 15069                                  ;This is  the initial default drive when the system first comes
 15070                                  ;up.  drive a=0, drive b=1,  etc.   If  the  bios  doesn't  set
 15071                                  ;it then drive a is assumed.
 15072                                  ;
 15073                                  ;   BUFFERS                 BYTE
 15074                                  ;
 15075                                  ;This is  the  default  number of buffers for the system.  This
 15076                                  ;value may be overridden by the user in  the  CONFIG.SYS  file.
 15077                                  ;It is DBed to 2 in SYSINIT it should be greater than 1.
 15078                                  ;
 15079                                  ;   FILES                   BYTE
 15080                                  ;
 15081                                  ;This is  the  default  number  of  files for the system.  This
 15082                                  ;value may be overridden by the user in  the  CONFIG.SYS  file.
 15083                                  ;It is  DBed  to  8 in SYSINIT, values less than 5 are ignored.
 15084                                  ;
 15085                                  ;   SYSINIT                 FAR
 15086                                  ;
 15087                                  ;The entry  point  of  the  SYSINIT  module.  OEM BIOS jumps to
 15088                                  ;this label at the end of its INIT code.
 15089                                  ;
 15090                                  ;   The OEM  has  the  following  variables declared public:
 15091                                  ;
 15092                                  ;   RE_INIT                 FAR
 15093                                  ;
 15094                                  ;This is an entry point which allows the BIOS to do some INIT
 15095                                  ;work  after  the  DOS is initialized.  ALL REGISTERS MUST BE
 15096                                  ;PRESERVED.  On entry DS points to the first available memory
 15097                                  ;(after  the DOS).  DS:0 points to a 100H byte program header
 15098                                  ;prefix which represents  the  "program"  currently  running.
 15099                                  ;This  program  should  be  thought  of  as  the OEM BIOS and
 15100                                  ;SYSINIT taken together.  This is not  a  normal  program  in
 15101                                  ;that  no  memory  is  allocated to it, it is running in free
 15102                                  ;memory.
 15103                                  ;NOTES:
 15104                                  ;     At the time this routine is called SYSINIT occupies the
 15105                                  ;highest 10K of memory ("highest" is determined by the  value
 15106                                  ;of the MEMORY_SIZE variable), DO NOT DO WRITES THERE.
 15107                                  ;     Since this is called AFTER DOS is initialized, you can
 15108                                  ;make system calls.  This also implies that the code for this
 15109                                  ;routine    CANNOT   be   thrown   away   by   use   of   the
 15110                                  ;FINAL_DOS_LOCATION since the DOS has already been moved.
 15111                                  ;     If you don't want  anything done just set this to point
 15112                                  ;at a FAR RET instruction.
 15113                                  
 15114                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15115                                  ; TITLE   BIOS SYSTEM INITIALIZATION
 15116                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15117                                  
 15118                                  ;include version.inc
 15119                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15120                                  
 15121                                  ;FALSE   EQU     0
 15122                                  ;TRUE    EQU     0FFFFh
 15123                                  
 15124                                  ;IBMVER	    EQU     TRUE
 15125                                  ;IBMCOPYRIGHT EQU   FALSE
 15126                                  ;STACKSW    EQU	    TRUE		;Include Switchable Hardware Stacks
 15127                                  ;IBMJAPVER  EQU     FALSE		; If TRUE set KANJI true also
 15128                                  ;MSVER      EQU     FALSE
 15129                                  ;ALTVECT    EQU     FALSE		; Switch to build ALTVECT version
 15130                                  ;KANJI      EQU     FALSE
 15131                                  
 15132                                  ;(MSDOS 6.0, versiona.inc, 1991)
 15133                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15134                                  ;MAJOR_VERSION  EQU	6
 15135                                  ;;MINOR_VERSION	EQU	0	;6.00
 15136                                  ;MINOR_VERSION  EQU	21	;6.21  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15137                                  
 15138                                  ; 22/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0)
 15139                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15140                                  MAJOR_VERSION   EQU	5
 15141                                  MINOR_VERSION   EQU	0
 15142                                  
 15143                                  expected_version equ	(MINOR_VERSION<<8)+MAJOR_VERSION
 15144                                  
 15145                                  ;DOSREVNM equ	00000000b       ; m037 - bits 0-2 = revision number of DOS
 15146                                  				; currently 0.
 15147                                  DOSREVNM equ	00000111b	; [[[ 7 for Retro DOS v4.0 ]]] (21/03/2019)	
 15148                                  DOSINROM equ	00001000B       ; bit 3 of ver flags returned in BH
 15149                                  DOSINHMA equ	00010000B       ; bit 4 of ver flags 
 15150                                  
 15151                                  ;      if1
 15152                                  ;      %OUT  ... for DOS Version 5.00 ...
 15153                                  ;      endif
 15154                                  
 15155                                         ;******************************
 15156                                         ;Each assembler program should:
 15157                                         ;  mov ah,030h                   ;DOS Get Version function
 15158                                         ;  int 021h                      ;Version ret. in AX,minor version first
 15159                                         ;  cmp ax,expected_version       ;ALL utilities should check for an
 15160                                         ;  jne error_handler             ; EXACT version match.
 15161                                         ;******************************
 15162                                  
 15163                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15164                                  ; device definitions
 15165                                  
 15166                                  ;Attribute bit masks
 15167                                  DEVTYP  EQU     8000h           ;Bit 15 - 1  if Char, 0 if block
 15168                                  DEVIOCTL EQU    4000h           ;Bit 14 - CONTROL mode bit
 15169                                  ISFATBYDEV EQU  2000h           ;Bit 13 - Device uses FAT ID bytes, comp media.
 15170                                  ISCIN   EQU     0001h           ;Bit 0 - This device is the console input.
 15171                                  ISCOUT  EQU     0002h           ;Bit 1 - This device is the console output.
 15172                                  ISNULL  EQU     0004h           ;Bit 2 - This device is the null device.
 15173                                  ISCLOCK EQU     0008h           ;Bit 3 - This device is the clock device.
 15174                                  ISIBM   EQU     0010h           ;Bit 4 - This device is special
 15175                                  
 15176                                  ; The device table list has the form:
 15177                                  struc	SYSDEV
 15178 00000000 ????????                .NEXT:		resd 1		;Pointer to next device header
 15179 00000004 ????                    .ATT:		resw 1		;Attributes of the device
 15180 00000006 ????                    .STRAT:		resw 1		;Strategy entry point
 15181 00000008 ????                    .INT:		resw 1		;Interrupt entry point
 15182 0000000A ????????????????        .NAME:		resb 8		;Name of device (only first byte used for block)
 15183                                  .size:
 15184                                  endstruc
 15185                                  
 15186                                  ;Static Reguest Header
 15187                                  struc	SRHEAD
 15188 00000000 ??                      .REQLEN:	resb 1		;Length in bytes of request block
 15189 00000001 ??                      .REQUNIT:	resb 1		;Device unit number
 15190 00000002 ??                      .REQFUNC:	resb 1		;Type of request
 15191 00000003 ????                    .REQSTAT:	resw 1		;Status Word
 15192 00000005 ????????????????                	resb 8		;Reserved for queue links
 15193                                  .size:
 15194                                  endstruc
 15195                                  
 15196                                  ;Status word masks
 15197                                  STERR   EQU     8000H           ;Bit 15 - Error
 15198                                  STBUI   EQU     0200H           ;Bit 9 - Buisy
 15199                                  STDON   EQU     0100H           ;Bit 8 - Done
 15200                                  STECODE EQU     00FFH           ;Error code
 15201                                  WRECODE EQU     0
 15202                                  
 15203                                  ;Function codes
 15204                                  DEVINIT EQU     0               ;Initialization
 15205                                  DINITHL EQU     26              ;Size of init header
 15206                                  DEVMDCH EQU     1               ;Media check
 15207                                  DMEDHL  EQU     15              ;Size of media check header
 15208                                  DEVBPB  EQU     2               ;Get BPB
 15209                                  DEVRDIOCTL EQU  3               ;IOCTL read
 15210                                  DBPBHL  EQU     22              ;Size of Get BPB header
 15211                                  DEVRD   EQU     4               ;Read
 15212                                  DRDWRHL EQU     22              ;Size of RD/WR header
 15213                                  DEVRDND EQU     5               ;Non destructive read no wait (character devs)
 15214                                  DRDNDHL EQU     14              ;Size of non destructive read header
 15215                                  DEVIST  EQU     6               ;Input status
 15216                                  DSTATHL EQU     13              ;Size of status header
 15217                                  DEVIFL  EQU     7               ;Input flush
 15218                                  DFLSHL  EQU     15              ;Size of flush header
 15219                                  DEVWRT  EQU     8               ;Write
 15220                                  DEVWRTV EQU     9               ;Write with verify
 15221                                  DEVOST  EQU     10              ;Output status
 15222                                  DEVOFL  EQU     11              ;Output flush
 15223                                  DEVWRIOCTL EQU  12              ;IOCTL write
 15224                                  
 15225                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15226                                  struc	SYS_FCB
 15227 00000000 ??                      .fcb_drive:	resb 1
 15228 00000001 ????????????????        .fcb_name:	resb 8
 15229 00000009 ??????                  .fcb_ext:	resb 3
 15230 0000000C ????                    .fcb_EXTENT:	resw 1
 15231 0000000E ????                    .fcb_RECSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of record (user settable)
 15232 00000010 ????                    .fcb_FILSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of file in bytes; used with the following
 15233                                                          ; word
 15234 00000012 ????                    .fcb_DRVBP:	resw 1	; BP for SEARCH FIRST and SEARCH NEXT
 15235 00000014 ????                    .fcb_FDATE:	resw 1	; Date of last writing
 15236 00000016 ????                    .fcb_FTIME:	resw 1	; Time of last writing
 15237 00000018 ??                      .fcb_DEVID:	resb 1	; Device ID number, bits 0-5 if file.
 15238                                                          ; bit 7=0 for file, bit 7=1 for I/O device
 15239                                                          ; If file, bit 6=0 if dirty
 15240                                                          ; If I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 15241                                                          ;               Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 15242                                                          ;               Bit 0=1 if console input device
 15243                                                          ;               Bit 1=1 if console output device
 15244                                                          ;               Bit 2=1 if null device
 15245                                                          ;               Bit 3=1 if clock device
 15246 00000019 ????                    .fcb_FIRCLUS:	resw 1	; First cluster of file
 15247 0000001B ????                    .fcb_CLUSPOS:	resw 1	; Position of last cluster accessed
 15248 0000001D ????                    .fcb_LSTCLUS:	resw 1	; Last cluster accessed and directory
 15249 0000001F ??                                   	resb 1	; pack 2 12 bit numbers into 24 bits...
 15250 00000020 ??                      .fcb_NR:	resb 1	; Next record
 15251 00000021 ????????                .fcb_RR:	resb 4	; Random record
 15252                                  .size:
 15253                                  endstruc
 15254                                  
 15255                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15256                                  ; Field definition for I/O buffer information
 15257                                  
 15258                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, BUFFER.INC, 1991)
 15259                                  
 15260                                  struc buffinfo
 15261 00000000 ????                    .buf_next:	resw 1	; Pointer to next buffer in list
 15262 00000002 ????                    .buf_prev:	resw 1	; Pointer to previous buffer in list
 15263 00000004 ??                      .buf_ID:	resb 1	; Drive of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 15264                                  			; SFT table index (bit 7 = 1)
 15265                                  			; = FFh if buffer free
 15266 00000005 ??                      .buf_flags:	resb 1	; Bit 7 = 1 if Remote file buffer
 15267                                  			;	= 0 if Local device buffer
 15268                                  			; Bit 6 = 1 if buffer dirty
 15269                                  			; Bit 5 = Reserved
 15270                                  			; Bit 4 = Search bit (bit 7 = 1)
 15271                                  			; Bit 3 = 1 if buffer is DATA
 15272                                  			; Bit 2 = 1 if buffer is DIR
 15273                                  			; Bit 1 = 1 if buffer is FAT
 15274                                  			; Bit 0 = Reserved
 15275 00000006 ????????                .buf_sector:	resd 1	; Sector number of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 15276                                  ; The next two items are often refed as a word (bit 7 = 0)
 15277 0000000A ??                      .buf_wrtcnt:	resb 1	; For FAT sectors, # times sector written out
 15278 0000000B ????                    .buf_wrtcntinc:	resw 1	; "   "     "   , # sectors between each write
 15279 0000000D ????????                .buf_DPB :	resd 1	; Pointer to drive parameters
 15280 00000011 ????                    .buf_fill:	resw 1	; How full buffer is (bit 7 = 1)
 15281 00000013 ??                      .buf_reserved:	resb 1	; make DWORD boundary for 386
 15282                                  .size:
 15283                                  endstruc
 15284                                  
 15285                                  %define buf_offset	dword [buf_sector]
 15286                                  			;For bit 7 = 1, this is the byte
 15287                                  			;offset of the start of the buffer in
 15288                                  			;the file pointed to by buf_ID.  Thus
 15289                                  			;the buffer starts at location
 15290                                  			;buf_offset in the file and contains
 15291                                  			;buf_fill bytes.
 15292                                  
 15293                                  bufinsiz	equ	buffinfo.size ; ; Size of structure in bytes
 15294                                  
 15295                                  
 15296                                  buf_Free	equ	0FFh		; buf_id of free buffer
 15297                                  
 15298                                  ;Flag byte masks
 15299                                  buf_isnet	EQU	10000000B
 15300                                  buf_dirty	EQU	01000000B
 15301                                  ;***
 15302                                  buf_visit	EQU	00100000B
 15303                                  ;***
 15304                                  buf_snbuf	EQU	00010000B
 15305                                  
 15306                                  buf_isDATA	EQU	00001000B
 15307                                  buf_isDIR	EQU	00000100B
 15308                                  buf_isFAT	EQU	00000010B
 15309                                  buf_type_0	EQU	11110001B	; AND sets type to "none"
 15310                                  
 15311                                  buf_NetID	EQU	bufinsiz
 15312

 15314                                  
 15315                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15316                                  ;**	DPB - Drive Parameter Block
 15317                                  
 15318                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, DPB.INC, 1991)
 15319                                  
 15320                                  ;	BUGBUG - this isn't authorative - it's my probably incomplete and
 15321                                  ;	possibly inaccurate deductions from code study... - jgl
 15322                                  ;
 15323                                  ;	The DPB is DOS's main structure for describing block devices.
 15324                                  ;	It contains info about the "Drive" intermingled with info about
 15325                                  ;	the FAT file system which is presumably on the drive.  I don't know
 15326                                  ;	how those fields are used if it's not the FAT file system - BUGBUG
 15327                                  ;
 15328                                  ;	The DPBs are statically allocated and chained off of DPBHead.
 15329                                  ;	Users scan this chain looking for a match on DPB_DRIVE.
 15330                                  ;	The DPBs are built at init time from info in the SYSDEV structure.
 15331                                  
 15332                                  ; 08/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3, DPB.INC, 24/07/1987)
 15333                                  
 15334                                  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15335                                  
 15336                                  struc	DPB
 15337 00000000 ??                      .DRIVE:		resb 1		; Logical drive # assoc with DPB (A=0,B=1,...)
 15338 00000001 ??                      .UNIT:		resb 1		; Driver unit number of DPB
 15339 00000002 ????                    .SECTOR_SIZE:	resw 1		; Size of physical sector in bytes
 15340 00000004 ??                      .CLUSTER_MASK:	resb 1		; Sectors/cluster - 1
 15341 00000005 ??                      .CLUSTER_SHIFT:	resb 1		; Log2 of sectors/cluster
 15342 00000006 ????                    .FIRST_FAT:	resw 1		; Starting record of FATs
 15343 00000008 ??                      .FAT_COUNT:	resb 1		; Number of FATs for this drive
 15344 00000009 ????                    .ROOT_ENTRIES:	resw 1		; Number of directory entries
 15345 0000000B ????                    .FIRST_SECTOR:	resw 1		; First sector of first cluster
 15346 0000000D ????                    .MAX_CLUSTER:	resw 1		; Number of clusters on drive + 1
 15347                                  ;.FAT_SIZE:	resb 1  ; MSDOS 3.3
 15348 0000000F ????                    .FAT_SIZE:	resw 1		; Number of records occupied by FAT
 15349 00000011 ????                    .DIR_SECTOR:	resw 1		; Starting record of directory
 15350 00000013 ????????                .DRIVER_ADDR:	resd 1		; Pointer to driver
 15351 00000017 ??                      .MEDIA:		resb 1		; Media byte
 15352 00000018 ??                      .FIRST_ACCESS:	resb 1		; This is initialized to -1 to force a media
 15353                                  				; check the first time this DPB is used
 15354 00000019 ????????                .NEXT_DPB:	resd 1		; Pointer to next Drive parameter block
 15355 0000001D ????                    .NEXT_FREE:	resw 1		; Cluster # of last allocated cluster
 15356 0000001F ????                    .FREE_CNT:	resw 1		; Count of free clusters, -1 if unknown
 15357                                  .size:
 15358                                  endstruc
 15359                                  
 15360                                  DPBSIZ  EQU     DPB.size	; Size of the structure in bytes
 15361                                  
 15362                                  DSKSIZ  EQU	DPB.MAX_CLUSTER	; Size of disk (temp used during init only)
 15363

 15419                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0  (MSDOS 6.0, BPB.INC, IOCTL.INC)
 15420                                  
 15421                                  ;**	BIOS PARAMETER BLOCK DEFINITION
 15422                                  ;
 15423                                  ;	The BPB contains information about the disk structure.  It dates
 15424                                  ;	back to the earliest FAT systems and so FAT information is
 15425                                  ;	intermingled with physical driver information.
 15426                                  ;
 15427                                  ;	A boot sector contains a BPB for its device; for other disks
 15428                                  ;	the driver creates a BPB.  DOS keeps copies of some of this
 15429                                  ;	information in the DPB.
 15430                                  ;
 15431                                  ;	The BDS structure contains a BPB within it.
 15432                                  
 15433                                  struc A_BPB
 15434 00000000 ????                    .BPB_BYTESPERSECTOR:	resw	1
 15435 00000002 ??                      .BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER:	resb	1
 15436 00000003 ????                    .BPB_RESERVEDSECTORS:	resw	1
 15437 00000005 ??                      .BPB_NUMBEROFFATS:	resb	1
 15438 00000006 ????                    .BPB_ROOTENTRIES: 	resw	1
 15439 00000008 ????                    .BPB_TOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 15440 0000000A ??                      .BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR:	resb	1
 15441 0000000B ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERFAT:	resw	1
 15442 0000000D ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK:	resw	1
 15443 0000000F ????                    .BPB_HEADS:		resw	1
 15444 00000011 ????                    .BPB_HIDDENSECTORS:	resw	1
 15445 00000013 ????                    			resw	1
 15446 00000015 ????                    .BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 15447 00000017 ????                    			resw	1
 15448 00000019 ????????????            			resb	6	; NOTE:  many times these
 15449                                  ;					; 	 6 bytes are omitted
 15450                                  ;					;	 when BPB manipulations
 15451                                  ;					;	 are performed!
 15452                                  .size:
 15453                                  endstruc
 15454                                  
 15455                                  struc A_DEVICEPARAMETERS
 15456 00000000 ??                      .DP_SPECIALFUNCTIONS:	resb	1
 15457 00000001 ??                      .DP_DEVICETYPE:		resb	1
 15458 00000002 ????                    .DP_DEVICEATTRIBUTES:	resw	1
 15459 00000004 ????                    .DP_CYLINDERS:		resw	1
 15460 00000006 ??                      .DP_MEDIATYPE:		resb	1
 15461 00000007 <res 1Fh>               .DP_BPB:		resb	A_BPB.size
 15462 00000026 ????                    .DP_TRACKTABLEENTRIES:	resw	1
 15463 00000028 <res FCh>               .DP_SECTORTABLE:	resb	MAX_SECTORS_IN_TRACK * A_SECTORTABLE.size
 15464                                  endstruc

 15712                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15713                                  ; BIOSTRUC.INC (MSDOS 3.3 - 24/07/1987) 	
 15714                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15715                                  					  ;;Rev 3.30 Modification
 15716                                  ; ROM BIOS CALL PACKET STRUCTURES					  
 15717                                  									  
 15718                                  ;*******************************					  
 15719                                  ;System Service call ( Int 15h )					  
 15720                                  ;*******************************					  
 15721                                  ;Function AH = 0C0h, Return system configuration			  
 15722                                  ;For PC and PCJR on return:						  
 15723                                  ;	(AH)	= 80h							  
 15724                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 15725                                  ;For PCXT, PC PORTABLE and PCAT on return:				  
 15726                                  ;	(AH)	= 86h							  
 15727                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 15728                                  ;For all others:							  
 15729                                  ;	(AH)	= 0							  
 15730                                  ;	(CY)	= 0							  
 15731                                  ;	(ES:BX) = pointer to system descriptor vector in ROS		  
 15732                                  ; System descriptor :							  
 15733                                  ;	DW	xxxx		length of descriptor in bytes,		  
 15734                                  ;				minimum length = 8			  
 15735                                  ;	DB	xx		model byte				  
 15736                                  ;				0FFh	= PC				  
 15737                                  ;				0FEh	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 15738                                  ;				0FDh	= PC/JR 			  
 15739                                  ;				0FCh	= PC/AT				  
 15740                                  ;				0F9h	= Convertable			  
 15741                                  ;				0F8h	= Model 80			  
 15742                                  ;				0E0 thru 0EFh = reserved		  
 15743                                  ;									  
 15744                                  ;	DB	xx		secondary model byte			  
 15745                                  ;				000h	= PC1				  
 15746                                  ;				000h	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 15747                                  ;				000h	= PC/JR 			  
 15748                                  ;				000h	= PC/AT 			  
 15749                                  ;				001h	= PC/AT Model 339		  
 15750                                  ;				003h	= PC/RT				  
 15751                                  ;				000h	= Convertable			  
 15752                                  ;									  
 15753                                  ;	DB	xx		bios revision level			  
 15754                                  ;				00 for first release, subsequent release  
 15755                                  ;				of code with same model byte and	  
 15756                                  ;				secondary model byte require revison level
 15757                                  ;				to increase by one.			  
 15758                                  ;									  
 15759                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 1		  
 15760                                  ;				X0000000 = 1, bios use DMA channel 3	  
 15761                                  ;					 = 0, DMA channel 3 not used	  
 15762                                  ;									  
 15763                                  ;				0X000000 = 1, 2nd Interrupt chip present  
 15764                                  ;					 = 0, 2nd Interrupt chip not present
 15765                                  ;									  
 15766                                  ;				00X00000 = 1, Real Time Clock present	  
 15767                                  ;					 = 0, Real Time Clock not present 
 15768                                  ;									  
 15769                                  ;				000X0000 = 1, Keyboard escape sequence(INT 15h)
 15770                                  ;						called in keyboard interrupt
 15771                                  ;						(Int 09h).		  
 15772                                  ;					 = 0, Keyboard escape sequence not
 15773                                  ;						called. 		  
 15774                                  ;				0000XXXX reserved			  
 15775                                  ;									  
 15776                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15777                                  ;									  
 15778                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15779                                  ;									  
 15780                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15781                                  ;									  
 15782                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15783                                  ;									  
 15784                                  
 15785                                  ; 22/03/2019									  
 15786                                  struc ROMBIOS_DESC		; BIOS_SYSTEM_DESCRIPTOR						  
 15787 00000000 ????                    .bios_sd_leng:		resw 1				  
 15788 00000002 ??                      .bios_sd_modelbyte:	resb 1

 15791 00000004 ??                      			resb 1

 15903                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15904                                  ; CURDIR.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 15905                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15906                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15907                                  
 15908                                  ;**	CDS - Current Directory Structure
 15909                                  ;
 15910                                  ; CDS items are used bu the internal routines to store cluster numbers and
 15911                                  ; network identifiers for each logical name.  The ID field is used dually,
 15912                                  ; both as net ID and for a cluster number for local devices. In the case
 15913                                  ; of local devices, the cluster number will be -1 if there is a potential
 15914                                  ; of the disk being changed or if the path must be recracked.
 15915                                  ;
 15916                                  ;	Some pathnames have special preambles, such as
 15917                                  ;
 15918                                  ;		\\machine\sharename\...
 15919                                  ;	For these pathnames we can't allow ".." processing to back us
 15920                                  ;	up into the special front part of the name.  The CURDIR_END field
 15921                                  ;	holds the address of the seperator character which marks
 15922                                  ;	the split between the special preamble and the regular
 15923                                  ;	path list; ".." processing isn't allowed to back us up past
 15924                                  ;	(i.e., before) CURDIR_END
 15925                                  ;	For the root, it points at the leading /. For net
 15926                                  ;	assignments it points at the end (nul) of the initial assignment:
 15927                                  ;	A:/	\\foo\bar	    \\foo\bar\blech\bozo
 15928                                  ;	  ^		 ^		     ^
 15929                                  
 15930                                  DIRSTRLEN	EQU	64+3		; Max length in bytes of directory strings
 15931                                  TEMPLEN 	EQU	DIRSTRLEN*2
 15932                                  
 15933                                  struc 		curdir_list
 15934                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 15935 00000000 <res 43h>               .cdir_text	resb	DIRSTRLEN	; text of assignment and curdir
 15936 00000043 ????                    .cdir_flags	resw	1		; various flags
 15937 00000045 ????????                .cdir_devptr	resd	1		; local pointer to DPB or net device
 15938 00000049 ????????                .cdir_ID	resw	2		; cluster of current dir (net ID)
 15939 0000004D ????                    .cdir_usr_word	resw	1
 15940 0000004F ????                    .cdir_end	resw	1		; end of assignment
 15941                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 15942 00000051 ??                      .cdir_type:	resb	1		; IFS drive (2=ifs, 4=netuse)
 15943 00000052 ????????                .cdir_ifd_hdr:	resd	1		; Ptr to File System Header
 15944 00000056 ????                    .cdir_fsda:	resb	2		; File System Dependent Data Area
 15945                                  .size:
 15946                                  endstruc
 15947                                  
 15948                                  curdirlen	EQU	curdir_list.size	; Needed for screwed up
 15949                                  						; ASM87 which doesn't allow
 15950                                  						; Size directive as a macro
 15951                                  						; argument
 15952                                  %define curdir_netID	dword [curdir_list.cdir_ID]
 15953

 15955

 15957                                  curdir_isnet	EQU	1000000000000000B
 15958                                  curdir_isifs	EQU	1000000000000000B
 15959                                  curdir_inuse	EQU	0100000000000000B
 15960                                  curdir_splice	EQU	0010000000000000B
 15961                                  curdir_local	EQU	0001000000000000B

 15963                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15964                                  ; SF.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 15965                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15966                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15967                                  
 15968                                  ; system file table
 15969                                  
 15970                                  ;**	System File Table SuperStructure
 15971                                  ;
 15972                                  ;	The system file table entries are allocated in contiguous groups.
 15973                                  ;	There may be more than one such groups; the SF "superstructure"
 15974                                  ;	tracks the groups.
 15975                                  
 15976                                  struc	SF
 15977 00000000 ????????                .SFLink:	resd	1
 15978 00000004 ????                    .SFCount:	resw	1		; number of entries
 15979 00000006 ????                    .SFTable:	resw	1		; beginning of array of the following
 15980                                  .size:
 15981                                  endstruc
 15982                                  
 15983                                  ;**	System file table entry
 15984                                  ;
 15985                                  ;	These are the structures which are at SFTABLE in the SF structure.
 15986                                  
 15987                                  struc	SF_ENTRY
 15988 00000000 ????                    .sf_ref_count:	resw	1		; number of processes sharing entry
 15989                                  					;   if FCB then ref count
 15990 00000002 ????                    .sf_mode: 	resw	1		; mode of access or high bit on if FCB
 15991 00000004 ??                      .sf_attr: 	resb	1		; attribute of file
 15992 00000005 ????                    .sf_flags:	resw	1		;Bits 8-15
 15993                                  					; Bit 15 = 1 if remote file
 15994                                  					;	 = 0 if local file or device
 15995                                  					; Bit 14 = 1 if date/time is not to be
 15996                                  					;   set from clock at CLOSE.  Set by
 15997                                  					;   FILETIMES and FCB_CLOSE.  Reset by
 15998                                  					;   other reseters of the dirty bit
 15999                                  					;   (WRITE)
 16000                                  					; Bit 13 = Pipe bit (reserved)
 16001                                  					;
 16002                                  					; Bits 0-7 (old FCB_devid bits)
 16003                                  					; If remote file or local file, bit
 16004                                  					; 6=0 if dirty Device ID number, bits
 16005                                  					; 0-5 if local file.
 16006                                  					; bit 7=0 for local file, bit 7
 16007                                  					;      =1 for local I/O device
 16008                                  					; If local I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 16009                                  					;		Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 16010                                  					;		Bit 0=1 if console input device
 16011                                  					;		Bit 1=1 if console output device
 16012                                  					;		Bit 2=1 if null device
 16013                                  					;		Bit 3=1 if clock device

 16317                                  SYSINIT$:
 16318                                  	;IF	STACKSW 
 16319                                  	; include MSSTACK.INC	;Main stack program and data definitions
 16320                                  	; include STKMES.INC	;Fatal stack error message

 16325                                  ; 05/07/2018
 16326                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16327                                  ; 04/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 16328                                  
 16329                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16330                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT)
 16331                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16332                                  
 16333                                  ;	MSStack.inc
 16334                                  ;
 16335                                  ;	Interrupt level 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,(10, 11, 12, 14, 15 - AT level)
 16336                                  ;	should follow the standard Interrupt Sharing Scheme which has
 16337                                  ;	a standard header structure.
 16338                                  ;	Fyi, the following shows the relations between
 16339                                  ;	the interrupt vector and interrupt level.
 16340                                  ; VEC(Hex)    2  8  9  A  B  C	D  E  70  72  73  74  76  77
 16341                                  ; LVL(Deci)   9  0  1  2  3  4	5  6   8  10  11  12  14  15
 16342                                  ;	MSSTACK module modifies the following interrupt vectors
 16343                                  ;	to meet the standard Interrupt Sharing standard;
 16344                                  ;	  A, B, C, D, E, 72, 73, 74, 76, 77.
 16345                                  ;	Also, for interrupt level 7 and 15, the FirstFlag in a standard header
 16346                                  ;	should be initialized to indicat whether this interrupt handler is
 16347                                  ;	the first (= 80h) or not.  The FirstFlag entry of INT77h's
 16348                                  ;	program header is initialized in STKINIT.INC module.
 16349                                  ;	FirstFlag is only meaningful for interrupt level 7 and 15.
 16350                                  ;
 16351                                  
 16352                                  ;  User specifies the number of stack elements - default = 9
 16353                                  ;						 minimum = 8
 16354                                  ;						 maximum = 64
 16355                                  ;
 16356                                  ;  Intercepts Asynchronous Hardware Interrupts only
 16357                                  ;
 16358                                  ;  Picks a stack from pool of stacks and switches to it
 16359                                  ;
 16360                                  ;  Calls the previously saved interrupt vector after pushing flags
 16361                                  ;
 16362                                  ;  On return, returns the stack to the stack pool
 16363                                  ;
 16364                                  
 16365                                  ; This is a modification of STACKS:
 16366                                  ; 1. To fix a bug which was causing the program to take up too much space.
 16367                                  ; 2. To dispense stack space from hi-mem first rather than low-mem first.
 16368                                  ;    . Clobbers the stack that got too big instead of innocent stack
 16369                                  ;    . Allows system to work if the only stack that got too big was the most
 16370                                  ;      deeply nested one
 16371                                  ; 3. Disables NMI interrupts while setting the NMI vector.
 16372                                  ; 4. Does not intercept any interupts on a PCjr.
 16373                                  ; 5. Double checks that a nested interrupt didn't get the same stack.
 16374                                  ; 6. Intercepts Ints 70, 72-77 for PC-ATs and other future products
 16375                                  
 16376                                  		;EVEN
 16377                                  ;align 2
 16378                                  		; 21/10/2022
 16379                                  
 16380 00000000 0000                    		dw	0	; spare field but leave these in order
 16381 00000002 0000                    stackcount:	dw	0
 16382 00000004 0000                    stackat: 	dw	0
 16383 00000006 0000                    stacksize:	dw	0
 16384 00000008 0000                    stacks:		dw	0
 16385 0000000A 0000                    		dw	0
 16386                                  
 16387 0000000C [0800]                  firstentry:	dw	stacks
 16388 0000000E [4800]                  lastentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 16389 00000010 [4800]                  nextentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 16390                                  
 16391                                  ;***********************************************************************
 16392                                  ; THESE ARE THE INDIVIDUAL INTERRUPT HANDLERS
 16393                                  
 16394                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16395                                  
 16396 00000012 00000000                old02:	dd	0
 16397                                  
 16398                                  int02:
 16399                                  
 16400                                  ; *********************************************************************
 16401                                  ;
 16402                                  ; this is special support for the pc convertible / nmi handler
 16403                                  ;
 16404                                  ;	on the pc convertible, there is a situation where an nmi can be 
 16405                                  ;	caused by using the "out" instructions to certain ports. when this
 16406                                  ;	occurs, the pc convertible hardware *guarantees* that **nothing** 
 16407                                  ;	can stop the nmi or interfere with getting to the nmi handler. this
 16408                                  ;	includes other type of interrupts (hardware and software), and
 16409                                  ;	also includes other type of nmi's. when any nmi has occured,
 16410                                  ;	no other interrtupt (hardware, software or nmi) can occur until
 16411                                  ;	the software takes specific steps to allow further interrupting.
 16412                                  ;
 16413                                  ;	for pc convertible, the situation where the nmi is generated by the
 16414                                  ;	"out" to a control port requires "fixing-up" and re-attempting. in
 16415                                  ;	otherwords, it is actually a "restartable exception". in this
 16416                                  ;	case, the software handler must be able to get to the stack in
 16417                                  ;	order to figure out what instruction caused the problem, where
 16418                                  ;	it was "out"ing to and what value it was "out"ing.  therefore,
 16419                                  ;	we will not switch stacks in this situation. this situation is
 16420                                  ;	detected by interrogating port 62h, and checking for a bit value
 16421                                  ;	of 80h. if set, *****do not switch stacks*****.
 16422                                  ;
 16423                                  ; *********************************************************************
 16424                                  
 16425 00000016 50                      	push	ax
 16426 00000017 06                      	push	es
 16427 00000018 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h
 16428 0000001B 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 16429                                  	; 02/11/2022
 16430 0000001D 26803EFEFFF9            	cmp	byte [es:0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; check if convertible
 16431 00000023 07                      	pop	es
 16432 00000024 750C                    	jne	short normal02
 16433                                  
 16434 00000026 E462                    	in	al,62h		; PC/XT PPI port C. Bits:
 16435                                  				; 0-3: values of DIP switches
 16436                                  				; 5: 1=Timer 2 channel out
 16437                                  				; 6: 1=I/O channel check
 16438                                  				; 7: 1=RAM parity check error occurred.
 16439 00000028 A880                    	test	al,80h
 16440 0000002A 7406                    	jz	short normal02
 16441                                  special02:
 16442 0000002C 58                      	pop	ax
 16443 0000002D 2EFF2E[1200]            	jmp	far [cs:old02]
 16444                                  normal02:
 16445 00000032 58                      	pop	ax
 16446 00000033 E81101                  	call	do_int_stacks
 16447 00000036 [1200]                  	dw	old02
 16448                                  
 16449                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16450                                  
 16451 00000038 00000000                old08:	dd	0
 16452                                  
 16453                                  int08:
 16454 0000003C E80801                  	call	do_int_stacks
 16455 0000003F [3800]                  	dw	old08
 16456                                  
 16457                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16458                                  
 16459 00000041 00000000                old09:	dd	0
 16460                                  
 16461                                  int09:
 16462                                  
 16463                                  ; keyboard interrupt must have a three byte jump, a nop and a zero byte
 16464                                  ; as its first instruction for compatibility reasons
 16465                                  
 16466 00000045 EB02                    	jmp	short keyboard_lbl
 16467 00000047 90                      	nop
 16468 00000048 00                      	db	0
 16469                                  
 16470                                  keyboard_lbl:
 16471 00000049 E8FB00                  	call	do_int_stacks
 16472 0000004C [4100]                  	dw	old09
 16473                                  
 16474                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16475                                  
 16476 0000004E 00000000                old70:	dd	0
 16477                                  
 16478                                  int70:
 16479 00000052 E8F200                  	call	do_int_stacks
 16480 00000055 [4E00]                  	dw	old70
 16481                                  
 16482                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16483                                  
 16484                                  ;	irp	a,<0a,0b,0c,0d,0e,72,73,74,76,77>
 16485                                  ;public	int&a
 16486                                  ;public	old&a
 16487                                  ;public	firstflag&a
 16488                                  ;int&a	proc	far
 16489                                  ;	jmp	short entry_int&a&_stk
 16490                                  ;old&a	dd	  0		;forward pointer
 16491                                  ;	dw	  424bh 	;compatible signature for int. sharing
 16492                                  ;firstflag&a db   0		;the firstly hooked.
 16493                                  ;	jmp	short intret_&a	;reset routine. we don't care this.
 16494                                  ;	db	7 dup (0)	;reserved for future.
 16495                                  ;entry_int&a&_stk:
 16496                                  ;	call	do_int_stacks
 16497                                  ;	dw	old&a
 16498                                  ;intret_&a:
 16499                                  ;	iret
 16500                                  ;int&a	endp
 16501                                  ;	endm
 16502                                  
 16503                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16504                                  
 16505                                  int0A:
 16506 00000057 EB10                    	jmp	short entry_int0A_stk
 16507 00000059 00000000                old0A:	dd	0

 16674                                  
 16675                                  ;********************************************************************
 16676                                  ;common routines
 16677                                  ;********************************************************************
 16678                                  
 16679                                  ; do interrupt stack switching. the fake return address holds
 16680                                  ; a pointer to the far-pointer of the actual interrupt
 16681                                  ; service routine
 16682                                  
 16683                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 16684                                  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16685                                  
 16686                                  ;allocbyte   equ 0
 16687                                  ;intlevel    equ 1
 16688                                  ;savedsp     equ 2
 16689                                  ;savedss     equ 4
 16690                                  ;newsp       equ 6
 16691                                  
 16692                                  do_int_stacks:
 16693 00000147 50                      	push	ax
 16694 00000148 55                      	push	bp
 16695 00000149 06                      	push	es
 16696 0000014A 2E8E06[0A00]            	mov	es,[cs:stacks+2]	; Get segment of stacks
 16697 0000014F 2E8B2E[1000]            	mov	bp,[cs:nextentry]	; get most likely candidate
 16698 00000154 B001                    	mov	al,allocated ; 1
 16699                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16700                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al 
 16701                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16702 00000156 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al		; grab the entry
 16703 0000015A 3C00                    	cmp	al,free ; 0		; still avail?
 16704 0000015C 754F                    	jne	short notfree02
 16705                                  
 16706 0000015E 2E832E[1000]08          	sub	word [cs:nextentry],entrysize ; set for next interrupt
 16707                                  
 16708                                  found02:
 16709 00000164 26896602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],sp	; save sp value
 16710 00000168 268C5604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ss	; save ss also
 16711                                  
 16712 0000016C 89E8                    	mov	ax,bp			; temp save of table offset
 16713                                  
 16714 0000016E 268B6E06                	mov	bp,[es:bp+newsp]	; get new SP value
 16715                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16716                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+6]
 16717                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16718                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0],ax	
 16719 00000172 26394600                	cmp	[es:bp],ax		; check for offset into table
 16720 00000176 7542                    	jne	short foundbad02
 16721                                  
 16722                                  	;mov	ax,es			; point ss,sp to the new stack
 16723                                  	;mov	es,bp
 16724                                  	;mov	bp,sp
 16725                                  	;mov	bp,[bp+6]
 16726                                  	;mov	ss,ax
 16727                                  	;mov	sp,es
 16728                                  	;mov	es,ax
 16729                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp]
 16730                                  
 16731                                  	; 21/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 code SYSINIT code)
 16732 00000178 55                      	push    bp
 16733 00000179 89E5                    	mov     bp,sp
 16734 0000017B 8B4608                  	mov     ax,[bp+8]
 16735 0000017E 5D                      	pop     bp
 16736 0000017F 06                      	push    es
 16737 00000180 17                      	pop     ss
 16738 00000181 89EC                    	mov     sp,bp
 16739 00000183 89C5                    	mov     bp,ax
 16740                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16741                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp+0]	
 16742 00000185 2E8B6E00                	mov	bp,[cs:bp]	
 16743                                  
 16744 00000189 9C                      	pushf				; go execute the real interrupt handler
 16745                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16746 0000018A 2EFF5E00                	call	far [cs:bp]		;  which will iret back to here
 16747                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16748                                  	;call	far [cs:bp+0]
 16749                                  
 16750 0000018E 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp			; retrieve the table offset for us
 16751                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16752 00000190 268B6E00                	mov	bp,[es:bp]		;  but leave it on the stack
 16753                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16754                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+0]
 16755 00000194 268E5604                	mov	ss,[es:bp+savedss]	; get old stack back
 16756 00000198 268B6602                	mov	sp,[es:bp+savedsp]
 16757                                  
 16758                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16759                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; free the entry
 16760                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16761 0000019C 26C6460000              	mov	byte [es:bp],free ; 0
 16762 000001A1 2E892E[1000]            	mov	[cs:nextentry],bp	; setup to use next time
 16763                                  
 16764 000001A6 07                      	pop	es
 16765 000001A7 5D                      	pop	bp			; saved on entry
 16766 000001A8 58                      	pop	ax			; saved on entry
 16767 000001A9 83C402                  	add	sp,2
 16768 000001AC CF                      	iret				; done with this interrupt
 16769                                  
 16770                                  notfree02:
 16771 000001AD 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; error flag
 16772 000001AF 7404                    	je	short findnext02	;  no, continue
 16773                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16774                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, restore error value
 16775                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16776 000001B1 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 16777                                  
 16778                                  findnext02:
 16779 000001B5 E81200                  	call	longpath
 16780 000001B8 EBAA                    	jmp	short found02
 16781                                  
 16782                                  foundbad02:
 16783 000001BA 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 16784 000001BF 72F4                    	jc	short findnext02
 16785 000001C1 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			; flag this entry
 16786                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16787                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],clobbered
 16788                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16789 000001C3 26C6460003              	mov	byte [es:bp],clobbered ; 3
 16790 000001C8 EBEB                    	jmp	short findnext02	; keep looking
 16791                                  
 16792                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16793                                  
 16794                                  ; Common routines
 16795                                  
 16796                                  longpath:
 16797                                  	; 21/03/2019
 16798 000001CA 2E8B2E[0E00]            	mov	bp,[cs:lastentry]	; start with last entry in table
 16799                                  lploopp:
 16800                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16801                                  	;cmp	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; is entry free?
 16802                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16803 000001CF 26807E0000              	cmp	byte [es:bp],free
 16804 000001D4 7512                    	jne	short inuse		;  no, try next one
 16805                                  
 16806 000001D6 B001                    	mov	al,allocated
 16807                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16808                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	; allocate entry
 16809                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16810 000001D8 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 16811 000001DC 3C00                    	cmp	al,free 		; is it still free?
 16812 000001DE 7414                    	je	short found		;  yes, go use it
 16813                                  
 16814 000001E0 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; is it other than Allocated or Free?
 16815 000001E2 7404                    	je	short inuse		;  no, check the next one
 16816                                  
 16817                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16818                                  	;mov	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, put back the error state
 16819                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16820 000001E4 26884600                	mov	[es:bp],al
 16821                                  inuse:
 16822 000001E8 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 16823 000001ED 7406                    	je	short fatal
 16824 000001EF 83ED08                  	sub	bp,entrysize
 16825 000001F2 EBDB                    	jmp	short lploopp
 16826                                  found:
 16827 000001F4 C3                      	retn
 16828                                  fatal:
 16829 000001F5 1E                      	push	ds
 16830 000001F6 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		;look at the model byte
 16831 000001F9 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 16832 000001FB 803EFEFFF9              	cmp	byte [0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; convertible?
 16833 00000200 1F                      	pop	ds
 16834 00000201 7504                    	jne	short skip_nmis
 16835                                  
 16836 00000203 B007                    	mov	al,07h			; disable pc convertible nmis
 16837 00000205 E672                    	out	72h,al
 16838                                  
 16839                                  skip_nmis:
 16840 00000207 FA                      	cli				; disable and mask
 16841 00000208 B0FF                    	mov	al,0FFh			;   all other ints
 16842 0000020A E621                    	out	021h,al
 16843 0000020C E6A1                    	out	0A1h,al
 16844                                  
 16845 0000020E 8CCE                    	mov	si,cs
 16846 00000210 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si
 16847 00000212 BE[3902]                	mov	si,fatal_msg
 16848                                  ;SR;
 16849                                  ;   We set all foci to this VM to issue the stack failure message
 16850                                  ;
 16851 00000215 50                      	push	ax
 16852 00000216 1E                      	push	ds
 16853                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 16854                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h
 16855                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16856 00000217 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG
 16857 0000021A 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 16858

 16860 0000021C F606[CE08]01            	test	byte [IsWin386],1 ; (retrodos4.sys, offset: ****h)
 16861 00000221 1F                      	pop	ds
 16862 00000222 58                      	pop	ax

 16864

 16866                                  	;call	KERNEL_SEGMENT:V86_Crit_SetFocus ; set focus to this VM
 16867                                  	; 21/10/2022

 16871                                  ;
 16872                                  fatal_loop:

 18034                                  ; code entry points will be located in low memory. Dos_segreinit is used

 18042                                  ; to install the low memory stub (this must be done before allowing any

 18044                                  ; call dos_segreinit at all, since the interrupt vector table has already

 18308 000007C4 BE[AA02]                	mov	si,command_line+1
 18309 000007C7 1E                      	push    ds
 18310 000007C8 07                      	pop     es
 18311 000007C9 89F7                    	mov     di,si
 18312 000007CB B1FF                    	mov     cl,0FFh ; -1
 18313                                  _@_loop:
 18314 000007CD FEC1                    	inc     cl ; +1
 18315 000007CF AC                      	lodsb

 18324                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18325                                  
 18326                                  ;   Once we get to this point, the above code, which is below "retry"
 18327                                  ;   in memory, can be trashed (and in fact is -- see references to retry
 18328                                  ;   which follow....)
 18329                                  
 18330                                  retry:
 18331 000007DD BA[D534]                	mov	dx,commnd	; now pointing to file description
 18332                                  
 18333                                  ; we are going to open the command interpreter and size it as is done in
 18334                                  ; ldfil. the reason we must do this is that sysinit is in free memory. if
 18335                                  ; there is not enough room for the command interpreter,exec will probably
 18336                                  ; overlay our stack and code so when it returns with an error sysinit won't be
 18337                                  ; here to catch it. this code is not perfect (for instance .exe command
 18338                                  ; interpreters are possible) because it does its sizing based on the
 18339                                  ; assumption that the file being loaded is a .com file. it is close enough to
 18340                                  ; correctness to be usable.
 18341                                  
 18342                                  ; first, find out where the command interpreter is going to go.
 18343                                  
 18344 000007E0 52                      	push	dx		; save pointer to name
 18345 000007E1 BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh
 18346 000007E4 B448                    	mov	ah,48h	; ALLOC
 18347 000007E6 CD21                            int     21h             ; get biggest piece
 18348 000007E8 B448                    	mov	ah,48h	; ALLOC
 18349 000007EA CD21                    	int	21h		; second time gets it
 18350 000007EC 7243                    	jc	short memerrjx	; oooops
 18351                                  
 18352 000007EE 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 18353 000007F0 B449                    	mov	ah,49h	; DEALLOC
 18354 000007F2 CD21                    	int	21h		; give it right back
 18355 000007F4 89DD                    	mov	bp,bx
 18356                                  
 18357                                  ; es:0 points to block,and bp is the size of the block in para.
 18358                                  
 18359                                  ; we will now adjust the size in bp down by the size of sysinit.
 18360                                  ; we need to do this because exec might get upset if some of the exec
 18361                                  ; data in sysinit is overlayed during the exec.
 18362                                  
 18363                                  	; 22/10/2022
 18364                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT:083Bh)
 18365 000007F6 8B1E[9202]                      mov     bx,[MEMORY_SIZE] ; get location of end of memory
 18366 000007FA 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs		 ; get location of beginning of sysinit
 18367                                  
 18368                                  ; Note that the "config_wrkseg" environment data is a segment in
 18369                                  ; unallocated memory (as of the Dealloc of [area], above). This is ideal
 18370                                  ; in one sense, because Exec is going to make a copy of it for COMMAND.COM
 18371                                  ; anyway, and no one has responsibility for freeing "config_wrkseg". But
 18372                                  ; we need to make sure that there's no way Exec will stomp on that data
 18373                                  ; before it can copy it, and one way to do that is to make the available
 18374                                  ; memory calculation even more "paranoid", by subtracting "config_wrkseg"
 18375                                  ; from the "memory_size" segment value (which is typically A000h) instead
 18376                                  ; of the current sysinit CS....
 18377                                  ;
 18378                                  ; The reason I use the term "paranoid" is because this code should have
 18379                                  ; slid the data required by Exec up to the very top of memory, because as
 18380                                  ; it stands, you have to have sizeof(COMMAND.COM) PLUS 64K to load just
 18381                                  ; COMMAND.COM (64k is about what sysinit, and all the goop above sysinit,
 18382                                  ; consumes). Now it's just a little worse (65K or more, depending on
 18383                                  ; the size of your CONFIG.SYS, since the size of the environment workspace

 18631                                  ; procedure : AllocFreeMem
 18632                                  ;
 18633                                  ; Allocate Max memory from DOS to find out where to load DOS.
 18634                                  ; DOS is at temporary location when this call is being made
 18635                                  ;
 18636                                  ; Inputs : None
 18637                                  ; Outputs: The biggest chunk of memory is allocated (all mem at init time)
 18638                                  ;	   [area] & [memhi] set to the para value of the start of the
 18639                                  ;	   free memory.
 18640                                  ;
 18641                                  ; Uses   : AX, BX
 18642                                  ;

 18727                                  ; procedure : TryToMovDOSHi
 18728                                  ;
 18729                                  ;		This tries to move DOS into HMA.

 18734                                  ;		the A20 switching code in the low mem stub to be installed.
 18735                                  ; 
 18736                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18737                                  
 18738                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 18739                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:092Ah)

 18750                                  	;;mov	es,[cs:FINAL_DOS_LOCATION] ; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18751                                  	; 11/12/2022
