 18769                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18770                                  ;
 18771                                  ; procedure : MovDOSHi
 18772                                  ;
 18773                                  ;		Tries to allocate HMA and Move DOS/BIOS code into HMA
 18774                                  ;		For ROMDOS, the code is not actually moved, but the
 18775                                  ;		HMA is allocated and prepared for sub-allocation.
 18776                                  ;
 18777                                  ;		Returns : CY if it failed
 18778                                  ;
 18779                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18780                                  
 18781                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 18782                                  MovDOSHi:
 18783                                  	; 14/05/2019
 18784                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18785                                  	; ds = cs
 18786 000008F3 E8D800                  	call	AllocHMA
 18787 000008F6 7213                    	jc	short mdhx			; did we get HMA?
 18788 000008F8 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh			; yes, HMA seg = 0ffffh
 18789 000008FB 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 18790                                  
 18791                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 18792                                  	; actually move the BIOS and DOS
 18793                                  
 18794                                  	; NOTE: Retro DOS v4.0 does not move BIOS (IO.SYS) to HMA
 18795                                  	; 24/03/2019
 18796                                  	
 18797                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18798 000008FD E83400                  	call	MovBIOS				; First move BIOS into HMA
 18799                                  
 18800                                  	; ES:DI points to free HMA after BIOS
 18801                                  	
 18802                                  	; 14/05/2019
 18803                                  	; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18804                                  	;xor	di,di
 18805                                  	
 18806                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18807                                  	;mov	cx,[cs:hi_doscod_size]		; pass the code size of DOS
 18808                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18809                                  	; ds = cs
 18810 00000900 8B0E[8102]              	mov	cx,[hi_doscod_size]		; when it is in HMA
 18811 00000904 E81100                  	call	MovDOS				; and move it
 18812                                  
 18813                                  	; ES:DI points to free HMA after DOS
 18814                                  ;else
 18815                                  ;	; allocate space at beginning of HMA to allow for CPMHack
 18816                                  ;
 18817                                  ;	mov	di,0E0h				; room for 5 bytes at ffff:d0
 18818                                  ;
 18819                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS
 18820                                  
 18821 00000907 E86202                  	call	SaveFreeHMAPtr			; Save the Free HMA ptr
 18822 0000090A F8                      	clc
 18823                                  mdhx:
 18824 0000090B C3                      	retn
 18825

 18830                                  ;		Allocates memory from DOS and moves BIOS/DOS code into it

 18840                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18841                                  	; ds = cs

 18850                                  	; 24/03/2019
 18851

 18853 00000911 E82000                  	call	MovBIOS
 18854                                  
 18855                                  ;------ ES:DI points memory immediately after BIOS
 18856                                  
 18857                                  	; 14/05/2019
 18858                                  	; NOTE: 
 18859                                  	;     Order of (RETRO) DOS kernel sections at memory:
 18860                                  	;	BIOSDATA+BIOSCODE+BIOSDATAINIT+DOSDATA+DOSCODE(LOW)
 18861                                  
 18862                                  	; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18863                                  	;xor	di,di	
 18864                                  
 18865                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18866                                  	;mov	cx,[cs:lo_doscod_size]		; DOS code size when loaded

 19144                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 19145                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 19146                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 19147                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 19148                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 19149                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 19150                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 19151                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 19152                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 19153                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 19154                                  ;	  stub will go.
 19155                                  ;
 19156                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 19157                                  
 19158                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19159                                  update_arena:
 19160 00000987 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 19161 00000988 57                      	push	di
 19162 00000989 51                      	push	cx
 19163 0000098A 52                      	push	dx
 19164                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19165                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 19166                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19167                                  	; ds = cs 
 19168 0000098B C53E[6B02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 19169 0000098F 4F                      	dec	di
 19170 00000990 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 19171                                  						;  before sysvar
 19172 00000991 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 19173                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 19174 00000993 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 19175 00000998 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 19176 0000099A 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 19177                                  
 19178                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 19179 0000099C 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 19180 000009A1 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 19181 000009A3 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 19182 000009A5 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 19183 000009A7 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19184                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 19185 000009A9 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 19186                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 19187 000009AD C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 19188 000009B3 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block
 19189                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIZE],cx			; store it in the arena
 19190 000009B5 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 19191 000009B9 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller
 19192                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19193                                  	;; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)	; Take care ORG 30h of
 19194 000009BB 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				;  BIOS code
 19195 000009BE 5A                      	pop	dx
 19196 000009BF 59                      	pop	cx
 19197 000009C0 5F                      	pop	di
 19198 000009C1 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs
 19199 000009C2 C3                      	retn
 19200                                  ;
 19201                                  ; M012 : END
 19202                                  ;
 19203                                  FatalErr:

 19207 000009C8 B409                    	mov	ah,9

 19209                                  				; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 19210                                          ;jmp	stall

 19212 000009CC FA                      	cli
 19213 000009CD F4                      	hlt

 19219                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19220                                  ;
 19221                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 19222                                  ;
 19223                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 19224                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 19225                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 19226                                  ;
 19227                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 19228                                  ;
 19229                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19230                                  
 19231                                  AllocHMA:
 19232                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 19233                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 19234                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 19235                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 19236                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.
 19237                                  
 19238                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 19239                                  ;
 19240                                  ;	xor	ax,ax
 19241                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)
 19242                                  ;	push	ax
 19243                                  ;	popf
 19244                                  ;	pushf
 19245                                  ;	pop	ax
 19246                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)
 19247                                  ;	and	ax,0F000h
 19248                                  ;	cmp	ax,0F000h	; 8088/8086?
 19249                                  ;	jz	short grab_hma_error
 19250                                  
 19251                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19252                                  	; (SYSINIT:0A26h)
 19253                                  
 19254 000009CE 1E                      	push	ds
 19255                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data
 19256                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT
 19257                                  	; 21/10/2022
 19258 000009CF B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG
 19259 000009D2 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19260                                  
 19261 000009D4 E84A00                  	call	IsXMSLoaded
 19262 000009D7 7545                    	jnz	short grabhma_error
 19263                                  
 19264 000009D9 B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 19265 000009DC CD2F                    	int	2Fh		; get the vector into es:bx
 19266                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 19267                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 19268                                  
 19269 000009DE 891E[0E00]              	mov	[xms],bx
 19270                                  	;mov	[0Eh], bx
 19271 000009E2 8C06[1000]              	mov	[xms+2],es
 19272                                  	;mov	[10h],es
 19273                                  
 19274 000009E6 B401                    	mov	ah,1		; request HMA
 19275 000009E8 BAFFFF                  	mov	dx,0FFFFh
 19276                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 19277 000009EB FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 19278 000009EF 48                      	dec	ax
 19279 000009F0 7409                    	jz	short allocHMA_1 ; error if not able to allocate HMA
 19280                                  
 19281                                  ;------ Himem may be lying because it has allocated mem for int 15
 19282                                  
 19283 000009F2 B488                    	mov	ah,88h
 19284 000009F4 CD15                    	int	15h
 19285                                  		; Get Extended Memory Size
 19286                                  		; Return: CF clear on success
 19287                                  		; AX = size of memory above 1M in K
 19288 000009F6 83F840                  	cmp	ax,64		; less than 64 K of hma ?
 19289                                  	;jb	short grabhma_error
 19290                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19291 000009F9 7224                    	jb	short grabhma_err ; cf=1
 19292                                  allocHMA_1:
 19293 000009FB B405                    	mov	ah,5		; localenableA20
 19294                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 19295 000009FD FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 19296 00000A01 48                      	dec	ax
 19297 00000A02 751A                    	jnz	short grabhma_error ; error if couldn't enable A20
 19298                                  
 19299 00000A04 E88901                  	call	IsVDiskInstalled
 19300 00000A07 7415                    	jz	short grabhma_error ; yes, we cant use HMA
 19301                                  
 19302 00000A09 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh
 19303 00000A0C 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 19304 00000A0E 26C70610003412          	mov	word [es:10h],1234h ; see if we can really read/write there
 19305 00000A15 26813E10003412          	cmp	word [es:10h],1234h
 19306                                  	;jne	short grabhma_error ; don't try to load there if XMS lied
 19307                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19308 00000A1C 7401                    	je	short allocHMA_ok	
 19309                                  
 19310                                  ; 11/12/2022
 19311                                  ;	; 11/12/2022
 19312                                  ;	; cf=0
 19313                                  ;	;clc
 19314                                  ;	pop	ds
 19315                                  ;	retn
 19316                                  
 19317                                  grabhma_error:
 19318 00000A1E F9                      	stc
 19319                                  	; 11/12/022
 19320                                  grabhma_err:	; cf=1
 19321                                  allocHMA_ok:	; cf=0
 19322 00000A1F 1F                      	pop	ds
 19323 00000A20 C3                      	retn
 19324                                  
 19325                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19326                                  ;
 19327                                  ; procedure : IsXMSLoaded
 19328                                  ;
 19329                                  ;             Checks whether a XMS driver is loaded
 19330                                  ;
 19331                                  ; Returns : Z flag set if XMS driver loaded
 19332                                  ;           Z flag reset if no XMS drivers are present
 19333                                  ;
 19334                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19335                                  
 19336                                  IsXMSLoaded:
 19337 00000A21 B80043                  	mov	ax,4300h

 19339                                  				; Return: AL = 80h XMS driver installed
 19340                                  				; AL <> 80h no driver
 19341 00000A26 3C80                    	cmp	al,80h		; XMS installed?
 19342 00000A28 C3                      	retn

 19389                                  
 19390                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19391                                  ;
 19392                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 19393                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 19394                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 19395                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 19396                                  ;
 19397                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 19398                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 19399                                  ;
 19400                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19401                                  
 19402                                  StartVDHead:

 19452                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19453                                  ;
 19454                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 19455                                  ;
 19456                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 19457                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 19458                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 19459                                  ;
 19460                                  ; Inputs : None
 19461                                  ;
 19462                                  ; Outputs : None
 19463                                  ;
 19464                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 19465                                  ;
 19466                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19467                                  
 19468                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19469                                  
 19470                                  InstVDiskHeader:

 19472 00000A9C 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table

 19481                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 19482 00000AA8 2EA3[780A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 19483                                  
 19484                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 19485

 19487                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 19488                                  	; 23/10/2022

 19490 00000AB1 CD21                    	int	21h
 19491                                  
 19492                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 19493                                  
 19494 00000AB3 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena

 19496                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; owner = System

 19498                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; System Code
 19499 00000ABD 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:8],'SC'

 19501 00000AC5 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; get back to allocated memory
 19502                                  
 19503                                  ;-------------- install new int 19 vector
 19504                                  
 19505 00000AC7 FA                      	cli				; no reboots at this time

 19588                                  
 19589                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 19590                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 19591                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 19592                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 19593                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 19594                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 19595                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 19596                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 19597                                  ;								      ;I070
 19598                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 19599                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 19600                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 19601                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 19602                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 19603                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 19604                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 19605                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 19606                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 19607                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 19608                                  ;								      ;I070
 19609                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 19610                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 19611                                  
 19612                                  	; 12/12/2022
 19613                                  	; ds = cs

 19619 00000B4B D3EA                    	shr	dx,cl

 19650                                  ; procedure : SaveFreeHMAPtr
 19651                                  ;
 19652                                  ;		Save the Free HMA pointer in BIOS variable for later use.
 19653                                  ;		(INT 2f ax==4a01 call returns pointer to free HMA)
 19654                                  ;		Normalizes the pointer to ffff:xxxx format and stores only
 19655                                  ;		the offset.
 19656                                  ;
 19657                                  ; Inputs : ES:DI - pointer to free HMA
 19658                                  ; Output : FreeHMAPtr in BIOS data segment updated
 19659                                  ;
 19660                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19661                                  
 19662                                  SaveFreeHMAPtr:

 19664 00000B6E B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh		; HMA segment
 19665 00000B71 29D8                    	sub	ax,bx
 19666 00000B73 83C70F                  	add	di,15			; para round
 19667 00000B76 83E7F0                  	and	di,0FFF0h
 19668 00000B79 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 19669 00000B7B D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 19670 00000B7D 29C7                    	sub	di,ax
 19671 00000B7F 1E                      	push	ds
 19672                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 19673                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h
 19674                                  	; 21/10/2022
 19675 00000B80 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 19676 00000B83 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19677 00000B85 893E[F508]              	mov	[FreeHMAPtr],di	   ; (ds:8F7h for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 19678 00000B89 C606[0D00]FF            	mov	byte [inHMA],0FFh  ; (ds:0Dh)
 19679 00000B8E 1F                      	pop	ds
 19680 00000B8F C3                      	retn

 19783                                  
 19784                                  ;	BUGBUG - we don't update confbot - won't someone else use it?
 19785                                  ;	chuckst -- answer: no. Confbot is used to access the CDSs,
 19786                                  ;	25 jul 92  which are stored BELOW it. Alloclim is the
 19787                                  ;		   variable which has the top of free memory for
 19788                                  ;		   device driver loads, etc.

 19791                                  
 19792                                  ;	chuckst, 25 Jul 92 -- note: I'm removing the code here
 19793                                  ;		that automatically updates alloclim every time we
 19794                                  ;		set up some new CDSs. Instead, I've added code
 19795                                  ;		which pre-allocates space for 26 CDSs. This
 19796                                  ;	        way we've got room for worst case CDSs before

 19815                                  ;*	Initialize our temporary CDSs. We'll init each CDS with the
 19816                                  ;	info from the corresponding DPB.
 19817                                  ;
 19818                                  ;	(cx) = count of CDSs left to process
 19819                                  ;	(es:di) = address of next CDS
 19820                                  
 19821                                  fooset:
 19822                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19823 00000C0B 2EA1[A502]              	mov	ax,[cs:DirStrng] ; "A:"
 19824 00000C0F AB                      	stosw				; setup the root as the curdir
 19825                                  
 19826                                  	;call	get_dpb_for_drive_al	; get dpb for drive in dpb
 19827

 19829                                  ;		 (si) = -1 if no drive
 19830                                  
 19831 00000C10 2EA1[A702]              	mov	ax,[cs:DirStrng+2] ; "\",0
 19832 00000C14 AB                      	stosw
 19833 00000C15 2EFE06[A502]            	inc	byte [cs:DirStrng]
 19834 00000C1A 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 19835 00000C1C 51                      	push	cx
 19836                                  	;mov	cx,curdir_list.cdir_flags - 4 ; 63
 19837 00000C1D B93F00                  	mov	cx,63	; 23/10/2022
 19838 00000C20 F3AA                    	rep	stosb			; zero out rest of CURDIR_TEXTs
 19839                                  
 19840                                  ;	should handle the system that does not have any floppies.
 19841                                  ;	in this case,we are going to pretended there are two dummy floppies
 19842                                  ;	in the system. still they have dpb and cds,but we are going to
 19843                                  ;	0 out curdir_flags,curdir_devptr of cds so ibmdos can issue
 19844                                  ;	"invalid drive specification" message when the user try to
 19845                                  ;	access them.
 19846                                  ;
 19847                                  ;	(ax) = 0
 19848                                  ;	(es:di) = CURDIR_FLAGS in the CDS records
 19849                                  ;	(ds:si) = Next DPB (-1 if none)
 19850                                  
 19851 00000C22 83FEFF                  	cmp	si,-1	; cmp si,0FFFFh
 19852 00000C25 7414                    	je	short fooset_zero	; don't have any physical drive.
 19853                                  
 19854                                  ;	check to see if we are faking floppy drives. if not go to normcds.
 19855                                  ;	if we are faking floppy drives then see if this cds being initialised
 19856                                  ;	is for drive a: or b: by checking the appropriate field in the dpb
 19857                                  ;	pointed to by ds:si. if not for a: or b: then go to normcds. if
 19858                                  ;	for a: or b: then execute the code given below starting at fooset_zero.
 19859                                  ;	for dpb offsets look at inc\dpb.inc.
 19860                                  
 19861 00000C27 2E803E[8902]01          	cmp	byte [cs:fake_floppy_drv],1
 19862 00000C2D 7513                    	jne	short normcds 		; machine has floppy drives
 19863                                  	;cmp	byte [si+DPB.drive],1	; if dpb_drive = 0 (a) or 1 (b).

 20608                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 20609                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 20610                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 20611                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 20612                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 20613                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 20614                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 20615                                  ;
 20616                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 20617                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 20618                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 20619                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 20620                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 20621                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 20622                                  ;
 20623                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 20624                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 20625                                  ;
 20626                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 20627                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 20628                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 20629                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 20630                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 20631                                  ;
 20632                                  ;	for round-up machine
 20633                                  ;
 20634                                  ;			  none.
 20635                                  
 20636                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 20637                                  ;
 20638                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 20639                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 20640                                  
 20641                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20642

 20843                                  ; 26/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 20844                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)	
 20845                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20846                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 20847                                  ;
 20848                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 20849                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 20850                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 20851                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 20852                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 20853                                  ; program).
 20854                                  
 20855                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 20856                                  
 20857                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 20858                                  
 20859 00001041 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 20860                                  
 20861                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 20862                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 20863                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 20864                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 20865                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 20866                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 20867                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 20868                                  ; carridge return.
 20869                                  
 20870                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 20871                                  ;character after =.
 20872                                  
 20873 00001042 06                      	push	es
 20874 00001043 1E                      	push	ds
 20875 00001044 07                      	pop	es
 20876 00001045 1F                      	pop	ds			; es->sysinitseg,ds->confbot seg
 20877 00001046 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 20878                                  
 20879 00001048 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 20880 0000104A FC                      	cld
 20881 0000104B 2EC606[6D03]20          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],' ' ; clear out the parm area
 20882 00001051 BF[6E03]                	mov	di,ldexec_parm
 20883                                  installfilename:			; skip the file name
 20884 00001054 AC                      	lodsb				; al = ds:si; si++
 20885 00001055 3C00                    	cmp	al,0
 20886 00001057 7402                    	je	short got_installparm
 20887 00001059 EBF9                    	jmp	short installfilename
 20888                                  got_installparm:			; copy the parameters to ldexec_parm
 20889 0000105B AC                      	lodsb
 20890 0000105C 268805                  	mov	[es:di],al
 20891 0000105F 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf	; cmp al,0Ah	; line feed?
 20892 00001061 7405                    	je	short done_installparm
 20893 00001063 FEC1                    	inc	cl			; # of char. in the parm.
 20894 00001065 47                      	inc	di
 20895 00001066 EBF3                    	jmp	short got_installparm
 20896                                  done_installparm:
 20897 00001068 2E880E[6C03]            	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_line],cl ; length of the parm.
 20898 0000106D 80F900                  	cmp	cl,0			; if no parm,then
 20899 00001070 7506                    	jne	short install_seg_set 	; let the parm area
 20900 00001072 2EC606[6D03]0D          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],cr ; 0Dh 
 20901                                  					; starts with cr.
 20902                                  install_seg_set:
 20903 00001078 2EC70600000000          	mov	word [cs:0],0		; make a null environment segment
 20904 0000107F 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs			; by overlap jmp instruction of sysinitseg.

 20992                                  
 20993                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 20994                                  ;
 20995                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 20996                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 20997                                  ;
 20998                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 20999                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 21000                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 21001                                  
 21002                                  ParaRound:
 21003 000010C1 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 21004 000010C4 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 21005 000010C6 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21006 000010C8 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21007 000010CA D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21008 000010CC C3                      	retn
 21009                                  
 21010                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21011                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 21012                                  ;
 21013                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 21014                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 21015                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 21016                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 21017                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 21018                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 21019                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 21020                                  ;
 21021                                  ;in: after relocation,
 21022                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 21023                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 21024                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 21025                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 21026                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 21027                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 21028                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 21029                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 21030                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 21031                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 21032                                  ;
 21033                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 21034                                  
 21035                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21036                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21037                                  sysinit_base:				
 21038 000010CD 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 21039 000010D2 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 21040 000010D7 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 21041 000010D9 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 21042 000010DE 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 21043 000010E3 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 21044 000010E4 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 21045 000010E5 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 21046                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 21047                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 21048 000010E7 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 21049 000010EA 263906[5603]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 21050 000010EF 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 21051                                  
 21052                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 21053                                  
 21054 000010F1 B409                    	mov	ah,9
 21055 000010F3 0E                      	push	cs
 21056 000010F4 1F                      	pop	ds
 21057 000010F5 BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21058 000010F8 CD21                    	int	21h
 21059                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 21060                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 21061                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21062                                  _stall: 
 21063                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21064 000010FA F4                      	hlt 
 21065                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21066                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 21067 000010FB EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 21068                                  
 21069                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 21070 000010FD 26FF2E[5203]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 21071                                  
 21072                                  ;-------------------------------------
 21073                                  
 21074                                  sum_up:
 21075                                  
 21076                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 21077                                  ;out:  ax - result
 21078                                  ;
 21079                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 21080                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 21081                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 21082                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 21083                                  ;
 21084                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 21085                                  
 21086 00001102 1E                      	push	ds
 21087                                  	;mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 21088                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21089 00001103 26A1[A102]              	mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 21090 00001107 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21091 00001109 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 21092 0000110B 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21093 0000110D 268B0E[4C03]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 21094                                  					;whole test better fail.
 21095 00001112 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 21096 00001114 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 21097                                  sum1:
 21098 00001116 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 21099 00001118 46                      	inc	si
 21100 00001119 46                      	inc	si
 21101 0000111A E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 21102                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 21103                                  sum_sys_code:
 21104                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21105 0000111C BE1C11                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21106                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 21107                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 21108                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 21109                                  	; 02/11/2022
 21110                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 21111                                  	; 30/12/2022 (BugFix)
 21112                                  	; (SI_End is 39D0h for this -Retro DOS v4.0- IO.SYS)
 21113 0000111F B9[6039]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 21114 00001122 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 21115 00001124 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 21116                                  sum2:
 21117 00001126 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 21118 00001129 46                      	inc	si
 21119 0000112A 46                      	inc	si
 21120 0000112B E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 21121 0000112D 1F                      	pop	ds
 21122 0000112E C3                      	retn
 21123                                  
 21124                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21125                                  
 21126                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 21127                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:
 21128 0000112F 0000                    	dw	0
 21129                                  sysinit_base_sp equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 63 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1161h)
 21130                                  ;SYSINIT:11BFh:
 21131 00001131 0000                    	dw	0

 21145                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21146                                  ; Set_Buffer
 21147                                  ;
 21148                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 21149                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 21150                                  ;
 21151                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 21152                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 21153                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 21154                                  ;
 21155                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 21156                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 21157                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21158                                  
 21159                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21160                                  	; (SYSINIT:11DCh)
 21161                                  
 21162                                  set_buffer:
 21163 0000114E 30D2                    	xor	dl,dl				; assume buffers not in HMA
 21164 00001150 E85500                  	call	GetBufferAddr
 21165 00001153 7402                    	jz	short set_buff_1
 21166 00001155 B201                    	mov	dl,1				; buffers in HMA
 21167                                  set_buff_1:
 21168                                  	; 25/10/2022
 21169                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue],di	; head of Buff Q
 21170 00001157 893F                    	mov	[bx],di
 21171                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue+2],es
 21172 00001159 8C4702                  	mov	[bx+2],es
 21173                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Dirty_Buff_Count],0 ;set dirty_count to 0.
 21174 0000115C C747040000              	mov	word [bx+4],0
 21175                                  
 21176 00001161 89F8                    	mov	ax,di
 21177 00001163 2E8B0E[9702]            	mov	cx,[cs:buffers]
 21178 00001168 57                      	push	di				; remember first buffer
 21179                                  
 21180                                  ;	for each buffer
 21181                                  
 21182                                  nxt_buff:

 21218                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21219                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 21220                                  ;
 21221                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 21222                                  ;
 21223                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 21224                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA

 21229 000011A8 53                      	push	bx
 21230 000011A9 52                      	push	dx

 21236                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 21237                                  	; 12/12/2022

 21239 000011B8 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 21240 000011BA B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h

 21242 000011BD CD2F                    	int	2Fh

 21244 000011C2 7508                    	jne	short got_hma
 21245 000011C4 BF0000                  	mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 21246                                  	;zf=1
 21247                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 21248                                  	;zf=1
 21249 000011C7 2E8E06[E003]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 21250                                  got_hma:

 21252 000011CD 5B                      	pop	bx
 21253 000011CE C3                      	retn

 21283                                  ; ======================================================================
 21284                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 21285                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21286                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21287                                  
 21288                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21289                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 21290                                  ;
 21291                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 21292                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 21293                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 21294                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 21295                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 21296                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 21297                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 21298                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 21299                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 21300                                  ;
 21301                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 21302                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 21303                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 21304                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 21305                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 21306                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 21307                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 21308                                  ;	conditions:
 21309                                  ;
 21310                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 21311                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 21312                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 21313                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 21314                                  ;
 21315                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 21316                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 21317                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 21318                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 21319                                  ;
 21320                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 21321                                  ;
 21322                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 21323                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 21324                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 21325                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 21326                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 21327                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 21328                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 21329                                  ;	interrupt line.
 21330                                  ;
 21331                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 21332                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 21333                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 21334                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 21335                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 21336                                  ;
 21337                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 21338                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 21339                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 21340                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 21341                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 21342                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 21343                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 21344                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 21345                                  ;
 21346                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 21347                                  
 21348                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21349                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 21350                                  
 21351                                  	; 14/12/2022
 21352                                  stackinit:
 21353 000011F7 50                      	push	ax
 21354 000011F8 1E                      	push	ds
 21355 000011F9 06                      	push	es
 21356 000011FA 53                      	push	bx
 21357 000011FB 51                      	push	cx
 21358 000011FC 52                      	push	dx
 21359 000011FD 57                      	push	di
 21360 000011FE 56                      	push	si
 21361 000011FF 55                      	push	bp
 21362                                  
 21363                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 21364                                  
 21365                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21366                                  	; ds = cs
 21367 00001200 A1[8A02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 21368 00001203 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 21369                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21370                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 21371                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs

 21373                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)

 22183                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22184                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22185                                  
 22186                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22187                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 22188                                  
 22189                                  new_init_loop:
 22190                                  
 22191                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 22192                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 22193                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 22194                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 22195                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 22196                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 22197                                  
 22198 000013EC 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 22199 000013EF 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 22200 000013F1 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 22201 000013F5 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 22202                                  
 22203 000013F8 1E                      	push	ds
 22204                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 22205                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 22206                                  	; 21/10/2022
 22207 000013F9 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 22208 000013FC 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 22209 000013FE 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 22210 00001401 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 22211 00001403 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 22212 00001407 894502                  	mov	word [di+2],ax
 22213 0000140A 1F                      	pop	ds
 22214                                  
 22215 0000140B 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 22216 0000140E 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 22217 00001412 C3                      	retn
 22218                                  
 22219                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
 22220                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22221                                  
 22222                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22223                                  ;set the devmark for mem command.
 22224                                  ;in: [memhi] - the address to place devmark
 22225                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 22226                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 22227                                  ;out: devmark established.
 22228                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 22229                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.
 22230                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22231                                  
 22232                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22233                                  ; (SYSINIT:1637h)
 22234                                  
 22235                                  setdevmark:
 22236                                  
 22237 00001413 06                      	push	es
 22238 00001414 51                      	push	cx
 22239                                  
 22240 00001415 2E8B0E[E003]            	mov	cx,[cs:memhi]
 22241 0000141A 2E890E[3414]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
