 22453                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22454                                  ; PARMS 	LABEL	BYTE
 22455                                  ;		DW	PARMSX
 22456                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 22457                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 22458                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA DELIMITER LIST,
 22459                                  ;					; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="
 22460                                  ;					; "," & WHITESPACE ALWAYS
 22461                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 22462                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA END OF LINE LIST, CR, LF OR 0 ALWAYS
 22463                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22464                                  
 22465                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMS block structure
 22466                                  struc _$P_PARMS_Blk
 22467 00000000 ????                     .PARMSX_Address:  resw 1		;AN000; Address of PARMSX
 22468 00000002 ??                       .Num_Extra:	   resb 1		;AN000; Number of extra stuff
 22469 00000003 ??                       .Len_Extra_Delim: resb 1		;AN000; Length of extra delimiter
 22470                                  endstruc
 22471                                  
 22472                                  _$P_Len_PARMS	   equ	4		;AN000;
 22473                                  _$P_I_Use_Default  equ	0		;AN000; no extra stuff specified
 22474                                  _$P_I_Have_Delim   equ	1		;AN000; extra delimiter specified
 22475                                  _$P_I_Have_EOL	   equ	2		;AN000; extra EOL specified
 22476                                  
 22477                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22478                                  ; PARMSX	LABEL	BYTE
 22479                                  ;		DB	minp,maxp	; MIN, MAX POSITIONAL OPERANDS ALLOWED
 22480                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF POSITIONAL 1
 22481                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxp-1 TIMES
 22482                                  ;		DB	maxs		; # OF SWITCHES
 22483                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF SWITCH 1
 22484                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxs-1 TIMES
 22485                                  ;		DB	maxk		; # OF KEYWORD
 22486                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF KEYWORD 1
 22487                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxk-1 TIMES
 22488                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22489                                  
 22490                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMSX block structure
 22491                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 22492 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 22493 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 22494 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 22495                                  endstruc
 22496                                  
 22497                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22498                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 22499                                  ;
 22500                                  ;
 22501                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 22502                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 22503                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22504                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22505                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22506                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22507                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22508                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22509                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22510                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22511                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22512                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 22513                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 22514                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 22515                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 22516                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 22517                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 22518                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 22519                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 22520                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 22521                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 22522                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 22523                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 22524                                  ;	   :
 22525                                  ;
 22526                                  ;Note:
 22527                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 22528                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 22529                                  ;
 22530                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 22531                                  ;
 22532                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 22533                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 22534                                  ;
 22535                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 22536                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 22537                                  ;
 22538                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 22539                                  ;
 22540                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 22541                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 22542                                  ;
 22543                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22544                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 22545                                  ;
 22546                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 22547                                  ;
 22548                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22549                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 22550                                  ;
 22551                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22552                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22553                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22554                                  ;
 22555                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 22556                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 22557                                  ;
 22558                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 22559                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 22560                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 22561                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22562                                  
 22563                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 22564                                  
 22565                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 22566                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 22567                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 22568                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 22569                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 22570                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 22571                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 22572                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 22573                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 22574                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 22575                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 22576                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 22577                                  
 22578                                  ;**** Function flags
 22579                                  
 22580                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 22581                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 22582                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 22583                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 22584                                  
 22585                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 22586                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 22587 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 22588 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 22589 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 22590 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 22591 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 22592 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 22593                                  endstruc
 22594                                  
 22595                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22596                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 22597                                  ;
 22598                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 22599                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 22600                                  ;	     +-
 22601                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 22602                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 22603                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 22604                                  ;	     |	:
 22605                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 22606                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 22607                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 22608                                  ;	     |	:
 22609                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 22610                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 22611                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 22612                                  ;	     +-	:
 22613                                  ;
 22614                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 22615                                  ;
 22616                                  ;Note:
 22617                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 22618                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 22619                                  ;
 22620                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22621                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22622                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22623                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22624                                  
 22625                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 22626                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 22627                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 22628                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 22629                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 22630                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 22631                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 22632                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 22633                                  
 22634                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 22635 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 22636 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 22637 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 22638 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 22639 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 22640                                  endstruc
 22641                                  
 22642                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22643                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 22644                                  ;
 22645                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 22646                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 22647                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 22648                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 22649                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 22650                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 22651                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 22652                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 22653                                  ;
 22654                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 22655                                  ;
 22656                                  ;            +-
 22657                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 22658                                  ;	    | or
 22659                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 22660                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 22661                                  ;	    | or
 22662                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 22663                                  ;	    | or
 22664                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 22665                                  ;	    | or
 22666                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 22667                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 22668                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 22669                                  ;	    | or
 22670                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 22671                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 22672                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 22673                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 22674                                  ;	    +-
 22675                                  ;
 22676                                  ;
 22677                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 22678                                  ;      list.
 22679                                  ;
 22680                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 22681                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 22682                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 22683                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22684                                  
 22685                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure
 22686                                  struc _$P_Result_Blk
 22687 00000000 ??                       .Type:        resb 1		;AN000; Type returned
 22688 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 22689 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 22690 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 22691                                  endstruc
 22692                                  
 22693                                  ;--------------------------------
 22694                                  ;**** values for the type field in the result block
 22695                                  
 22696                                  _$P_EOL		   equ	0		;AN000; End of line
 22697                                  _$P_Number	   equ	1		;AN000; Number

 22802                                  ; PARSE.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991

 22806                                  ;***********************************************************************
 22807                                  ; SysParse;
 22808                                  ;
 22809                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 22810                                  ;
 22811                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 22812                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 22813                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 22814                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 22815                                  ;
 22816                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 22817                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 22818                                  ;		 is in DS.
 22819                                  ;
 22820                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 22821                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 22822                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 22823                                  ;
 22824                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 22825                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 22826                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 22827                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 22828                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 22829                                  ;
 22830                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 22831                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 22832                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 22833                                  ;
 22834                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 22835                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 22836                                  ;
 22837                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 22838                                  ;
 22839                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 22840                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 22841                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 22842                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 22843                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 22844                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 22845                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 22846                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 22847                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 22848                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 22849                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 22850                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 22851                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 22852                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 22853                                  ;	     (tm08)
 22854                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 22855                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 22856                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 22857                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 22858                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 22859                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 22860                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 22861                                  ;					  (tm12)
 22862                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 22863                                  ;					  (tm13)
 22864                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 22865                                  ;					  (tm14)
 22866                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 22867                                  ;					  (tm15)
 22868                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 22869                                  
 22870                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 22871                                  
 22872                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 22873                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 22874                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 22875                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 22876                                  
 22877                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 22878                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 22879                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 22880                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 22881                                  ;
 22882                                  
 22883                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 22884                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 22885                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 22886                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 22887                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 22888                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 22889                                  
 22890                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 22891                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 22892                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 22893                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 22894                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 22895                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 22896                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 22897                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 22898                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 22899                                  
 22900                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 22901                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 22902                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 22903                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 22904                                  ;	     segment.
 22905                                  
 22906                                  ;  9/16/87 : Ed K (;AN023;) PTM1040
 22907                                  ;	     in _$P_set_cdi PROC, it assumes CS points to psdata. Change Push CS
 22908                                  ;	     into PUSH cs.  In _$P_Get_DecNum PROC, fix AN020
 22909                                  ;	     forced both TIME and DATE to use the delims, "-","/",".".
 22910                                  ;	     Created FLag, in _$P_time_Format PROC, to request the delim in
 22911                                  ;	     BL be used if TIME is being parsed.
 22912                                  
 22913                                  ;  9/24/87 : Ed K
 22914                                  ;	     Removed the include to STRUC.INC.	Replaced the STRUC macro
 22915                                  ;	     invocations with their normally expanded code; made comments

 22926                                  ;	     _$P_SQuote EQU also removed from PSDATA.INC.  Any references to
 22927                                  ;	     single quote in PROC prologues are left as is for history reasons.
 22928                                  
 22929                                  ;	     This fixes another bug, not mentioned in p1672, in that two
 22930                                  ;	     quote chars within a quoted string is supposed to be reported as
 22931                                  ;	     one quote character, but is reported as two quotes.  This changed
 22932                                  ;	     two instructions in PROC _$P_Quoted_Str.
 22933

 23011                                  ; The table of special chars _$P_FileSp_Char should be initialized on every
 23012                                  ;entry to SysParse. This is in the non-checksum region and any program that
 23013                                  ;corrupts this table but does not corrupt the checksum region will leave
 23014                                  ;command.com parsing in an inconsistent state.
 23015                                  ; NB: The special characters string has been hardcoded here. If any change
 23016                                  ;is made to it in psdata.inc, a corresponding change needs to be made here.

 23022 00001518 2EC706[DD14]3B3D        	mov 	word [cs:_$P_FileSp_Char+6], ';='

 23432                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 23433                                  ;
 23434                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 23435                                  ;
 23436                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 23437                                  ;	    AL = type
 23438                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 23439                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 23440                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 23441                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 23442                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 23443                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 23444                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 23445                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 23446                                  ;
 23447                                  ; Output:   None
 23448                                  ;
 23449                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 23450                                  ;
 23451                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)

 23539                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23540                                  ; _$P_Check_Match_Flags
 23541                                  ;
 23542                                  ; Function:  Check the mutch_flags and make the exit code and set the
 23543                                  ;	     result buffer
 23544                                  ;
 23545                                  ;	    Check for types in this order:
 23546                                  ;		Complex
 23547                                  ;		Date
 23548                                  ;		Time
 23549                                  ;		Drive
 23550                                  ;		Filespec
 23551                                  ;		Quoted String
 23552                                  ;		Simple String
 23553                                  ;
 23554                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 23555                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 23556                                  ;
 23557                                  ; Output:    None
 23558                                  ;
 23559                                  ; Use:	     _$P_Value, P$_SValue, _$P_Simple_String, _$P_Date_Format
 23560                                  ;	     _$P_Time_Format, _$P_Complex_Format, _$P_File_Foemat
 23561                                  ;	     _$P_Drive_Format
 23562                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23563                                  
 23564                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23565                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:19CFh)

 23567                                  	; 12/12/2022

 23655                                  ;
 23656                                  ; Function: Remove colon at end
 23657                                  ;
 23658                                  ; Input:    cs:SI points to string buffer to be examineed
 23659                                  ;

 23666 00001851 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;

 23668                                  _$P_RCOL_Loop:				;AN000;

 23670 00001856 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of string ?

 23672

 23675

 23678

 23680 00001869 EB09                    	jmp	short _$P_RCOL_Exit	;AN000; and exit.
 23681                                  
 23682                                  _$P_RCOL00:				;AN000;
 23683 0000186B E84404                  	call	_$P_Chk_DBCS		;AN000; if not colon, then check if
 23684 0000186E 7301                    	jnc	short _$P_RCOL01	;AN000; DBCS leading byte.

 23687                                  _$P_RCOL01:				;AN000;

 23703                                  ;	    AL = 4 : Use file table

 23744                                  ;	    DL = 4 : Use file table

 23821                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23822                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 23823                                  ;
 23824                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 23825                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 23826                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 23827                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 23828                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 23829                                  ;
 23830                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 23831                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 23832                                  ;
 23833                                  ; Output:    None
 23834                                  ;
 23835                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 23836                                  ;
 23837                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 23838                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23839                                  
 23840                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23841                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 23842                                  
 23843                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 23844 000018DB 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 23845 000018DC 2E800E[4914]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 23846 000018E2 2E8026[4914]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 23847 000018E8 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get sign
 23848 000018EB 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 23849 000018ED 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 23850                                  
 23851 000018EF 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?
 23852 000018F1 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Sval01	;AN000; else
 23853                                  
 23854 000018F3 2E800E[4914]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 23855                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;
 23856 000018F9 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip sign char
 23857                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;
 23858 000018FA E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value
 23859 000018FD 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 23860 000018FE C3                      	retn
 23861

 24055                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24056                                  ; _$P_Check_OVF
 24057                                  ;
 24058                                  ; Function:  Check if overflow is occurred with consideration of
 24059                                  ;	     signed or un-signed numeric value
 24060                                  ;
 24061                                  ; Input:     Flag register
 24062                                  ;
 24063                                  ; Output:    CY = 1  :	Overflow
 24064                                  ;
 24065                                  ; Vars:     _$P_Flags(R)
 24066                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24067                                  
 24068                                  	; 26/10/2022
 24069                                  _$P_Check_OVF:
 24070 000019F0 9C                      	pushf				;AN000;
 24071 000019F1 2EF606[4914]02          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; is it negative value ?
 24072 000019F7 7502                    	jnz	short _$P_COVF 		;AN000; if no, check overflow
 24073                                  
 24074 000019F9 9D                      	popf				;AN000; by the CY bit
 24075 000019FA C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24076                                  
 24077                                  _$P_COVF:				;AN000;
 24078 000019FB 9D                      	popf				;AN000; else,
 24079 000019FC 7002                    	jo	short _$P_COVF00	;AN000; check overflow by the OF
 24080                                  
 24081 000019FE F8                      	clc				;AN000; indicate it with CY bit
 24082 000019FF C3                      	retn				;AN000; CY=0 means no overflow
 24083                                  
 24084                                  _$P_COVF00:				;AN000;
 24085 00001A00 F9                      	stc				;AN000; and CY=1 means overflow
 24086 00001A01 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24087                                  
 24088                                  ;***********************************************************************

 24566                                  ;
 24567                                  ; Function: Skip delimiters specified in the PARMS list, white space
 24568                                  ;	    and comma.
 24569                                  ;
 24570                                  ; Input:    DS:SI -> Command String
 24571                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 24572                                  ;
 24573                                  ; Output:   CY = 1 if the end of line encounterd
 24574                                  ;	    CY = 0 then SI move to 1st non-delimiter character
 24575                                  ;	    AL = Last examineed character
 24576                                  ;
 24577                                  ; Use:	    _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim,
 24578                                  ;
 24579                                  ; Vars:     _$P_Flags(R)
 24580                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24581                                  
 24582                                  _$P_Skip_Delim:
 24583                                  _$P_Skip_Delim_Loop:			;AN000;
 24584 00001BDE AC                      	lodsb				;AN000;
 24585 00001BDF E81F00                  	call	_$P_Chk_EOL		;AN000; is it EOL character ?
 24586 00001BE2 7417                    	jz	short _$P_Skip_Delim_CY	;AN000; if yes, exit w/ CY on
 24587                                  
 24588 00001BE4 E85000                  	call	_$P_Chk_Delim		;AN000; is it one of delimiters ?
 24589 00001BE7 7515                    	jnz	short _$P_Skip_Delim_NCY ;AN000; if no, exit w/ CY off
 24590                                  
 24591 00001BE9 2EF606[4914]20          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Extra ;AC034; extra delim or comma found ?
 24592 00001BEF 74ED                    	jz	short _$P_Skip_Delim_Loop ;AN000; if no, loop
 24593                                  
 24594 00001BF1 2EF606[4914]41          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW+_$P_equ ;AC034; /x , or xxx=zzz , (tm08)
 24595 00001BF7 7407                    	jz	short _$P_Exit_At_Extra	;AN000; no switch, no keyword (tm08)
 24596                                  
 24597                                  	;dec	si			;AN000; backup si for next call (tm08)
 24598                                  	;jmp	short _$P_Exit_At_Extra	;AN000; else exit w/ CY off
 24599                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24600                                  	; cf=0
 24601 00001BF9 EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_Skip_Delim_Exit
 24602                                  
 24603                                  _$P_Skip_Delim_CY:			;AN000;
 24604 00001BFB F9                      	stc				;AN000; indicate EOL
 24605 00001BFC EB01                    	jmp	short _$P_Skip_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 24606                                  
 24607                                  _$P_Skip_Delim_NCY:			;AN000;
 24608 00001BFE F8                      	clc				;AN000; indicate non delim
 24609                                  _$P_Skip_Delim_Exit:			;AN000; in this case, need
 24610 00001BFF 4E                      	dec	si			;AN000;  backup index pointer
 24611                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24612                                  _$P_Exit_At_Extra:	 ; cf=0
 24613 00001C00 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24614                                  
 24615                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24616                                  ;_$P_Exit_At_Extra:			;AN000;
 24617                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate extra delim
 24618                                  	;retn				;AN000;
 24619                                  
 24620                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24621                                  ; _$P_Chk_EOL;
 24622                                  ;
 24623                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of End of Line characters.
 24624                                  ;
 24625                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 24626                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 24627                                  ;
 24628                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of End of Line characters
 24629                                  ;**********************************************************************
 24630                                  
 24631                                  _$P_Chk_EOL:
 24632 00001C01 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 24633 00001C02 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 24634 00001C03 3C0D                    	cmp	al,_$P_CR		;AN000; Carriage return ?
 24635 00001C05 742D                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 24636                                  
 24637 00001C07 3C00                    	cmp	al,_$P_NULL		;AN000; zero ?
 24638 00001C09 7429                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 24639                                  
 24640                                  ;IF LFEOLSW				;AN028; IF LF TO BE ACCEPTED AS EOL
 24641 00001C0B 3C0A                    	cmp	al,_$P_LF		;AN000; Line feed ?
 24642 00001C0D 7425                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 24643                                  ;ENDIF					;AN028;
 24644                                  
 24645 00001C0F 26807D0202              	cmp	byte [es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_EOL 
 24646                                  					;AN000; EOL character specified ?
 24647 00001C14 721E                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 24648                                  
 24649 00001C16 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			;AN000;
 24650 00001C18 268A5D03                	mov	bl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim]
 24651                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 24652 00001C1C 83C304                  	add	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS 	;AN000; skip it
 24653 00001C1F 26803900                	cmp	byte [es:bx+di],_$P_I_Use_Default ;AN000; No extra EOL character ?
 24654 00001C23 740D                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_NZ	;AN000;
 24655                                  
 24656                                  	;xor	cx,cx			;AN000; Get number of extra character
 24657 00001C25 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 24658 00001C27 268A09                  	mov	cl,[es:bx+di]		;AN000;
 24659                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_Loop:			;AN000;
 24660 00001C2A 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 24661 00001C2B 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra EOL character
 24662 00001C2E 7404                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 24663                                  
 24664 00001C30 E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_EOL_Loop 	;AN000;
 24665                                  
 24666                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_NZ:				;AN000;
 24667 00001C32 3C0D                    	cmp	al,_$P_CR		;AN000; reset ZF
 24668                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit:			;AN000;
 24669 00001C34 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 24670 00001C35 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 24671 00001C36 C3                      	retn
 24672                                  
 24673                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24674                                  ; _$P_Chk_Delim;
 24675                                  ;
 24676                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of delimiter characters.
 24677                                  ;	    if AL+[si] is DBCS blank, it is replaced with two SBCS
 24678                                  ;	    blanks.
 24679                                  ;
 24680                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 24681                                  ;	    DS:SI -> Next Character
 24682                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 24683                                  ;
 24684                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of delimiter characters
 24685                                  ;	    SI points to the next character
 24686                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W), _$P_Flags(W)
 24687                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24688                                  
 24689                                  _$P_Chk_Delim:
 24690 00001C37 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 24691 00001C38 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 24692 00001C39 2EC606[4314]20          	mov	byte [cs:_$P_Terminator],_$P_Space 
 24693                                  					;AC034; Assume terminated by space
 24694                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags20,0DFh
 24695 00001C3F 2E8026[4914]DF          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Extra ;AC034;
 24696 00001C45 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space ; 20h	;AN000; Space ?
 24697 00001C47 7436                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 24698                                  
 24699 00001C49 3C09                    	cmp	al,_$P_TAB		;AN000; TAB ?
 24700 00001C4B 7432                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 24701                                  
 24702 00001C4D 3C2C                    	cmp	al,_$P_Comma		;AN000; Comma ?
 24703 00001C4F 7431                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 24704                                  
 24705                                  	; 26/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 24706                                  _$P_Chk_Delim00: 			;AN000;
 24707 00001C51 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_DBSP1	; 20h	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS Space ?
 24708 00001C53 750C                    	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 24709                                  
 24710 00001C55 803C20                  	cmp	byte [si],_$P_DBSP2 ; 20h ;AN000; 2nd byte of DBCS Space ?
 24711 00001C58 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 24712                                  
 24713 00001C5A B020                    	mov	al,_$P_Space		;AN000;
 24714 00001C5C 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; make si point to next character
 24715 00001C5D 38C0                    	cmp	al,al			;AN000; Set ZF
 24716 00001C5F EB1E                    	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 24717                                  
 24718                                  _$P_Chk_Delim01: 			;AN000;
 24719 00001C61 26807DFE01              	cmp	byte [es:di-_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_Delim 
 24720                                  					;AN000; delimiter character specified ?
 24721 00001C66 7217                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 24722                                  
 24723                                  	;xor	cx,cx			;AN000;
 24724 00001C68 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 24725                                  	;mov	cl,[es:di+3]
 24726 00001C6A 268A4D03                	mov	cl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim] 
 24727                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 24728 00001C6E 09C9                    	or	cx,cx			;AN000; No extra Delim character ?
 24729 00001C70 740B                    	jz	short _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ 	;AN000;
 24730                                  
 24731 00001C72 BB0300                  	mov	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS-1 ; 3	;AN000; set bx to 1st extra delimiter
 24732                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Loop:			;AN000;
 24733 00001C75 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 24734 00001C76 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra Delim character
 24735 00001C79 7407                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 24736                                  
 24737 00001C7B E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_Delim_Loop	;AN000; examine all extra delimiter
 24738                                  
 24739                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ:			;AN000;
 24740 00001C7D 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space		;AN000; reset ZF
 24741                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit:			;AN000;
 24742                                  _$P_ChkDfin:				;AN000;
 24743 00001C7F 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 24744 00001C80 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 24745 00001C81 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24746                                  
 24747                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0:			;AN000;
 24748 00001C82 2EA2[4314]              	mov	[cs:_$P_Terminator],al ;AC034; keep terminated delimiter
 24749 00001C86 2EF606[4914]01          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_equ ;AN027;AC034;; if terminating a key=
 24750 00001C8C 7506                    	jnz	short _$P_No_Set_Extra 	;AN027; then do not set the EXTRA bit
 24751                                  
 24752 00001C8E 2E800E[4914]20          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Extra 
 24753                                  					;AC034; flag terminated extra delimiter or comma
 24754                                  _$P_No_Set_Extra:			;AN027;
 24755 00001C94 38C0                    	cmp	al,al			;AN000; set ZF
 24756 00001C96 EBE7                    	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 24757                                  
 24758                                  
 24759                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24760                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 24761                                  ;
 24762                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 24763                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 24764                                  ;
 24765                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 24766                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 24767                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 24768                                  ;
 24769                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 24770                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 24771                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 24772                                  
 24773                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 24774                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 24775                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 24776                                  ;
 24777                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 24778                                  
 24779                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 24780                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24781                                  
 24782                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 24783                                  	;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 24784 00001C98 8D2E[5214]              	lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	; BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 24785                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 24786 00001C9C 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 24787 00001C9E 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 24788                                  
 24789                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 24790 00001CA0 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 24791 00001CA2 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 24792                                  
 24793 00001CA4 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 24794                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 24795                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24796 00001CA5 C3                      	retn
 24797                                  
 24798                                  ; 12/12/2022
 24799                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 24800                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 24801                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 24802                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 24803                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 24804                                  
 24805                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 24806                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 24807 00001CA6 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 24808 00001CA8 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 24809                                  
 24810 00001CAA 2E800E[4914]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 24811                                  ;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 24812                                  
 24813                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24814                                  	; cf=0
 24815                                  	;retn
 24816                                  
 24817                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 24818                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24819                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 24820 00001CB0 F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 24821                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 24822                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 24823 00001CB1 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24824                                  
 24825                                  ;**************************************************************************
 24826                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 24827                                  ;
 24828                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 24829                                  ;
 24830                                  ;  Input:
 24831                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 24832                                  ;
 24833                                  ;  Output:
 24834                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 24835                                  ;
 24836                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 24837                                  ;
 24838                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 24839                                  ;***************************************************************************
 24840                                  
 24841                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 24842 00001CB2 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 24843 00001CB3 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 24844 00001CB4 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 24845                                  	
 24846 00001CB5 2E833E[4614]00          	cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 24847 00001CBB 7527                    	jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 24848                                  
 24849 00001CBD 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24850 00001CBE 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 24851 00001CBF 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 24852 00001CC0 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 24853 00001CC1 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 24854 00001CC2 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 24855 00001CC3 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 24856 00001CC4 31F6                    	xor	si,si			;AN000;
 24857 00001CC6 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si			;AN000;
 24858 00001CC8 B80063                  	MOV	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 24859 00001CCB CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 24860                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 24861 00001CCD 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 24862 00001CCF 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 24863 00001CD1 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 24864 00001CD2 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 24865 00001CD3 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 24866 00001CD4 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 24867 00001CD5 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 24868 00001CD6 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 24869 00001CD7 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 24870 00001CD8 7429                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 24871                                  
 24872                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 24873 00001CDA 2E8936[4414]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 24874 00001CDF 2E891E[4614]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 24875                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 24876 00001CE4 2E8B36[4414]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 24877 00001CE9 2E8E1E[4614]            	mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 24878                                  
 24879                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 24880 00001CEE 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 24881 00001CF1 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 24882                                  
 24883 00001CF3 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 24884 00001CF5 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 24885                                  
 24886 00001CF7 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 24887 00001CFA 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 24888                                  
 24889 00001CFC F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 24890 00001CFD EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 24891                                  
 24892                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 24893 00001CFF 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 24894 00001D00 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 24895                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 24896 00001D01 EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 24897                                  
 24898                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 24899                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24900                                  	; cf=0
 24901                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 24902                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 24903 00001D03 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 24904 00001D04 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 24905 00001D05 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 24906 00001D06 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 24918                                  struc p_parms
 24919 00000000 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?
 24920 00000002 ??                      	resb	1	; db 1	; an extra delimiter list
 24921 00000003 ??                      	resb	1	; db 1	; length is 1
 24922 00000004 ??                      	resb 	1	; db ';' ; delimiter
 24923                                  .size:
 24924                                  endstruc
 24925                                  
 24926                                  struc p_pos
 24927 00000000 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; numeric value??
 24928 00000002 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; function
 24929 00000004 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; result value buffer
 24930                                  
 24931                                  ; note: by defining result_val before this structure, we could remove
 24932                                  ;  the "result_val" from every structure invocation
 24933                                  
 24934 00000006 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; value list
 24935 00000008 ??                      	resb	1	; db 0	; no switches/keywords
 24936                                  .size:
 24937                                  endstruc
 24938                                  
 24939                                  struc	p_range
 24940 00000000 ??                      	resb	1	; db 1	; range definition
 24941 00000001 ??                      	resb 	1	; db 1	; 1 definition of range
 24942 00000002 ??                      	resb 	1	; db 1	; item tag for this range
 24943 00000003 ????????                	resd	1	; dd ?	; numeric min
 24944 00000007 ????????                	resd	1	; dd ?	; numeric max
 24945                                  .size:
 24946                                  endstruc

 24950                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 24951                                  	; (SYSINIT:1F48h)
 24952                                  
 24953                                  ; buffer = [n | n,m] {/e}
 24954                                  
 24955                                  ;buf_parms p_parms <buf_parmsx>
 24956                                  buf_parms: 
 24957 00001D07 [0C1D]                  	dw	buf_parmsx
 24958 00001D09 01                      	db	1	; an extra delimiter list
 24959 00001D0A 01                      	db	1	; length is 1
 24960 00001D0B 3B                      	db	';'	; delimiter
 24961                                  
 24962                                  buf_parmsx:
 24963 00001D0C 0102[161D][2A1D]        	dw	201h,buf_pos1,buf_pos2	; min 1, max 2 positionals
 24964 00001D12 01                      	db	1			; one switch
 24965 00001D13 [3E1D]                  	dw	sw_x_ctrl
 24966 00001D15 00                      	db	0			; no keywords
 24967                                  
 24968                                  ;buf_pos1 p_pos <8000h,0,result_val,buf_range_1>  ; numeric
 24969                                  buf_pos1:
 24970 00001D16 0080                    	dw	8000h	; numeric value??
 24971 00001D18 0000                    	dw	0	; function
 24972 00001D1A [501D]                  	dw	result_val ; result value buffer	
 24973 00001D1C [1F1D]                  	dw	buf_range_1 ; value list
 24974 00001D1E 00                      	db	0  	; no switches/keywords

 25475                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 25476                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 25477                                  ;
 25478                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25479                                  ;
 25480                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 25481                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 25482                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 25483                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 25484                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 25485                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 25486                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 25487                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 25488                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 25489                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 25490                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 25491                                  ;
 25492                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25493                                  
 25494                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 25495                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 25496                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 25497                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 25498                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 25499                                  
 25500                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 25501                                  
 25502                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 25503                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 25504                                  
 25505                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 25506                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 25507                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 25508                                  
 25509                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 25510                                  ;
 25511                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 25512                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 25513                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 25514                                  ;	           line.
 25515                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 25516                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 25517                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 25518                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 25519                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 25520                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 25521                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 25522                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 25523                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 25524                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 25525                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 25526                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 25527                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 25528                                  ;	           for details).
 25529                                  
 25530                                  fInHigh:  db	0
 25531                                  fUmbTiny: db	0
 25532                                  SegLoad:  dw	0
 25533                                  UmbLoad:  db	0
 25534                                  UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 25535                                  UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 25536                                  fm_umb:   db	0
 25537                                  fm_strat: db	0
 25538                                  fm_argc:  db	0	
 25539                                  
 25540                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 25541                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 25542                                  
 25543                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 25544                                  
 25545                                  %endif
 25546

 25557 00001EEA 0000                    DevSize:	dw	0	; size of the device driver being loaded(paras)
 25558 00001EEC 0000                    DevLoadAddr:	dw	0	; Mem addr where the device driver is 2 b loaded
 25559 00001EEE 0000                    DevLoadEnd:	dw	0	; MaxAddr to which device can be loaded
 25560 00001EF0 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver
 25561 00001EF4 00000000                DevBrkAddr:	dd	0	; Break address of the device driver
 25562                                  ; 27/10/2022 
 25563                                  ;ConvLoad:	db	0	; Use conventional (dos 5 -style) InitDevLoad?
 25564                                  ;
 25565 00001EF8 00                      DevUMB:		db	0	; byte indicating whether to load DDs in UMBs
 25566 00001EF9 0000                    DevUMBAddr:	dw	0	; cuurent UMB used fro loading devices (paras)
 25567 00001EFB 0000                    DevUMBSize:	dw	0	; Size of the current UMB being used   (paras)
 25568 00001EFD 0000                    DevUMBFree:	dw	0	; Start of free are in the current UMB (paras)
 25569                                  ;
 25570 00001EFF 00000000                DevXMSAddr:	dd	0
 25571                                  ;
 25572 00001F03 0000                    DevExecAddr:	dw	0	; Device load address parameter to Exec call
 25573 00001F05 0000                    DevExecReloc:	dw	0	; Device load relocation factor
 25574                                  ;
 25575 00001F07 00                      DeviceHi:	db	0	; Flag indicating whther the current device
 25576                                  				;  is being loaded into UMB
 25577 00001F08 0000                    DevSizeOption:	dw	0	; SIZE= option
 25578                                  ;
 25579 00001F0A 00                      Int12Lied:	db	0	; did we trap int 12 ?
 25580 00001F0B 0000                    OldInt12Mem:	dw	0	; value in 40:13h (int 12 ram)
 25581 00001F0D 50524F544D414E24        ThreeComName:	db	'PROTMAN$'	; 3Com Device name
 25582                                  ;
 25583 00001F15 00                      FirstUMBLinked:	db	0
 25584 00001F16 0000                    DevDOSData:	dw	0	; segment of DOS Data
 25585 00001F18 00000000                DevCmdLine:	dd	0	; Current Command line
 25586 00001F1C 00                      DevSavedDelim:	db	0	; The delimiter which was replaced with null
 25587                                  				; to use the file name in the command line
 25588                                  ;
 25589                                  ;	ifdef	dblspace_hooks
 25590                                  ;MagicHomeFlag:	db	0	; set non-zero when MagicDrv is final placed
 25591                                  ;	endif

 25666                                  ;;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 25667                                  ;;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 25668                                  ;;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 25669                                  ;;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 25670                                  ;;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 25671                                  ;;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 25672                                  ;;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)

 25700                                  
 25701                                  ; find the eof mark in the file. if present,then trim length.
 25702                                  
 25703 00001F7D 50                      	push	ax
 25704 00001F7E 57                      	push	di
 25705 00001F7F 51                      	push	cx
 25706 00001F80 B01A                    	mov	al,1Ah			; eof mark
 25707 00001F82 89D7                    	mov	di,dx			; point to buffer
 25708 00001F84 E305                    	jcxz	puteol			; no chars
 25709 00001F86 F2AE                    	repnz	scasb			; find end
 25710 00001F88 7501                    	jnz	short puteol		; none found and count exhausted

 25713

 25749 00001FA3 7204                    	jc	short conferr 		;if not we've got a problem
 25750 00001FA5 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax

 25759                                  ;
 25760                                  ; entry : multi_pass
 25761                                  ;
 25762                                  ;             called to execute device=,install= commands
