 25767                                  multi_pass:
 25768 00001FB0 0E                      	push	cs
 25769 00001FB1 1F                      	pop	ds
 25770                                  
 25771 00001FB2 803E[4903]0A            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],10
 25772                                  ;jae_endconv:
 25773 00001FB7 73F6                    	jae	short endconv 		; do nothing. just return.
 25774                                  
 25775                                  	;push	word [CONFBOT]
 25776                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25777 00001FB9 FF36[A102]              	push	word [top_of_cdss]
 25778 00001FBD 07                      	pop	es			; es -> confbot
 25779                                  
 25780 00001FBE 8B36[D403]              	mov	si,[org_count]
 25781 00001FC2 8936[D203]              	mov	[count],si		; set count
 25782 00001FC6 31F6                    	xor	si,si ; 0
 25783 00001FC8 8936[D603]                      mov     [chrptr],si		; reset chrptr
 25784 00001FCC 8936[2B03]                      mov     [linecount],si		; reset linecount
 25785                                  
 25786 00001FD0 E86807                  	call	getchr
 25787 00001FD3 EB06                    	jmp	short conflp
 25788                                  
 25789                                  getcom:
 25790 00001FD5 E8B10E                          call    organize                ; organize the file
 25791 00001FD8 E86007                  	call	getchr
 25792                                  conflp: 
 25793 00001FDB 72D2                    	jc	short endconv
 25794                                  
 25795 00001FDD FF06[2B03]                      inc     word [linecount]	; increase linecount
 25796                                  
 25797 00001FE1 C606[3314]00            	mov	byte [multdeviceflag],0	; reset multdeviceflag.
 25798 00001FE6 C606[3614]00            	mov	byte [setdevmarkflag],0	; reset setdevmarkflag.
 25799 00001FEB 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 25800 00001FED 7416                    	je	short blank_line	;  then ignore this line.
 25801                                  
 25802                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25803                                  %if 0
 25804                                  
 25805                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25806                                  
 25807                                  ;   If this is a genuine CONFIG.SYS command, then there should be a line
 25808                                  ;   number immediately following it....
 25809                                  
 25810                                          mov     [config_cmd],al         ; save original command code
 25811                                  	;and	al,NOT CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY
 25812                                  	and	al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; and al,7Fh
 25813                                          cmp     byte [config_multi],0	; is this a multi-config config.sys?
 25814                                          je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 25815                                  
 25816                                          push    ax                      ;
 25817                                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 25818                                          mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 25819                                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 25820                                          xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 25821                                          mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 25822                                          pop     ax
 25823                                  ;
 25824                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 25825                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 25826                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 25827                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 25828                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 25829                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 25830                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 25831                                  ;   spot.
 25832                                  ;
 25833                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 25834                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 25835                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 25836                                  ;   retrieved.
 25837                                  ;
 25838                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
 25839                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 25840                                          ;test	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 25841                                  	test	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 25842                                          jz	short final		; no install cmds, so yes it is
 25843                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; final pass?
 25844                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 25845                                  final:                                  ;
 25846                                  	mov	[es:si],al		; save backward-compatible command code
 25847                                  not_final:                              ;
 25848                                  ;endif
 25849                                  
 25850                                  %endif

 25852 00001FF1 E84707                  	call	getchr
 25853 00001FF4 7314                    	jnc	short tryi

 25858 00001FFB 73B2                    	jnb	short endconv	
 25859 00001FFD E90707                  	jmp	badop

 25873                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25874                                  ; 11/12/2022
 25875                                  ; (there is not a jump or call to here from anywhere!)
 25876                                  ;coff_p:
 25877                                  	;push	cs
 25878                                  	;pop	ds
 25879                                  
 25880                                  ;to handle install= commands,we are going to use multi-pass.
 25881                                  ;the first pass handles the other commands and only set install_flag when
 25882                                  ;it finds any install command. the second pass will only handle the
 25883                                  ;install= command.
 25884                                  
 25885                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25886                                  ;install command
 25887                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25888                                  
 25889                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 25890                                  	; (SYSINIT:2250h)
 25891                                  tryi:
 25892 0000200A 803E[4903]00            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],0	; the initial pass for DOS=HI
 25893 0000200F 7503                    	jne	short not_init_pass
 25894 00002011 E92301                  	jmp	multi_try_doshi
 25895                                  not_init_pass:
 25896 00002014 803E[4903]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; the second pass was for ifs=
 25897                                          ; 11/12/2022
 25898                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2	; now it is NOPs
 25899 00002019 74E5                    	je	short coff
 25900                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25901                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 25902                                  					; This pass can be made use of if
 25903                                  					; we want do some config.sys process
 25904                                  					; after device drivers are loaded
 25905                                  					; and before install= commands
 25906                                  					; are processed
 25907                                  
 25908 0000201B 803E[4903]03            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; the third pass for install= ?
 25909 00002020 7411                    	je	short multi_try_i
 25910 00002022 80FC48                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_DOS  ; 'H'
 25911                                  	; 11/12/2022
 25912                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2
 25913 00002025 74D9                    	je	short coff
 25914                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25915                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 25916                                  
 25917                                  ;       make note of any INSTALL= or INSTALLHIGH= commands we find,
 25918                                  ;       but don't process them now.        
 25919                                          
 25920 00002027 80FC49                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I'	; install= command?
 25921                                  	;jne	short precheck_installhigh ; the first pass is for normal operation.
 25922                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25923 0000202A 752A                    	jne	short tryb	
 25924                                  	
 25925                                  	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; set the flag
 25926 0000202C 800E[4A03]01            	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 25927                                  multi_pass_coff2:
 25928 00002031 EBCD                    	jmp	short coff ; 13/05/2019	; and handles the next command
 25929                                  
 25930                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25931                                  ;precheck_installhigh:
 25932                                  ;       cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH ; 'W' ; signifier for INSTALLHIGH
 25933                                  ;       jne     short tryb		; carry on with normal processing
 25934                                  ;	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd

 25938                                  multi_try_i:
 25939 00002033 80FC49                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I' ; install= command?

 25942 00002036 7505                    	jne	short multi_pass_filter
 25943                                  
 25944                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25945                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG

 25947                                  ;       jc	short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 25948                                  ;;endif
 25949                                  
 25950 00002038 E806F0                  	call	do_install_exec 	;install it.
 25951 0000203B EBC3                    	jmp	short coff		;to handle next install= command.

 25953                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25954                                  %if 0
 25955                                  
 25956                                  multi_try_n:
 25957                                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH   ; installhigh= command?
 25958                                          jne	short multi_pass_filter	; no. ignore this.
 25959                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25960                                          call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 25961                                          jc      short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 25962                                  ;endif
 25963                                  
 25964                                  ;       The memory environment is in its normal DOS state, so do
 25965                                  ;       the standard calls to set the alloc strategy for loading high
 25966                                  
 25967                                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|0 ; 5800h
 25968                                  	int	21h			;get alloc strategy
 25969                                  	mov	bx,ax
 25970                                          push    bx                      ; save for the return
 25971                                  
 25972                                          or	bx,HIGH_FIRST  ; 80h	;set alloc to HighFirst
 25973                                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1 ; 5801h
 25974                                  	int	21h			;set alloc strategy
 25975                                  
 25976                                  	mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|2 ; 5802h
 25977                                          int     21h                     ; get link state
 25978                                          xor     ah,ah                   ; clear top byte
 25979                                          push    ax                      ; save for return
 25980                                  
 25981                                          mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3 ; 5803h
 25982                                  	mov	bx,1
 25983                                  	int	21h			;link in UMBs
 25984                                  
 25985                                  	call	do_install_exec 	;install it.
 25986                                  
 25987                                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3
 25988                                          pop     bx                      ; recover original link state
 25989                                          int     21h
 25990                                          pop     bx                      ; recover original alloc strategy
 25991                                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1
 25992                                          int     21h
 25993                                  
 25994                                  	jmp	coff			;to handle next install= command.
 25995                                  
 25996                                  %endif

 26018                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26019                                  ;									      *
 26020                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 26021                                  ;									      *
 26022                                  ; input :								      *
 26023                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 26024                                  ; output:								      *
 26025                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 26026                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *

 26028                                  ;									      *

 26044                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *

 26047                                  ; };									      *
 26048                                  ;									      *

 27565                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27566                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 27567                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 27568                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 27569                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 27570                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 27571                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 27572                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 27573                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27574                                  
 27575                                  ;**************************************************************************
 27576                                  ;									  *
 27577                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 27578                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 27579                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 27580                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 27581                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 27582                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 27583                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 27584                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 27585                                  ; input :								  *
 27586                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 27587                                  ; output:								  *
 27588                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 27589                                  ;									  *
 27590                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 27591                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 27592                                  ; logic:								  *
 27593                                  ; {									  *
 27594                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 27595                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 27596                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 27597                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 27598                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 27599                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 27600                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 27601                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 27602                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 27603                                  ;	     }								  *
 27604                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 27605                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 27606                                  ;	};								  *
 27607                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 27608                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 27609                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 27610                                  ; };									  *
 27611                                  ;**************************************************************************
 27612

 28280                                  sysinit_parse:
 28281                                  
 28282                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28283                                  ;set up registers for sysparse
 28284                                  ;in)	es:si -> command line in confbot
 28285                                  ;	di -> offset of the parse control definition.
 28286                                  ;
 28287                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 28288                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 28289                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 28290                                  ;	*** after each call.
 28291                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 28292                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 28293                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 28294                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 28295                                  ;	 procedure.
 28296                                  ;	ax - exit code
 28297                                  ;	bl - terminated delimeter code
 28298                                  ;	cx - new positional ordinal
 28299                                  ;	si - set to pase scanned operand
 28300                                  ;	dx - selected result buffer
 28301                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28302                                  
 28303                                  	; 24/10/2022
 28304 000026E4 06                      	push	es			;save es,ds
 28305 000026E5 1E                      	push	ds
 28306                                  
 28307 000026E6 06                      	push	es
 28308 000026E7 1F                      	pop	ds			;now ds:si -> command line
 28309                                  
 28310 000026E8 0E                      	push	cs
 28311 000026E9 07                      	pop	es			;now es:di -> control definition
 28312                                  
 28313 000026EA 2E8C1E[3914]            	mov	[cs:badparm_seg],ds	;save the pointer to the parm
 28314 000026EF 2E8936[3714]            	mov	[cs:badparm_off],si	;we are about to parse for badparm msg.
 28315                                  	;mov	dx,0
 28316                                  	; 04/01/2023
 28317 000026F4 29D2                    	sub	dx,dx ; 0
 28318 000026F6 E8E8ED                  	call	SysParse
 28319 000026F9 83F800                  	cmp	ax,_$P_No_Error	; 0	;no error
 28320                                  
 28321                                  ;**cas note:  when zero true after cmp, carry clear
 28322                                  
 28323                                  	;je	short ll4
 28324                                  	; 24/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS compatibility, SYSINIT:2A02h)
 28325                                  	; 12/12/2022

 28327 000026FE 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,_$P_RC_EOL ; 0FFFFh	;or the end of line?
 28328                                  	;jne	short if4
 28329                                  	; 12/12/2022
 28330 00002701 7401                    	je	short en4 ; cf=0
 28331

 28626                                  ;
 28627                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 28628                                  ;
 28629                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 28630                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 28631                                  ;
 28632                                  ;	Output : none
 28633                                  ;
 28634                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 28635                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 28636                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 28637                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 28638                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 28639                                  ;
 28640                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28641                                  
 28642                                  LieInt12Mem:
 28643                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28644                                  	; ds = cs
 28645 000027A4 A1[A302]                	mov	ax,[ALLOCLIM]

 28647                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 28648 000027A7 E84400                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 28649 000027AA 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 28650                                  	; 13/05/2019
 28651                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 28652                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 28653                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12 as end of UMB
 28654                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28655                                  	; ds = cs
 28656 000027AC 803E[071F]00            	cmp	byte [DeviceHi],0
 28657 000027B1 74F0                    	je	short limx
 28658 000027B3 A1[EE1E]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadEnd]
 28659                                  lim_set:
 28660                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28661                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28662                                  	;call	SetInt12Mem
 28663                                  ;limx:
 28664                                  	;retn
 28665                                  	
 28666                                  	;jmp	short SetInt12Mem 
 28667                                  
 28668                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28669                                  ;
 28670                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 28671                                  ;
 28672                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 28673                                  ;	Output : none
 28674                                  ;
 28675                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 28676                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 28677                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 28678                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 28679                                  ;
 28680                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28681                                  
 28682                                  	; 01/11/2022
 28683                                  SetInt12Mem:
 28684 000027B6 1E                      	push	ds
 28685 000027B7 BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 28686 000027BA 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 28687 000027BC 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 28688 000027C0 2E891E[0B1F]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 28689 000027C5 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 28690 000027C7 D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 28691 000027C9 A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 28692 000027CC 2EC606[0A1F]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 28693 000027D2 1F                      	pop	ds
 28694                                  ;limx:
 28695 000027D3 C3                      	retn
 28696                                  
 28697                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28698                                  ;
 28699                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 28700                                  ;
 28701                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 28702                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 28703                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 28704                                  ;
 28705                                  ;	Output : none
 28706                                  ;

 28708                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 28709                                  ;
 28710                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28711                                  
 28712                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 28713                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28714                                  	; ds = cs
 28715 000027D4 803E[0A1F]00            	cmp	byte [Int12Lied],0
 28716                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; were we lying so far?
 28717                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 28718                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 28719 000027D9 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 28720                                  	; 18/12/2022
 28721 000027DB B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 28722 000027DE 8826[0A1F]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 28723                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 28724                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 28725 000027E2 1E                      	push	ds
 28726                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 28727 000027E3 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 28728 000027E5 2EA1[0B1F]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]
 28729 000027E9 A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; restore INT 12 memory
 28730 000027EC 1F                      	pop	ds
 28731                                  timx:
 28732 000027ED C3                      	retn

 28780                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28781                                  
 28782                                  ; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28783                                  
 28784                                  %if 0
 28785                                  
 28786                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 28787                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 28788                                  
 28789                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 28790                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 28791                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 28792                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28793                                  
 28794                                  ;******************************************************************************
 28795                                  ;
 28796                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 28797                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 28798                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 28799                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 28800                                  ;
 28801                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 28802                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 28803                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 28804                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 28805                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 28806                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 28807                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 28808                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 28809                                  ; available during the load.
 28810                                  ;
 28811                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 28812                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 28813                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 28814                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 28815                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 28816                                  ; allocated.  After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 28817                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 28818                                  ;
 28819                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 28820                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 28821                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 28822                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 28823                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 28824                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 28825                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 28826                                  ;
 28827                                  ;******************************************************************************
 28828                                  
 28829                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 28830                                  
 28831                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 28832                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 28833                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 28834                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 28835                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 28836                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 28837                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 28838                                  
 28839                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 28840                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 28841                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 28842                                  
 28843                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28844                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 28845                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28846                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 28847                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 28848                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 28849                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 28850                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28851                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1.  Its contents
 28852                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 28853                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28854                                  
 28855                                  InitVar:
 28856                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 28857                                  	push	ax
 28858                                  	push	cx
 28859                                  	push	di
 28860                                  	push	es
 28861                                  
 28862                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 28863                                  	push	cs
 28864                                  	pop	es
 28865                                  
 28866                                  	xor	ax,ax
 28867                                  	mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 28868                                  	mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 28869                                  	mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 28870                                  	mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 28871                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 28872                                  	mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 28873                                  
 28874                                  	cld
 28875                                  
 28876                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;For each entry
 28877                                  	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 28878                                  	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 28879                                  
 28880                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;Okay... for each entry
 28881                                  	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 28882                                  	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 28883                                  
 28884                                  	;normseg es			; Return ES
 28885                                  
 28886                                  	;popreg	<es, di, cx, ax>
 28887                                  	pop	es
 28888                                  	pop	di
 28889                                  	pop	cx
 28890                                  	pop	ax	 	
 28891                                  
 28892                                  	retn
 28893                                  
 28894                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28895                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 28896                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28897                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 28898                                  ; EXIT    : None
 28899                                  ; ERROR   : None
 28900                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 28901                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28902                                  
 28903                                  FixMem:
 28904                                  	push	ax
 28905                                  	push	bx
 28906                                  	push	cx
 28907                                  	push	dx
 28908                                  	push	es
 28909                                  
 28910                                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 28911                                  
 28912                                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 28913                                  	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 28914                                  
 28915                                  	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 28916                                  
 28917                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 28918                                  
 28919                                  	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 28920                                  	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 28921                                  	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 28922                                  
 28923                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 28924                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 28925                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 28926                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 28927                                  
 28928                                  fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 28929                                  	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 28930                                  	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 28931                                  	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 28932                                  
 28933                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 28934                                  
 28935                                  fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 28936                                  	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 28937                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 28938                                  
 28939                                  	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 28940                                  	add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 28941                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 28942                                  
 28943                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 28944                                  
 28945                                  fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Put this address on the stack
 28946                                  	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 28947                                  
 28948                                  	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 28949                                  	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 28950                                  	inc	bx
 28951                                  	mov	es,bx
 28952                                  
 28953                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 28954                                  	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 28955                                  	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 28956                                  fmX:	
 28957                                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 28958                                  
 28959                                  	pop	es
 28960                                  	pop	dx
 28961                                  	pop	cx
 28962                                  	pop	bx
 28963                                  	pop	ax
 28964                                  
 28965                                  	retn
 28966                                  
 28967                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28968                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 28969                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28970                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 28971                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 28972                                  ; ERROR:    None
 28973                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 28974                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28975                                  
 28976                                  fm_link:
 28977                                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 28978                                  	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 28979                                  
 28980                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 28981                                  	;
 28982                                  	;push	es
 28983                                  	;push	cs
 28984                                  	;pop	es
 28985                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 28986                                  	;pop	es
 28987                                  	
 28988                                  	mov	[cs:fm_umb],al
 28989                                  
 28990                                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 28991                                  	mov	bx,1
 28992                                  	int	21h
 28993                                  	retn
 28994                                  
 28995                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28996                                  ;*** fm_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 28997                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28998                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 28999                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29000                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29001                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 29002                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29003                                  
 29004                                  fm_unlink:
 29005                                  	xor	bx,bx
 29006                                  	
 29007                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb		; fm_umb already has the old link-state
 29008                                  	;
 29009                                  	;push	ds
 29010                                  	;push	cs
 29011                                  	;pop	ds
 29012                                  	;mov	bl,[fm_umb]	
 29013                                  	;pop	ds
 29014                                  	
 29015                                  	mov	bl,[cs:fm_umb]
 29016                                  
 29017                                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 29018                                  	int	21h			; so just use that, and call int 21h
 29019                                  	retn
 29020                                  
 29021                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29022                                  
 29023                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29024                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 29025                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 29026                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29027                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 29028                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 29029                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 29030                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29031                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29032                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 29033                                  ;
 29034                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 29035                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 29036                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 29037                                  ;
 29038                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 29039                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 29040                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 29041                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 29042                                  ;
 29043                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 29044                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 29045                                  ;
 29046                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29047                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 29048                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 29049                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 29050                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 29051                                  ;     lh
 29052                                  ;     /l
 29053                                  ;     1
 29054                                  ;     1000
 29055                                  ;     2
 29056                                  ;     print
 29057                                  ;     /d
 29058                                  ;     :lpt2
 29059                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 29060                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 29061                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 29062                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 29063                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 29064                                  ; for:
 29065                                  ;    Each /L
 29066                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 29067                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 29068                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 29069                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 29070                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 29071                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29072                                  
 29073                                  ParseVar:
 29074                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 29075                                  	push	di
 29076                                  	push	ds
 29077                                  	push	es
 29078                                  
 29079                                  	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 29080                                  	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 29081                                  	cld
 29082                                  
 29083                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 29084                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 29085                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 29086                                  
 29087                                  pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 29088                                  	call	isWhite
 29089                                  	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 29090                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 29091                                  	cmp	al,SWTCH
 29092                                  	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 29093                                  
 29094                                  	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 29095                                  	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 29096                                  	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 29097                                  
 29098                                  pv20:	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 29099                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 29100                                  	and	al,0DFh
 29101                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 29102                                  	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 29103                                  	jne	short pv30
 29104                                  
 29105                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 29106                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 29107                                  
 29108                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 29109                                  	;
 29110                                  	;push	es
 29111                                  	;push	cs
 29112                                  	;pop	es
 29113                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 29114                                  	;pop	es
 29115                                  
 29116                                  	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 29117                                  
 29118                                  	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 29119                                  
 29120                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 29121                                  	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then 'tis a bad
 29122                                  	jne	short pvE1		; switch!
 29123                                  
 29124                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 29125                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 29126                                  
 29127                                  	call	parseL
 29128                                  	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 29129                                  
 29130                                  	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 29131                                  	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 29132                                  
 29133                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 29134                                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 29135                                  pvErr:	dec	si
 29136                                  	dec	si
 29137                                  	stc
 29138                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 29139                                  	pop	es
 29140                                  	pop	ds
 29141                                  	pop	di
 29142                                  	retn
 29143                                  
 29144                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29145                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 29146                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29147                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 29148                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 29149                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 29150                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 29151                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29152                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 29153                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 29154                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax.  The 3-character rewind
 29155                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 29156                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29157                                  
 29158                                  parseL:
 29159                                  	lodsb
 29160                                  	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 29161                                  	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 29162                                  
 29163                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29164                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 29165                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29166                                  
 29167                                  pl10:	call	GetXNum		; After this, 'tis ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 29168                                  	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 29169                                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 29170                                  
 29171                                  	mov	cl,al		; Remember the UMB number
 29172                                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 29173                                  	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 29174                                  
 29175                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 29176                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29177                                  
 29178                                  	lodsb
 29179                                  	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 29180                                  	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 29181                                  
 29182                                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 29183                                  	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 29184                                  
 29185                                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?
 29186                                  	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 29187                                  
 29188                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 29189                                  	cmp	al,SWTCH 	; Did "umb/" ? (as in, "/L:1,100;2/S")
 29190                                  	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 29191                                  
 29192                                  	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 29193                                  	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 29194                                  
 29195                                  ; --- Read a size -------------------------------------------------------------
 29196                                  
 29197                                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else
 29198                                  	jc	short plE1	; And error if it's a bad size.
 29199                                  
 29200                                  	call	toPara		; Convert from bytes to paragraphs
 29201                                  
 29202                                  	call	stowSiz		; CL still has the UMB number for this routine
 29203                                  
 29204                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB size is another arg for LH to skip
 29205                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29206                                  
 29207                                  	lodsb
 29208                                  	cmp	al,';'		; They did "umb,size;", so get another UMB.
 29209                                  	je	short pl10	;
 29210                                  
 29211                                  	call	isWhite		; Did it end with whitespace?
 29212                                  	jz	short plX	; If so, we're done here--go back.
 29213                                  
 29214                                  	call	isEOL		; Did they do "umb,size" and end??? (stupid)
 29215                                  	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 29216                                  
 29217                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 29218                                  	cmp	al,SWTCH	; Did they do "umb,size/" ?
 29219                                  	je	short plSwX	; If so, again, we're done here.
 29220                                  plE1:	
 29221                                  	;mov	ax,1
 29222                                  	mov	ax,PV_InvArg	; If not, we don't know WHAT they did...
 29223                                  	dec	si
 29224                                  	stc
 29225                                  	retn
 29226                                  
 29227                                  plE2:	;mov	ax,2
 29228                                  	mov	ax,PV_BadUMB	; In this case, they've specified a UMB twice
 29229                                  	; 12/12/2022
 29230                                  	; cf=1
 29231                                  	;stc
 29232                                  	retn
 29233                                  plSwX:	
 29234                                  	dec	si		; If we hit a '/' character, back up one char
 29235                                  				; so the whitespace checker will see it too.
 29236                                  plX:	; 12/12/2022
 29237                                  	; cf=0
 29238                                  	;clc			; Then just return with carry clear, so
 29239                                  	retn			; ParseVar will go about its business.
 29240                                  
 29241                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29242                                  ;*** incArgc - increments fm_argc, for use with LoadHigh command-line parsing
 29243                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29244                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 29245                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29246                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29247                                  ; USES:     fm_argc, flags
 29248                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29249                                  
 29250                                  ;incArgc:
 29251                                  	;push	ax
 29252                                  
 29253                                  	;;getdata al, fm_argc	; Obtain previous value of fm_argc,
 29254                                  
 29255                                  	;mov	al,[cs:fm_argc]
 29256                                  
 29257                                  	;inc	al		; Increment it,
 29258                                  
 29259                                  	;;putdata fm_argc, al	; And store it right back.
 29260                                  
 29261                                  	;mov	[cs:fm_argc],al
 29262                                  
 29263                                  	;pop	ax
 29264                                  	;retn
 29265                                  
 29266                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29267                                  ;*** isEOL - returns with ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 29268                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29269                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 29270                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 29271                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29272                                  ; USES:     ZF
 29273                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29274                                  
 29275                                  isEOL:
 29276                                  	cmp	al,0		; Null-terminator
 29277                                  	je	short ieX
 29278                                  	cmp	al,CR ; 0Dh	; Carriage Return
 29279                                  	je	short ieX
 29280                                  	cmp	al,LF ; 0Ah	; LineFeed
 29281                                  ieX:	
 29282                                  	retn
 29283                                  
 29284                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29285                                  ;*** isWhite - returns with ZF set if AL contains whitespace (or "=")
 29286                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29287                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 29288                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains space, tab, or equals
 29289                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29290                                  ; USES:     ZF
 29291                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29292                                  
 29293                                  isWhite:
 29294                                  	cmp	al,' '		; Space
 29295                                  	je	short iwX
 29296                                  	cmp	al,'='		; Equals (treat as whitespace)
 29297                                  	je	short iwX
 29298                                  	cmp	al,tab ; 9	; Tab
 29299                                  iwX:	
 29300                                  	retn
 29301                                  
 29302                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29303                                  ;*** unMarkUMB - marks a given UMB as unused, even if previously marked used
 29304                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29305                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number
 29306                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29307                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29308                                  ; USES:     Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29309                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29310                                  
 29311                                  unMarkUMB:
 29312                                  	push	ax
 29313                                  	push	bx
 29314                                  	push	di
 29315                                  	push	es
 29316                                  
 29317                                  	push	cs
 29318                                  	pop	es
 29319                                  
 29320                                  	xor	ah,ah
 29321                                  	mov	bx,ax
 29322                                  
 29323                                  	; 19/04/2019
 29324                                  	
 29325                                  	;mov	byte [es:bx+UmbUsed],0
 29326                                  	mov	[es:bx+UmbUsed],ah ; 0
 29327                                  
 29328                                  	cmp	[es:UmbLoad],al
 29329                                  	jne	short umu10
 29330                                  
 29331                                  	;mov	[es:UmbLoad],0	; If unmarked the load UMB, load into convent.
 29332                                  	mov	[es:UmbLoad],ah ; 0
 29333                                  umu10:	
 29334                                  	pop	es
 29335                                  	pop	di
 29336                                  	pop	bx
 29337                                  	pop	ax
 29338                                  	retn
 29339                                  
 29340                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29341                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 29342                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been
 29343                                  ; listed in the /L:... chain. If it's the first one specified, it sets UmbLoad
 29344                                  ; to that UMB #... and in any case, it marks the UMB as specified.
 29345                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29346                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number, as specified by the user
 29347                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29348                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if UMB # is less than 0 or >= MAXUMB (see highvar.inc)
 29349                                  ; USES:     AX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29350                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29351                                  
 29352                                  stowUMB:
 29353                                  	cmp	al,MAXUMB ; 16
 29354                                  	jb	short su10
 29355                                  	stc
 29356                                  	retn			; Ooops-- UMB>=MAXUMB
 29357                                  su10:	
 29358                                  	push	bx
 29359                                  	push	di
 29360                                  	push	si
 29361                                  	push	ds
 29362                                  	push	es
 29363                                  	push	cs
 29364                                  	pop	es
 29365                                  	push	cs
 29366                                  	pop	ds
 29367                                  	
 29368                                  	;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],0FFh
 29369                                  	cmp	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; If this, we haven't been here before
 29370                                  	jne	short su20
 29371                                  	mov	[UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 29372                                  su20:	
 29373                                  	or	al,al		; If they gave UMB 0, there's really nothing
 29374                                  	jz	short su30	; that we should do here.
 29375                                  
 29376                                  	mov	bl,al
 29377                                  	xor	bh,bh
 29378                                  	mov	ax,1		; Now, AX = 1, and BX = UMB Number
 29379                                  
 29380                                  	xchg	[es:bx+UmbUsed],al
 29381                                  
 29382                                  	or	al,al		; If it was already 1, then al==1... and that
 29383                                  	jz	short su30	; means an error.
 29384                                  
 29385                                  	stc			; OOOPS!  This one's been used before.  :(
 29386                                  su30:	
 29387                                  	pop	es
 29388                                  	pop	ds
 29389                                  	pop	si
 29390                                  	pop	di
 29391                                  	pop	bx
 29392                                  	retn
 29393                                  
 29394                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29395                                  ;*** stowSiz - marks a given UMB as having a given minimum size
 29396                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29397                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains UMB number, AX contains size
 29398                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29399                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29400                                  ; USES:     AX, DX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29401                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29402                                  
 29403                                  ; 13/05/2019
 29404                                  
 29405                                  stowSiz:
 29406                                  	push	bx
 29407                                  	;push	di ; ?
 29408                                  	push	es
 29409                                  
 29410                                  	push	cs
 29411                                  	pop	es	
 29412                                  
 29413                                  	mov	bl,cl			; Now bl==UMB number, AX==size
 29414                                  	mov	bh,0			;     bx==UMB number, AX==size
 29415                                  	shl	bl,1			;     bx==offset into array, AX=size
 29416                                  	mov	[es:bx+UmbSize],ax	; Store the size
 29417                                  	
 29418                                  	pop	es
 29419                                  	;pop	di ; ?
 29420                                  	pop	bx
 29421                                  
 29422                                  	retn
 29423                                  
 29424                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29425                                  ;*** toDigit - converts a character-digit to its binary counterpart
 29426                                  ;            -- verifies that CL contains a valid character-digit; if so, it
 29427                                  ; changes CL to its counterpart binary digit ((CL-'0') or (CL-'A'+10)).
 29428                                  ; A-F are considered valid iff gnradix is 16.
 29429                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29430                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains a digit ('0' to '9' or, if gnradix==16, 'A' to 'F')
 29431                                  ; EXIT:     CL contains digit in binary (0 to 9 or, if gnradix==16, 0 to 15)
 29432                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set indicates invalid digit; carry clear indicates good digit
 29433                                  ; USES:     CL, Flags
 29434                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29435                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 29436                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 29437                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 29438                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29439                                  
 29440                                  gnradix:
 29441                                  	dw	0		; Must be a word--16x16 multiplication
 29442                                  
 29443                                  toDigit:
 29444                                  	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 29445                                  	jne	short td20	; Don't check hex digits if radix isn't 16
 29446                                  
 29447                                  toDigit_hex:
 29448                                  	cmp	cl,'a'	; 61h
 29449                                  	jb	short td10
 29450                                  	cmp	cl,'f'	; 66h
 29451                                  	ja	short tdE	; Nothing valid above 'z' at all...
 29452                                  	sub	cl,'a'-10 ; 57h	; Make 'a'==10 and return.
