 32339                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 32340                                  ; SYSINIT2.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 32341                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 32342                                  ; 14/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32343                                  
 32344                                  ; Multiple configuration block support  Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 32345                                  ;
 32346                                  ; Summary:
 32347                                  ;
 32348                                  ;   The procedure "organize" crunches the in-memory copy of config.sys
 32349                                  ;   into lines delimited by CR/LF (sometimes no CR, but *always* an LF)
 32350                                  ;   with the leading "keyword=" replaced by single character codes (eg, B
 32351                                  ;   for BUFFERS, D for DEVICE, Z for any unrecognized keyword); see comtab
 32352                                  ;   and/or config.inc for the full list.
 32353                                  ;
 32354                                  ;   [blockname] and INCLUDE are the major syntactical additions for multi-
 32355                                  ;   configuration support. blockname is either MENU, which contains one
 32356                                  ;   or more MENUITEM lines, an optional MENUDEFAULT (which includes optional
 32357                                  ;   time-out), or any user-defined keyword, such as NETWORK, CD-ROM, etc.
 32358                                  ;   INCLUDE allows the current block to name another block for inclusion
 32359                                  ;   during the processing phase of CONFIG.SYS. An INCLUDE is only honored
 32360                                  ;   once, precluding nasty infinite-loop scenarios. If blocks are present
 32361                                  ;   without a MENU block, then only lines inside COMMON blocks are processed.
 32362                                  ;
 32363                                  ; Example:
 32364                                  ;
 32365                                  ;   [menu]
 32366                                  ;   menuitem=misc,Miscellaneous
 32367                                  ;   menuitem=network,Network Configuration
 32368                                  ;   menudefault=network,15
 32369                                  ;
 32370                                  ;   [network]
 32371                                  ;   include misc
 32372                                  ;   device=foo
 32373                                  ;
 32374                                  ;   [misc]
 32375                                  ;   device=bar
 32376                                  ;   include alternate
 32377                                  ;
 32378                                  ;   [alternate]
 32379                                  ;   device=tar
 32380                                  ;
 32381                                  ;
 32382                                  ;   When the menu is displayed
 32383                                  ;
 32384                                  ;    1. Miscellaneous
 32385                                  ;    2. Network Configuration
 32386                                  ;
 32387                                  ;   #2 is highlighted as the default option, and will be automatically
 32388                                  ;   selected after 15 seconds. It will invoke the following lines in the
 32389                                  ;   following order:
 32390                                  ;
 32391                                  ;       DEVICE=BAR
 32392                                  ;       DEVICE=TAR
 32393                                  ;       DEVICE=FOO
 32394                                  ;
 32395                                  
 32396                                  ;MULTI_CONFIG equ 1
 32397                                  
 32398                                  ; the following depend on the positions of the various letters in switchlist
 32399                                  
 32400                                  switchnum	equ 11111000b ; 0F8h	; which switches require number
 32401                                  
 32402                                  flagec35	equ 00000100b ; 4	; electrically compatible 3.5 inch disk drive
 32403                                  flagdrive	equ 00001000b ; 8 
 32404                                  flagcyln	equ 00010000b ; 16
 32405                                  flagseclim	equ 00100000b ; 32
 32406                                  flagheads	equ 01000000b ; 64
 32407                                  flagff		equ 10000000b ; 128
 32408                                  
 32409                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32410                                  ; 19/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32411                                  
 32412                                  ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:3E78h
 32413                                  
 32414                                  ; 01/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 32415                                  ; MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:3054h
 32416                                  
 32417 00002CCB 00                      insert_blank:	db 	0
 32418

 32421                                  ; procedure : setparms
 32422                                  ;
 32423                                  ; the following set of routines is used to parse the drivparm = command in
 32424                                  ; the config.sys file to change the default drive parameters.
 32425                                  ;
 32426                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32427                                  
 32428                                  setparms:
 32429 00002CCC 1E                      	push	ds
 32430 00002CCD 50                      	push	ax
 32431 00002CCE 53                      	push	bx
 32432 00002CCF 51                      	push	cx
 32433 00002CD0 52                      	push	dx
 32434                                  
 32435 00002CD1 0E                      	push	cs
 32436 00002CD2 1F                      	pop	ds
 32437                                  
 32438 00002CD3 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 32439 00002CD5 8A1E[0E37]              	mov	bl,[drive]
 32440                                  	; 18/12/2022
 32441 00002CD9 43                      	inc	bx
 32442                                  	;inc	bl			; get it correct for ioctl call
 32443                                  					; (1=a,2=b...)
 32444 00002CDA BA[E635]                	mov	dx,deviceparameters
 32445 00002CDD B444                    	mov	ah,IOCTL ; 44h
 32446 00002CDF B00D                    	mov	al,GENERIC_IOCTL ; 0Dh
 32447 00002CE1 B508                    	mov	ch,RAWIO ; 8
 32448 00002CE3 B140                    	mov	cl,SET_DEVICE_PARAMETERS ; 40h
 32449 00002CE5 CD21                    	int	21h
 32450                                  
 32451                                  ; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 32452                                  ;
 32453                                  ;	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data		; get Bios_Data segment
 32454                                  ;	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 32455                                  ;	; 21/10/2022
 32456                                  ;	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h	
 32457                                  ;	mov	ds,ax			; set Bios_Data segment
 32458                                  ;
 32459                                  ;	test	word [cs:switches],flagec35 ; 4
 32460                                  ;	jz	short not_ec35
 32461                                  
 32462                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 32463                                  	;test	word [switches],flagec35 ; 4
 32464                                  	; 12/12/2022
 32465 00002CE7 F606[0F37]04            	test	byte [switches],flagec35 ; 4
 32466 00002CEC 7411                    	jz	short eot_ok
 32467                                  
 32468                                  	;mov	cl,[cs:drive]		; which drive was this for?
 32469                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 32470 00002CEE 8A0E[0E37]              	mov	cl,[drive]
 32471 00002CF2 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h	
 32472 00002CF5 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax	
 32473                                  
 32474 00002CF7 B001                    	mov	al,1			; assume drive 0
 32475 00002CF9 D2E0                    	shl	al,cl			; set proper bit depending on drive
 32476                                  	;or	[531h],al ; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS Offset SYINIT:3EACh)
 32477 00002CFB 0806[3105]              	or	[ec35_flag],al		; set the bit in the permanent flags
 32478                                  
 32479                                  ; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 32480                                  ;
 32481                                  ;not_ec35:
 32482                                  ;;	Now adjust the BIOS's EOT variable if our new drive has more
 32483                                  ;;	sectors per track than any old ones.
 32484                                  ;
 32485                                  ;	;mov	al,[cs:deviceparameters+20]
 32486                                  ;	mov	al,[cs:deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK]

 32489                                  ;	jbe	short eot_ok
 32490                                  ;	mov	[EOT],al
 32491                                  
 32492                                  eot_ok:
 32493 00002CFF 5A                      	pop	dx			; fix up all the registers
 32494 00002D00 59                      	pop	cx
 32495 00002D01 5B                      	pop	bx
 32496 00002D02 58                      	pop	ax
 32497 00002D03 1F                      	pop	ds ; 13/05/2019

 32507                                  
 32508                                  diddleback:
 32509 00002D05 1E                      	push	ds
 32510 00002D06 0E                      	push	cs
 32511 00002D07 1F                      	pop	ds
 32512                                  	;mov	word [deviceparameters+4],80
 32513 00002D08 C706[EA35]5000          	mov	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS],80
 32514                                  	;mov	byte [deviceparameters+1],2
 32515 00002D0E C606[E735]02            	mov	byte [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICETYPE],DEV_3INCH720KB ; 2
 32516                                  	;mov	word [deviceparameters+2],0
 32517 00002D13 C706[E835]0000          	mov	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICEATTRIBUTES],0
 32518 00002D19 C706[0F37]0000          	mov	word [switches],0	    ; zero all switches

 32523                                  %if 0
 32524                                  
 32525                                  ; 15/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32526                                  
 32527                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32528                                  ;
 32529                                  ; procedure : parseline
 32530                                  ;
 32531                                  ; entry point is parseline. al contains the first character in command line.
 32532                                  ;
 32533                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32534                                  
 32535                                  	; 01/11/2022 - Retrodos v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 32536                                  	; (SYSINIT:30ACh)
 32537                                  
 32538                                  parseline:
 32539                                  	push	ds
 32540                                  
 32541                                  	push	cs
 32542                                  	pop	ds
 32543                                  
 32544                                  nextswtch:
 32545                                  	cmp	al,cr			; carriage return?
 32546                                  	je	short done_line
 32547                                  	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 32548                                  	je	short put_back		; put it back and done
 32549                                  
 32550                                  ; anything less or equal to a space is ignored.
 32551                                  
 32552                                  	cmp	al,' '                  ; space?
 32553                                  	jbe	short getnext		; skip over space
 32554                                  	cmp	al,'/'
 32555                                  	je	short getparm
 32556                                  	stc				; mark error invalid-character-in-input
 32557                                  	jmp	short exitpl
 32558                                  
 32559                                  getparm:
 32560                                  	call	check_switch
 32561                                  	mov	[switches],bx		; save switches read so far
 32562                                  	jc	short swterr
 32563                                  getnext:
 32564                                  	call	getchr
 32565                                  	jc	short done_line
 32566                                  	jmp	short nextswtch
 32567                                  swterr:
 32568                                  	jmp	short exitpl		; exit if error
 32569                                  
 32570                                  done_line:
 32571                                  	; 12/12/2022
 32572                                  	test	byte [switches],flagdrive ; 8
 32573                                  	;test	word [switches],flagdrive ; 8 ; see if drive specified
 32574                                  	jnz	short okay
 32575                                  	stc				; mark error no-drive-specified
 32576                                  	jmp	short exitpl
 32577                                  
 32578                                  okay:
 32579                                  	mov	ax,[switches]
 32580                                  	and	ax,0003h	    ; get flag bits for changeline and non-rem
 32581                                  	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICEATTRIBUTES],ax
 32582                                  	mov	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_TRACKTABLEENTRIES],0
 32583                                  	;clc			    ; everything is fine
 32584                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 32585                                  	; 12/12/2022
 32586                                  	; cf=0
 32587                                  	;clc
 32588                                  	call	setdeviceparameters
 32589                                  exitpl:
 32590                                  	pop	ds
 32591                                  	retn
 32592                                  put_back:
 32593                                  	inc	word [count]		; one more char to scan
 32594                                  	dec	word [chrptr]		; back up over linefeed
 32595                                  	jmp	short done_line
 32596                                  
 32597                                  %endif
 32598                                  
 32599                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32600                                  ;
 32601                                  ; procedure : check_switch
 32602                                  ;
 32603                                  ; processes a switch in the input. it ensures that the switch is valid, and
 32604                                  ; gets the number, if any required, following the switch. the switch and the
 32605                                  ; number *must* be separated by a colon. carry is set if there is any kind of
 32606                                  ; error.
 32607                                  ;
 32608                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32609                                  
 32610                                  check_switch:
 32611 00002D21 E817FA                  	call	getchr
 32612                                  	;jc	short err_check
 32613 00002D24 724E                    	jc	short err_chk
 32614 00002D26 24DF                            and     al,0DFh                 ; convert it to upper case
 32615 00002D28 3C41                    	cmp	al,'A'
 32616                                  	;jb	short err_check
 32617 00002D2A 7248                    	jb	short err_chk ; 15/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32618 00002D2C 3C5A                    	cmp	al,'Z'
 32619 00002D2E 7743                    	ja	short err_check
 32620                                  
 32621 00002D30 06                      	push	es
 32622                                  
 32623 00002D31 0E                      	push	cs
 32624 00002D32 07                      	pop	es
 32625                                  
 32626 00002D33 8A0E[A237]              	mov	cl,[switchlist]		; get number of valid switches
 32627 00002D37 B500                    	mov	ch,0
 32628 00002D39 BF[A337]                	mov	di,1+switchlist		; point to string of valid switches
 32629 00002D3C F2AE                    	repne	scasb
 32630                                  
 32631 00002D3E 07                      	pop	es
 32632 00002D3F 7532                    	jnz	short err_check
 32633                                  
 32634 00002D41 B80100                  	mov	ax,1
 32635 00002D44 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl			; set bit to indicate switch
 32636 00002D46 8B1E[0F37]              	mov	bx,[switches]		; get switches so far
 32637 00002D4A 09C3                    	or	bx,ax			; save this with other switches
 32638 00002D4C 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 32639                                  	; 12/12/2022
 32640 00002D4E A8F8                    	test	al,switchnum ; 0F8h

 32649

 32654                                  	; 12/12/2022

 32662

 32664                                  ; not check for carry set here. if there is an error, it will be detected
 32665                                  ; further on (hopefully).

 32667 00002D6D E80500                  	call	process_num

 32672                                  	; 12/12/2022
 32673                                  	; cf=0
 32674                                  	;clc
 32675 00002D70 C3                      	retn

 32685                                  ;
 32686                                  ; procedure : process_num
 32687                                  ;
 32688                                  ; this routine takes the switch just input, and the number following (if any),
 32689                                  ; and sets the value in the appropriate variable. if the number input is zero
 32690                                  ; then it does nothing - it assumes the default value that is present in the
 32691                                  ; variable at the beginning. zero is ok for form factor and drive, however.
 32692                                  ;
 32693                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32694                                  
 32695                                  	; 02/11/2022 - Retrodos v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 32696                                  	; (SYSINIT:3156h)
 32697                                  process_num:
 32698 00002D75 850E[0F37]              	test	[switches],cx		; if this switch has been done before,
 32699 00002D79 752B                    	jnz	short done_ret		; ignore this one.
 32700                                  	; 12/12/2022
 32701 00002D7B F6C108                  	test	cl,flagdrive ; 8
 32702                                  	;test	cx,flagdrive ; 8
 32703 00002D7E 7404                    	jz	short try_f
 32704 00002D80 A2[0E37]                	mov	byte [drive],al
 32705                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 32706                                  	;jmp	short done_ret
 32707                                  	; 12/12/2022
 32708                                  	; cf=0
 32709 00002D83 C3                      	retn	; 13/05/2019
 32710                                  try_f:
 32711                                  	; 12/12/2022
 32712 00002D84 F6C180                  	test	cl,flagff ; 80h
 32713                                  	;test	cx,flagff ; 80h
 32714 00002D87 7404                    	jz	short try_t
 32715                                  
 32716                                  ; ensure that we do not get bogus form factors that are not supported
 32717                                  
 32718                                  	;mov	[deviceparameters+1],al
 32719 00002D89 A2[E735]                	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICETYPE],al
 32720                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 32721                                  	;jmp	short done_ret
 32722                                  	; 12/12/2022
 32723                                  	; cf=0
 32724 00002D8C C3                      	retn	; 13/05/2019
 32725                                  try_t:
 32726 00002D8D 09C0                    	or	ax,ax
 32727 00002D8F 7415                    	jz	short done_ret		; if number entered was 0, assume default value
 32728                                  	; 12/12/2022
 32729 00002D91 F6C110                  	test	cl,flagcyln ; 10h
 32730                                  	;test	cx,flagcyln ; 10h
 32731 00002D94 7404                    	jz	short try_s
 32732                                  
 32733                                  	;mov	[deviceparameters+4],ax
 32734 00002D96 A3[EA35]                	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS],ax
 32735                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 32736                                  	;jmp	short done_ret
 32737                                  	; 12/12/2022
 32738                                  	; cf=0
 32739 00002D99 C3                      	retn	; 13/05/2019
 32740                                  try_s:
 32741                                  	; 12/12/2022
 32742 00002D9A F6C120                  	test	cl,flagseclim ; 20h
 32743                                  	;test	cx,flagseclim ; 20h
 32744 00002D9D 7404                    	jz	short try_h
 32745 00002D9F A3[0C37]                	mov	[slim],ax
 32746                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 32747                                  	;jmp	short done_ret
 32748                                  	; 12/12/2022
 32749                                  	; cf=0
 32750 00002DA2 C3                      	retn	; 13/05/2019
 32751                                  
 32752                                  ; must be for number of heads
 32753                                  
 32754                                  try_h:
 32755 00002DA3 A3[0A37]                	mov	[hlim],ax
 32756                                  done_ret:
 32757                                  	;clc
 32758                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 32759                                  	; 12/12/2022
 32760                                  	; cf=0 (test instruction resets cf)
 32761                                  	;clc
 32762 00002DA6 C3                      	retn

 32764                                  ; 04/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 32765                                  %if 1

 32770                                  ;
 32771                                  ; procedure : parseline
 32772                                  ;
 32773                                  ; entry point is parseline. al contains the first character in command line.
 32774                                  ;
 32775                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32776                                  
 32777                                  	; 01/11/2022 - Retrodos v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 32778                                  	; (SYSINIT:30ACh)
 32779                                  parseline:
 32780                                  	; 04/01/2023
 32781                                  	; ds = cs ; *
 32782                                  
 32783                                  	;push	ds ; *
 32784                                  
 32785                                  	;push	cs ; *
 32786                                  	;pop	ds ; *
 32787                                  
 32788                                  nextswtch:
 32789 00002DA7 3C0D                    	cmp	al,cr			; carriage return?
 32790 00002DA9 741C                    	je	short done_line
 32791 00002DAB 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 32792 00002DAD 7421                    	je	short put_back		; put it back and done
 32793                                  
 32794                                  ; anything less or equal to a space is ignored.
 32795                                  
 32796 00002DAF 3C20                    	cmp	al,' '                  ; space?
 32797 00002DB1 760F                    	jbe	short getnext		; skip over space
 32798 00002DB3 3C2F                    	cmp	al,'/'
 32799 00002DB5 7402                    	je	short getparm
 32800 00002DB7 F9                      	stc				; mark error invalid-character-in-input
 32801                                  	;jmp	short exitpl
 32802                                  	; 04/01/2023
 32803                                  swterr:
 32804 00002DB8 C3                      	retn
 32805                                  
 32806                                  getparm:
 32807 00002DB9 E865FF                  	call	check_switch
 32808 00002DBC 891E[0F37]              	mov	[switches],bx		; save switches read so far
 32809 00002DC0 72F6                    	jc	short swterr
 32810                                  getnext:
 32811 00002DC2 E876F9                  	call	getchr
 32812                                  	;jc	short done_line
 32813                                  	;jmp	short nextswtch
 32814                                  	; 04/01/2023
 32815 00002DC5 73E0                    	jnc	short nextswtch
 32816                                  ;swterr:
 32817                                  	;jmp	short exitpl		; exit if error
 32818                                  
 32819                                  done_line:
 32820                                  	; 12/12/2022
 32821 00002DC7 F606[0F37]08            	test	byte [switches],flagdrive ; 8
 32822                                  	;test	word [switches],flagdrive ; 8 ; see if drive specified
 32823 00002DCC 750C                    	jnz	short okay
 32824 00002DCE F9                      	stc				; mark error no-drive-specified
 32825                                  	;jmp	short exitpl
 32826                                  	; 04/01/2023
 32827 00002DCF C3                      	retn
 32828                                  
 32829                                  ;exitpl:
 32830                                  	; 04/01/2023
 32831                                  	; ds = cs
 32832                                  	;;pop	ds ; *
 32833                                  	;retn
 32834                                  
 32835                                  put_back:
 32836 00002DD0 FF06[D203]              	inc	word [count]		; one more char to scan
 32837 00002DD4 FF0E[D603]              	dec	word [chrptr]		; back up over linefeed
 32838 00002DD8 EBED                    	jmp	short done_line
 32839                                  
 32840                                  okay:

 32842 00002DDD 83E003                  	and	ax,0003h	    ; get flag bits for changeline and non-rem
 32843 00002DE0 A3[E835]                	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICEATTRIBUTES],ax
 32844 00002DE3 C706[0C36]0000          	mov	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_TRACKTABLEENTRIES],0
 32845                                  	;clc			    ; everything is fine
 32846                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 32847                                  	; 12/12/2022
 32848                                  	; cf=0
 32849                                  	;clc
 32850                                  	;call	setdeviceparameters
 32851                                  	; 04/01/2023
 32852                                  	;jmp	short setdeviceparameters

 32858                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32859                                  ;
 32860                                  ; procedure : setdeviceparameters
 32861                                  ;
 32862                                  ; setdeviceparameters sets up the recommended bpb in each bds in the
 32863                                  ; system based on the form factor. it is assumed that the bpbs for the
 32864                                  ; various form factors are present in the bpbtable. for hard files,
 32865                                  ; the recommended bpb is the same as the bpb on the drive.
 32866                                  ; no attempt is made to preserve registers since we are going to jump to
 32867                                  ; sysinit straight after this routine.
 32868                                  ;
 32869                                  ;	if we return carry, the DRIVPARM will be aborted, but presently
 32870                                  ;	  we always return no carry
 32871                                  ;
 32872                                  ;	note:  there is a routine by the same name in msdioctl.asm
 32873                                  ;
 32874                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32875                                  
 32876                                  ; 15/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32877                                  
 32878                                  	; 02/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 32879                                  setdeviceparameters:
 32880                                  	; 04/01/2023
 32881                                  	; ds = cs
 32882                                  	
 32883 00002DE9 06                      	push	es
 32884                                  
 32885 00002DEA 0E                      	push	cs
 32886 00002DEB 07                      	pop	es
 32887                                  
 32888 00002DEC 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 32889 00002DEE 8A1E[E735]              	mov	bl,[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICETYPE]
 32890 00002DF2 80FB00                  	cmp	bl,DEV_5INCH ; 0
 32891 00002DF5 7506                    	jne	short got_80
 32892                                  
 32893 00002DF7 C706[EA35]2800          	mov	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS],40
 32894                                  							; 48 tpi=40 cyl
 32895                                  got_80:
 32896 00002DFD D1E3                    	shl	bx,1			; get index into bpb table
 32897 00002DFF 8BB7[8E37]              	mov	si,[bpbtable+bx]	; get address of bpb
 32898                                  
 32899                                  	;mov	di,deviceparameters+7	
 32900                                  	; 02/11/2022
 32901 00002E03 BF[ED35]                	mov	di,deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB ; es:di -> bpb
 32902 00002E06 B91F00                  	mov	cx,A_BPB.size ; 31
 32903 00002E09 FC                      	cld
 32904                                  	;repe	movsb
 32905                                  	; 02/11/2022
 32906 00002E0A F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 32907                                  
 32908 00002E0C 07                      	pop	es
 32909                                  
 32910                                  	; 12/12/2022
 32911 00002E0D F606[0F37]20            	test	byte [switches],flagseclim ; 20h
 32912                                  	;test	word [switches],flagseclim ; 20h
 32913 00002E12 7406                    	jz	short see_heads
 32914                                  
 32915 00002E14 A1[0C37]                	mov	ax,[slim]
 32916                                  	;mov	[deviceparameters+20],ax
 32917 00002E17 A3[FA35]                	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK],ax
 32918                                  
 32919                                  see_heads:
 32920                                  	; 12/12/2022
 32921 00002E1A F606[0F37]40            	test	byte [switches],flagheads ; 40h
 32922                                  	;test	word [switches],flagheads ; 40h
 32923 00002E1F 7406                    	jz	short heads_not_altered
 32924                                  
 32925 00002E21 A1[0A37]                	mov	ax,[hlim]
 32926                                  	;mov	[deviceparameters+22],ax	
 32927 00002E24 A3[FC35]                	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_HEADS],ax
 32928                                  
 32929                                  heads_not_altered:
 32930                                  
 32931                                  ; set up correct media descriptor byte and sectors/cluster
 32932                                  ;   sectors/cluster is always 2 except for any one sided disk or 1.44M
 32933                                  
 32934                                  	;mov	byte [deviceparameters+9],2
 32935                                  	; 02/11/2022
 32936                                  	;mov	byte [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER],2
 32937                                  	; 04/01/2023
 32938 00002E27 B80200                  	mov	ax,2	
 32939 00002E2A A2[EF35]                	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER],al ; 2
 32940                                  
 32941 00002E2D B3F0                    	mov	bl,0F0h			; get default mediabyte
 32942                                  
 32943                                  ;	preload the mediadescriptor from the bpb into bh for convenient access
 32944                                  
 32945                                  	;mov	bh,[deviceparameters+17]
 32946                                  	; 02/11/2022
 32947 00002E2F 8A3E[F735]              	mov	bh,[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 32948                                  
 32949                                  	; 04/01/2023
 32950                                  	; ax = 2
 32951 00002E33 3906[FC35]              	cmp	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_HEADS],ax ; >2 heads?
 32952                                  	;cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_HEADS],2 ; >2 heads?
 32953 00002E37 773C                    	ja	short got_correct_mediad ; just use default if heads>2
 32954                                  
 32955 00002E39 7524                    	jne	short only_one_head	; one head, do one head stuff
 32956                                  
 32957                                  ;	two head drives will use the mediadescriptor from the bpb
 32958                                  
 32959 00002E3B 88FB                    	mov	bl,bh			; get mediadescriptor from bpb
 32960                                  
 32961                                  ;	two sided drives have two special cases to look for. One is
 32962                                  ;	   a 320K diskette (40 tracks, 8 secs per track). It uses
 32963                                  ;	   a mediaid of 0fch. The other is 1.44M, which uses only
 32964                                  ;	   one sector/cluster.
 32965                                  
 32966                                  ;	any drive with 18secs/trk, 2 heads, 80 tracks, will be assumed
 32967                                  ;	   to be a 1.44M and use only 1 sector per cluster. Any other
 32968                                  ;	   type of 2 headed drive is all set.
 32969                                  
 32970 00002E3D 833E[FA35]12            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK],18
 32971 00002E42 7509                    	jne	short not_144m
 32972 00002E44 833E[EA35]50            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS],80
 32973 00002E49 7502                    	jne	short not_144m
 32974                                  
 32975                                  ;	We've got cyl=80, heads=2, secpertrack=18. Set cluster size to 1.
 32976                                  
 32977 00002E4B EB24                    	jmp	short got_one_secperclus_drive
 32978                                  
 32979                                  ;	check for 320K
 32980                                  
 32981                                  not_144m:
 32982 00002E4D 833E[EA35]28            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS],40
 32983 00002E52 7521                    	jne	short got_correct_mediad
 32984 00002E54 833E[FA35]08            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK],8
 32985 00002E59 751A                    	jne	short got_correct_mediad
 32986                                  
 32987 00002E5B B3FC                    	mov	bl,0FCh
 32988 00002E5D EB16                    	jmp	short got_correct_mediad
 32989                                  
 32990                                  only_one_head:
 32991                                  
 32992                                  ;	if we don't have a 360K drive, then just go use 0f0h as media descr.
 32993                                  
 32994 00002E5F 803E[E735]00            	cmp	byte [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICETYPE],DEV_5INCH ; 0
 32995 00002E64 740B                    	je	short got_one_secperclus_drive
 32996                                  
 32997                                  ;	single sided 360K drive uses either 0fch or 0feh, depending on
 32998                                  ;	  whether sectorspertrack is 8 or 9. For our purposes, anything
 32999                                  ;	  besides 8 will be considered 0fch
 33000                                  
 33001 00002E66 B3FC                    	mov	bl,0FCh			; single sided 9 sector media id
 33002 00002E68 833E[FA35]08            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK],8
 33003                                  	; 12/12/2022
 33004 00002E6D 7502                    	jne	short got_one_secperclus_drive ; okay if anything besides 8
 33005                                  
 33006 00002E6F B3FE                    	mov	bl,0FEh			; 160K mediaid
 33007                                  
 33008                                  ;	we've either got a one sided drive, or a 1.44M drive
 33009                                  ;	  either case we'll use 1 sector per cluster instead of 2
 33010                                  
 33011                                  got_one_secperclus_drive:
 33012                                  	; 04/01/2023
 33013                                  	; ax = 2
 33014 00002E71 48                      	dec	ax  ; ax = 1
 33015 00002E72 A2[EF35]                	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER],al ; 1
 33016                                  	;mov	byte [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER],1
 33017                                  
 33018                                  got_correct_mediad:
 33019 00002E75 881E[F735]              	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR],bl
 33020                                  
 33021                                  ;	 Calculate the correct number of Total Sectors on medium
 33022                                  
 33023 00002E79 A1[EA35]                	mov	ax,[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS]
 33024 00002E7C F726[FC35]              	mul	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_HEADS]
 33025 00002E80 F726[FA35]              	mul	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK]
 33026 00002E84 A3[F535]                	mov	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS],ax
 33027 00002E87 F8                      	clc				; we currently return no errors
 33028                                  
 33029 00002E88 C3                      	retn
 33030                                  
 33031                                  ;	M047 -- end rewritten routine

 33033                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33034                                  ;
 33035                                  ; procedure : organize
 33036                                  ;

 33050                                  ;

 33052                                  ;;   because we the case of values in SET commands preserved

 33054                                  ;	call	mapcase

 33061 00002E96 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax

 33064                                  	; 12/12/2022

 33069                                  org1:
 33070 00002E9B E8B101                  	call	skip_comment
 33071 00002E9E 740D                    	jz	short end_commd_line	; found a comment string and skipped.
 33072 00002EA0 E89601                  	call	get2			; not a comment string. then get a char.
 33073 00002EA3 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf ; 0Ah

 33075 00002EA7 3C20                    	cmp	al,' ' ; 20h

 33081                                  	;mov	byte [cs:com_level],0	; reset the command level.

 33085 00002EB3 EBE6                    	jmp	short org1
 33086

 33088 00002EB5 F9                      	stc

 33502                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33503                                  ;
 33504                                  ; procedure : skip_comment
 33505                                  ;
 33506                                  ;skip the commented string until lf, if current es:si-> a comment string.
 33507                                  ;in) es:si-> string
 33508                                  ;	 cx -> length.
 33509                                  ;out) zero flag not set if not found a comment string.
 33510                                  ;	  zero flag set if found a comment string and skipped it. al will contain
 33511                                  ;	  the line feed character at this moment when return.
 33512                                  ;	  ax register destroyed.
 33513                                  ;	  if found, si, cx register adjusted accordingly.
 33514                                  ;
 33515                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33516                                  
 33517                                  	; 04/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0
 33518                                  
 33519                                  skip_comment:
 33520 0000304F E3EE                    	jcxz	noget		; get out of the organize routine.
 33521                                  
 33522                                  	; 04/01/2023
 33523                                  	; ds = cs	
 33524                                  
 33525 00003051 803E[CC03]00            	cmp	byte [com_level],0
 33526                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:com_level],0 ; only check it if parameter level is 0.
 33527 00003056 752C                    	jne	short no_commt	 ; (not inside quotations)
 33528                                  
 33529 00003058 803E[CD03]01            	cmp	byte [cmmt],1
 33530                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:cmmt],1
 33531 0000305D 7225                    	jb	short no_commt
 33532                                  
 33533 0000305F 268A04                  	mov	al,[es:si]
 33534                                  	
 33535 00003062 3806[CE03]              	cmp	[cmmt1],al
 33536                                  	;cmp	[cs:cmmt1],al
 33537 00003066 751C                    	jne	short no_commt
 33538                                  
 33539 00003068 803E[CD03]02            	cmp	byte [cmmt],2
 33540                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:cmmt],2
 33541 0000306D 750A                    	jne	short skip_cmmt
 33542                                  
 33543 0000306F 268A4401                	mov	al,[es:si+1]
 33544                                  	
 33545 00003073 3806[CF03]              	cmp	[cmmt2],al
 33546                                  	;cmp	[cs:cmmt2],al
 33547 00003077 750B                    	jne	short no_commt
 33548                                  skip_cmmt:
 33549 00003079 E3C4                    	jcxz	noget		; get out of organize routine.
 33550 0000307B 268A04                  	mov	al,[es:si]
 33551 0000307E 46                      	inc	si
 33552 0000307F 49                      	dec	cx
 33553 00003080 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf		; line feed?
 33554 00003082 75F5                    	jne	short skip_cmmt
 33555                                  no_commt:
 33556 00003084 C3                      	retn
 33557                                  
 33558                                  ; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 33559                                  %if 0
 33560                                  
 33561                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 33562                                  
 33563                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33564                                  ;
 33565                                  ;   kbd_read: wait for keystroke
 33566                                  ;
 33567                                  ;   INPUT
 33568                                  ;       DS == CS == sysinitseg
 33569                                  ;
 33570                                  ;   OUTPUT
 33571                                  ;       Carry SET to clean boot, CLEAR otherwise
 33572                                  ;
 33573                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 33574                                  ;       All
 33575                                  ;
 33576                                  ;   HISTORY
 33577                                  ;       Created 16-Nov-1992 by JeffPar
 33578                                  ;
 33579                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33580                                  
 33581                                  kbd_read:
 33582                                          test    byte [bDisableUI],2
 33583                                          jnz     short kbd_nodelay
 33584                                  
 33585                                          push    ds              ; the bios timer tick count is incremented
 33586                                          sub     ax,ax           ; 18.2 times per second;
 33587                                          mov     ds,ax           ; watch the timer tick count for 37 transitions
 33588                                  	;mov	dx,[046Ch]	; get initial value
 33589                                  kbd_loop:
 33590                                          mov     ah,1            ;
 33591                                          int     16h             ; peek the keyboard
 33592                                          jnz	short kbd_loopdone ; something's there, get out
 33593                                          mov     ah,2            ; peek the shift states
 33594                                          int     16h             ;
 33595                                          test    al,03h          ; either right or left shift key bits set?
 33596                                          jnz	short kbd_loopdone ; yes
 33597                                          mov     ax,[046Ch]	;
 33598                                  	;sub	ax,dx           ; get difference
 33599                                  	; 15/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 33600                                  	sub	ax,[cs:_timer_lw_] ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:42E5h        
 33601                                  
 33602                                  	cmp     al,37           ; reached limit?
 33603                                          jb	short kbd_loop	; not yet
 33604                                  kbd_loopdone:
 33605                                          pop     ds              ; delay complete!
 33606                                  kbd_nodelay:
 33607                                          sub     bx,bx           ; assume clean boot
 33608                                          mov     ah,2            ; peek the shift states
 33609                                          int     16h             ;
 33610                                          test    al,03h          ; either right or left shift key bits set?
 33611                                          jz      short kbd_notshift ; no
 33612                                          inc     bx              ; yes
 33613                                          inc     bx
 33614                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:4301h
 33615                                  	or	byte [bQueryOpt],4
 33616                                  kbd_notshift:                   ;
 33617                                          mov     ah,1            ; peek the keyboard
 33618                                          int     16h             ;
 33619                                          jz	short kbd_test	; no key present
 33620                                          or      al,al           ; is it a function key?
 33621                                          jnz	short kbd_test	; no
 33622                                  
 33623                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:430Bh
 33624                                          cmp     ah,62h          ; CTRL F5
 33625                                          je	short kbd_cfg_bypass
 33626                                  	
 33627                                          cmp     ah,3Fh          ; F5 function key?
 33628                                          jne	short kbd_notf5	; no
 33629                                  kbd_cfg_bypass:
 33630                                          mov     dx,_$CleanMsg
 33631                                          call    print
 33632                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:431Bh
 33633                                  	or	byte [bQueryOpt],4           ;
 33634                                          jmp     short kbd_eat   ; yes, clean boot selected
 33635                                  kbd_notf5:
 33636                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:4322h
 33637                                          cmp     ah,65h          ; CTRL F8
 33638                                          je	short kbd_cfg_confirm
 33639                                  
 33640                                          cmp     ah,42h          ; F8 function key?
 33641                                          jne	short kbd_exit	; no
 33642                                  kbd_cfg_confirm:
 33643                                          mov     dx,_$InterMsg
 33644                                          call    print           ;
 33645                                          mov     bl,1            ; yes, interactive-boot option enabled
 33646                                          mov     [bQueryOpt],bl  ; change default setting
 33647                                  kbd_eat:                        ;
 33648                                          mov     ah,0            ;
 33649                                          int     16h             ; eat the key we assumed was a signal
 33650                                          mov	byte [secElapsed],-1
 33651                                          or      bx,bx           ;
 33652                                          jz	short kbd_clean	;
 33653                                  kbd_test:                       ;
 33654                                          cmp     bl,2            ;
 33655                                          jb	short kbd_exit	;
 33656                                  kbd_clean:                      ;
 33657                                          call    disable_autoexec; yes, tell COMMAND to skip autoexec.bat
 33658                                          stc                     ; set carry to indicate abort
 33659                                          retn			;
 33660                                  kbd_exit:                       ;
 33661                                          clc                     ; clear carry to indicate success
 33662                                          retn			;
 33663                                  
 33664                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33665                                  ;
 33666                                  ;   set_numlock: set numlock LED
 33667                                  ;
 33668                                  ;   INPUT
 33669                                  ;       ES:SI -> numlock setting (ie, "ON" or "OFF")
 33670                                  ;
 33671                                  ;   OUTPUT
 33672                                  ;       None
 33673                                  ;
 33674                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 33675                                  ;       None
 33676                                  ;
 33677                                  ;   HISTORY
 33678                                  ;       Created 16-Nov-1992 by JeffPar
 33679                                  ;
 33680                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33681                                  
 33682                                  set_numlock:
 33683                                          push    ax
 33684                                          push    ds
 33685                                          sub     ax,ax
 33686                                          mov     ds,ax
 33687                                          mov     ax,[es:si]      ; get 1st 2 bytes of value (ON or OF)
 33688                                          cmp     ax,[cs:OnOff+2]	; should we turn it off?
 33689                                          jne	short not_off	; no
 33690                                          and     byte [0417h],~20h ; 0DFh
 33691                                          jmp     short set_done
 33692                                  not_off:
 33693                                          cmp     ax,[cs:OnOff]	; should we turn it on?
 33694                                          stc
 33695                                          jne	short set_done	; no
 33696                                          or      byte [0417h],20h
 33697                                  set_done:
 33698                                          pop     ds
 33699                                          pop     ax
 33700                                          retn
 33701                                  
 33702                                  ; 16/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 33703                                  
 33704                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33705                                  ;
 33706                                  ;   menu_check:  check for presence of menu (and other) configuration blocks
 33707                                  ;
 33708                                  ;   INPUT
 33709                                  ;       CX == "organized" config.sys memory image length
 33710                                  ;    ES:SI -> "organized" config.sys memory image
 33711                                  ;       DS == CS == sysinitseg
 33712                                  ;
 33713                                  ;   OUTPUT
 33714                                  ;       Same as above;  the idea is that menu_check simply transforms
 33715                                  ;       a block-structured config.sys image into a conventional image,
 33716                                  ;       based on the user's block selection and any other boot-time options
 33717                                  ;       the user may have employed...
 33718                                  ;
 33719                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 33720                                  ;       All
 33721                                  ;
 33722                                  ;   NOTES
 33723                                  ;       [count] and [org_count] are set to the new config.sys image length
 33724                                  ;
 33725                                  ;   HISTORY
 33726                                  ;       Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 33727                                  ;
 33728                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33729                                  
 33730                                  menu_check:
 33731                                  
 33732                                  ;   Search for SWITCHES, determine if /N or /F are present;  if so, then
 33733                                  ;   disable clean/interactive boot options
 33734                                  
 33735                                          push    cx              ;
 33736                                          push    si              ;
 33737                                          sub     bx,bx           ; remains ZERO until first block
 33738                                  swchk_loop:                     ;
 33739                                          call    get_char        ; get first char of current line
 33740                                          jc	short swchk_end	; hit eof
 33741                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ;
 33742                                          jne	short swchk_next1 ;
 33743                                          inc     bx              ; remember that we've seen a block
 33744                                          jmp     short swchk_nextline
 33745                                  swchk_next1:                    ;
 33746                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_NUMLOCK
 33747                                          jne	short swchk_next2 ;
 33748                                          or      bx,bx           ; only do NUMLOCK commands that exist
 33749                                          jnz	short swchk_nextline ; before the first block
 33750                                          call    set_numlock     ; REM it out so we don't act on it later, too
 33751                                          mov     byte [es:si-1],CONFIG_REM
 33752                                          jmp     short swchk_nextline
 33753                                  swchk_next2:                    ;
 33754                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_SWITCHES
 33755                                          jne	short swchk_nextline ; this line ain't it
 33756                                  swchk_scan:                     ;
 33757                                          call    get_char        ; look for /N or /F
 33758                                  swchk_scan1:                    ;
 33759                                          cmp     al,LF           ; end of line?
 33760                                          je	short swchk_nextline ; yes
 33761                                          cmp     al,'/'          ; switch-char?
 33762                                          jne	short swchk_scan ; no
 33763                                          call    get_char        ;
 33764                                          and     al,~20h ; 0DFh	; convert to upper case
 33765                                          cmp     al,[swit_n+1]
 33766                                          jne	short swchk_scan2 ; no
 33767                                          or      byte [bDisableUI],1
 33768                                          jmp	short swchk_scan ; continue looking for switches of interest
 33769                                  swchk_scan2:                    ;
 33770                                          cmp     al,[swit_f+1]
 33771                                          jne	short swchk_scan1 ; no
 33772                                          or      byte [bDisableUI],2
 33773                                          jmp     short swchk_scan ; continue looking for switches of interest
 33774                                  swchk_nextline:                 ;
 33775                                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 33776                                          jmp     short swchk_loop ;
 33777                                  swchk_end:                      ;
 33778                                          pop     si              ;
 33779                                          pop     cx              ;
 33780                                  
 33781                                  ;   Do the keyboard tests for clean/interactive boot now, but only if
 33782                                  ;   the DisableUI flag is still clear
 33783                                  
 33784                                          test    byte [bDisableUI],1
 33785                                          jnz	short menu_search
 33786                                  ;
 33787                                  ;   Wait for 2 seconds first, UNLESS the /F bit was set in bDisableUI, or
 33788                                  ;   there is anything at all in the keyboard buffer
 33789                                  ;
 33790                                          call    kbd_read
 33791                                          jnc	short menu_search
 33792                                          jmp	menu_abort
 33793                                  
 33794                                  ;   Search for MENU block;  it is allowed to be anywhere in config.sys
 33795                                  
 33796                                  menu_search:
 33797                                          sub     bx,bx           ; if no MENU, default to zero for no_selection
 33798                                          mov     di,szMenu	;
 33799                                          call    find_block      ; find the MENU block
 33800                                          jnc	short menu_found ;
 33801                                          mov     byte [szBoot],0
 33802                                          jmp	no_selection ; not found
 33803                                  
 33804                                  ;   Process the requested menu color(s)
 33805                                  
 33806                                  menu_color:
 33807                                          push    cx              ;
 33808                                          push    dx              ;
 33809                                          mov     dx,0007h        ; default color setting
 33810                                          call    get_number	; get first number
 33811                                          and     bl,0Fh		; first # is foreground color (for low nibble)
 33812                                          mov     ch,bl           ; save it in CH
 33813                                          and     dl,0F0h         ;
 33814                                          or      dl,bl           ;
 33815                                          call    delim           ; did we hit a delimiter
 33816                                          jne	short check_color ; no, all done
 33817                                          call    get_number	; get next number
 33818                                          and     bl,0Fh		; second # is background color (for high nibble)
 33819                                          mov     dh,bl           ; save it in DH
 33820                                          and     dl,0Fh		;
 33821                                          mov     cl,4            ;
 33822                                          shl     bl,cl           ;
 33823                                          or      dl,bl           ;
 33824                                  check_color:                    ;
 33825                                          cmp     ch,dh           ; are foreground/background the same?
 33826                                          jne	short set_color	; no
 33827                                          xor     dl,08h          ; yes, so modify the fgnd intensity
 33828                                  set_color:
 33829                                          mov     [bMenuColor],dl ;
 33830                                          pop     dx              ;
 33831                                          pop     cx              ;
 33832                                          jmp	menu_nextitem
 33833                                  
 33834                                  ;   Back to our regularly scheduled program (the COLOR and other goop
 33835                                  ;   above is there simply to alleviate short jump problems)
 33836                                  
 33837                                  menu_found:
 33838                                          mov     byte [bDefBlock],1
 33839                                          mov     word [offDefBlock],0
 33840                                          mov     byte [secTimeOut],-1
 33841                                          and     byte [bQueryOpt],~2 ; 0FDh
 33842                                  
 33843                                          call    skip_opt_line   ; skip to next line
 33844                                          sub     dx,dx           ; initialize total block count (0 => none yet)
 33845                                  
 33846                                  ;   Process the menu block now
 33847                                  
 33848                                  menu_process:
 33849                                          call    get_char        ; get first char of current line
 33850                                          jc	short to_menu_getdefault ; could happen if menu block at end (rare)
 33851                                          and     al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; 7Fh
 33852                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ; BEGIN implies END
 33853                                          je	short to_menu_getdefault
 33854                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_SUBMENU
 33855                                          je	short menu_item	; go process sub-menu
 33856                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_MENUITEM
 33857                                          je	short menu_item	; go process menu item
 33858                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_MENUDEFAULT
 33859                                          je	short menu_default ; go process menu default
 33860                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_MENUCOLOR
 33861                                          je	short menu_color ; go process menu color
 33862                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_NUMLOCK
 33863                                          je	short menu_numlock ;
 33864                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_REM   ; allow remarks in menu block
 33865                                          je	short menu_nextitem ;
 33866                                          call    any_delim       ; allow blank lines and such
 33867                                          je	short menu_nextitem ;
 33868                                          stc                     ;
 33869                                          call    print_error     ; non-MENU command!
 33870                                          jmp     short menu_nextitem
 33871                                  menu_numlock:
 33872                                          call    set_numlock
 33873                                          jmp     short menu_nextitem
 33874                                  to_menu_getdefault:
 33875                                          jmp     short menu_getdefault
 33876                                  
 33877                                  ;   Save the offset of the default block name, we'll need it later
 33878                                  
 33879                                  menu_default:
 33880                                          mov     [offDefBlock],si; save address of default block name
 33881                                          cmp     byte [secElapsed],0
 33882                                          jne	short timeout_skip ; secElapsed is only zero for the FIRST menu,
 33883                                          call    skip_token      ; and for subsequent menus IF nothing was typed;
 33884                                          jc	short menu_nextitem ; secElapsed becomes -1 forever as soon as
 33885                                          call    skip_delim      ; something is typed
 33886                                          jc	short menu_nextitem ;
 33887                                          mov     si,bx           ;
 33888                                          call    get_number      ; get number (of seconds for timeout)
 33889                                          cmp     bl,90           ; limit it to a reasonable number
 33890                                          jb	short timeout_ok ; (besides, 99 is the largest # my simple
 33891                                          mov     bl,90           ;  display function can handle)
 33892                                  timeout_ok:                     ;
 33893                                          mov     [secTimeOut],bl ;
 33894                                  timeout_skip:
 33895                                          jmp     short menu_nextitem
 33896                                  
 33897                                  ;   Verify that this is a valid menu item by searching for the named block
 33898                                  
 33899                                  menu_item:
 33900                                          cmp     dl,MAX_MULTI_CONFIG ; have we reached the max # of items yet?
 33901                                          jae	short menu_nextitem ;
 33902                                          mov     di,si           ; DS:DI -> block name to search for
 33903                                          call    srch_block      ;
 33904                                          je	short menu_itemfound ;
 33905                                          stc                     ;
 33906                                          call    print_error     ; print error and pause
 33907                                          jmp     short menu_nextitem ; if not found, ignore this menu item
 33908                                  
 33909                                  ;   srch_block, having succeeded, returns DI -> past the token that it
 33910                                  ;   just matched, which in this case should be a descriptive string; ES:SI
 33911                                  ;   and CX are unmodified
 33912                                  
 33913                                  menu_itemfound:
 33914                                          inc     dx              ; otherwise, increment total block count
 33915                                          mov     bx,dx           ; and use it to index the arrays of offsets
 33916                                          mov	[abBlockType+bx],al
 33917                                          add     bx,bx           ; of recorded block names and descriptions
 33918                                  
 33919                                  ;   There should be a description immediately following the block name on
 33920                                  ;   MENUITEM line; failing that, we'll just use the block name as the
 33921                                  ;   description...
 33922                                  
 33923                                          mov     [aoffBlockName+bx],si
 33924                                          mov     [aoffBlockDesc+bx],si
 33925                                          mov     di,bx           ; skip_delim modifies BX, so stash it in DI
 33926                                          call    skip_token      ;
 33927                                          jc	short menu_nextitem ; hit eol/eof
 33928                                          call    skip_delim      ;
 33929                                          jc	short menu_nextitem ; hit eol/eof
 33930                                          xchg    bx,di           ;
 33931                                          mov     [aoffBlockDesc+bx],di
 33932                                  
 33933                                  menu_nextitem:
 33934                                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 33935                                          jmp     menu_process    ; go back for more lines
 33936                                  
 33937                                  ;   Display menu items now, after determining which one is default
 33938                                  
 33939                                  menu_getdefault:
 33940                                          or      dl,dl           ; where there any valid blocks at all?
 33941                                          jnz	short menu_valid ; yes
 33942                                          sub     bx,bx           ; no, so force autoselect of 0
 33943                                          jmp     menu_autoselect ; (meaning: process common blocks only)
 33944                                  menu_valid:
 33945                                          sub     bx,bx           ;
 33946                                          mov     [bMaxBlock],dl  ; first, record how many blocks we found
 33947                                          mov     di,[offDefBlock];
 33948                                          or      di,di           ; does a default block exist?
 33949                                          jz	short menu_nodefault ; no
 33950                                          inc     bx              ; yes, walk name table, looking for default
 33951                                  menu_chkdefault:
 33952                                          push    bx              ;
 33953                                          add     bx,bx           ;
 33954                                          mov     si,[aoffBlockName+bx]
 33955                                          mov     cx,128          ; arbitrary maximum length of a name
 33956                                          push    ds              ;
 33957                                          push    es              ;
 33958                                          pop     ds              ;
 33959                                          call    comp_names      ; is this block the same as the default?
 33960                                          pop     ds              ;
 33961                                          pop     bx              ;
 33962                                          je	short menu_setdefault ; yes
 33963                                          inc     bx              ;
 33964                                          cmp     bl,[bMaxBlock]  ; all done searching?
 33965                                          jbe	short menu_chkdefault ; not yet
 33966                                  menu_nodefault:
 33967                                          mov     bl,1            ; if no default, force default to #1
 33968                                  menu_setdefault:
 33969                                          mov     [bDefBlock],bl  ; yes, this will be the initial current block
 33970                                  
 33971                                  ;   If the timeout was explicitly set to 0 (or technically, anything that
 33972                                  ;   failed to resolve to a number, like "NONE" or "EAT POTATOES"), then we're
 33973                                  ;   supposed to skip menu display and run with the specified default block;
 33974                                  ;   however, if the user hit Enter prior to boot, thereby requesting fully
 33975                                  ;   INTERACTIVE boot, then we shall display the menu block anyway (though still
 33976                                  ;   with no timeout)
 33977                                  
 33978                                          cmp     byte [secTimeOut],0 ; is timeout zero? (ie, assume default)
